jobDescription: Craft Advertising & Sales Job Description Activision Blizzard Media (ABM) brings innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. This division builds powerful marketing solutions that are embraced by the world’s largest marketers. ABM is seeking a passionate, innovative, and broad-thinking Account Manager to support the Sales team located in Los Angeles, while also collaborating with the Account Management team nationally. This position will offer the right person a great opportunity to work with Account Leads, Digital Agencies and Clients and help them to manage the campaign process from start to finish. You will also be partnering with internal cross-functional teams including Ad Ops, Measurement, and Product Marketing. A can-do attitude is a must! Your day-to-day will be filled with creative problem solving, dynamic campaigns, and operational excellence. Reporting to the Senior Account Manager, your role is responsible for the following: Support West Coast Direct Sales Team Work collaboratively with Sales to provide strategic media plans and ideas to clients based on their objectives Act as the main point of contact for clients and agencies post-sale Establish credible relationships with clients and serve as a trusted consultant to optimize and expand their advertising investment Monitor live campaigns, providing regular reporting, and partner with internal stakeholders on measurement insights in accordance with the client’s KPIs Support International Sales And Expansion Efforts Onboard and support a network of 3rd Party Sales Agents (Resellers) in global markets Coordinate with internal and external teams to craft localized insights and audience narratives for each market Proactively surface opportunities to market ABM in countries abroad (webinars, case studies, research, etc) Facilitate campaign management with internal teams, when applicable Maintain weekly calls and/or regular communication to ensure resellers are supported across sales and marketing endeavors Thorough knowledge of ABM ecosystem - inclusive of product offering, supply mechanics, and measurement efforts Display excellent project management abilities for all activities, ensuring internal and external stakeholders are well informed throughout the entire process Take an active role in identifying key business challenges and developing best practices to address challenges Skills To Create Thrills 3+ years of digital media experience Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills Attention to detail and experience managing operational tasks in a fast-paced environment A strong team player who can support and cover other team members in a proactive, open and collaborative nature Driver of operational efficiency and excellence Ability to articulate complex requirements to achieve results Working knowledge of programmatic execution and understanding of technology, eg. Google Ad Manager, video/mobile media products, audience targeting and the programmatic landscape Experience with Salesforce and/or Datorama are a bonus! “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.” We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics. About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R016882

Craft Data, Analytics & Strategy Job Description Job Description: Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross- platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We are looking for a Measurement Lead in New York to work within our exciting and rapidly growing Ad Sales business. You will work within the Research & Marketing team to help evaluate the impact and success of digital advertiser campaigns and sponsorships across both Activision Blizzard Media’s mobile portfolio and Activision Blizzard’s esports portfolio. You will also work with members of the Research & Marketing team, helping to build insight based marketing collateral, assist in custom research initiatives, and execution and management of digital campaign effectiveness measurement.. You will be a part of a team that spans the globe with hubs in New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago, and London. Your role within Activision Blizzard Media/Key Responsibilities Reporting to the Head of Ad Effectiveness, the Measurement Lead is responsible for the following critical tasks: Partner with internal sales/account management/adops teams, advertisers/agencies, and vendors to assist in the execution and management of digital campaign effectiveness measurement.   Work with research management to evaluate new research tools, data sources, and conduct on-platform primary research studies/projects and test plans. You will be responsible for presenting research findings to internal teams and clients with a solutions-selling approach. Assist in running multiple ad effectiveness research studies and aiding in the process from start to finish including development and execution of campaign measurement plans, survey design, liasoning between internal team members and external vendors and clients, setting up and programming studies, monitoring/analyzing results, building final deliverables with insightful recommendations, and internal/external presentation of results.  Lead the development of any creative best practices and meta-analysis sales collateral to showcase our learnings and expertise in the digital gaming space.  Candidates should be knowledgeable about the advertising industry, passionate about the entertainment business, and have experience with digital measurement.   Candidates must be comfortable using data to develop actionable insights and effectively communicate a story on behalf of advertiser clients. Requirements 5+ years of media research experience, ideally working in a client-facing capacity. Strong experience in campaign measurement. Ideally you will have overseen running multiple ad effectiveness research studies, the execution of campaign measurement plans, survey design, liasoning between internal team members and external vendors and clients, and analysis and presentation of results. Must have experience in vendor management and be comfortable in client-facing settings (measurement overview, consultative meetings, and presentations). Experience ideating, launching, and executing research studies/projects and/or test plans. Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills. Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills. You are detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize, organize and summarize data and produce marketing insights. Great interpersonal skills – able to build and maintain internal and external relationships; client service experience preferred. You are curious about the “why” behind data, and eager to ask questions and learn. Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Psychology, Economics or Social Sciences preferred. About King King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch. We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the company. A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. Making the World Playful Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful! In New York City, the standard base pay range for this role is $76,730 - $113,554 annually. This base pay range is for New York City and is not applicable to other locations. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role are eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed. About King King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta. Job Title AI Engineer - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R011422 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history - and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are seeking a passionate AI Engineer who will work closely with other engineers and content teams to expand our AI systems to create new and exciting experiences for our players. This is a great opportunity to work with a passionate engineering team on the world’s most popular game franchises! What You’ll Be Doing… Work with AI engineering teams to expand our AI technology in order to push the limits of what our AI can currently do Work alongside our design and content teams to develop new AI characters and behaviors Implement, debug and optimize major systems in C/C++ and other languages in the context of a large cross platform codebase Design and implement optimized AI systems To succeed you must have… Excellent C++ programming skills, with knowledge of algorithms and data structures Fluency in 3D math and algebra, related to game programming. Strong design sensibilities and outstanding communication skills. A passion for making video games Solid debugging skills Experience extending an established code base 3+ years of experience in games or real-time AI 1+ shipped games Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math related field We’d love it if you also have… Open world game development experience Expertise in one or more of the following areas: AI systems in a networked environment Animation – blend trees, IK, motion matching AI navigation mesh generation and pathfinding AI controlled vehicles Optimization Experience with scripting languages Console development experience High Moon Studios Founded in 2002, High Moon Studios is an award-winning studio developing for the Call of Duty® franchise, with past development on over 15 titles including Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone, Bungie’s Destiny 2: Forsaken, and Transformers: Fall of Cybertron. We employ more than 170 people in Carlsbad, CA, a seaside city in San Diego County. Our pride is our people and the experiences we have successfully created for our fans. High Moon's talent is comprised of gifted entertainment and technology professionals responsible for some of the most successful games ever made. We have award-winning developers, published artists and specialists recognized as among the best in their fields. Our studio has a history of using innovative techniques designed to boost productivity and product quality, which in turn enhances our studio's quality of life. High Moon Studios is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.highmoonstudios.com. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. High Moon Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Job Title Analytics Engineer Requisition ID R018983 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. This role will collaborate cross-functionally with teams to understand the impact of marketing efforts at the top, middle and bottom of the funnel. You are a curious, technology-minded person with a passion for using data to inform decisions. Your ability to take large amounts of data, and build an informed perspective on how to improve the impact of marketing investments is critical to success in this role. Job Title Team Name: Analytics Internship Requisition ID R017324 Job Description Analytics Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile Must be pursuing a bachelors, masters, or PhD majoring in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related technical field and graduating December 2023 or later. Curious, dedicated, analytical, and excited to play with data. Available for a 12-week internship starting in late May or late June. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Internship Opportunities Machine Learning (Consumer Technology): Leverage data, game APIs, and creative marketing to build an engaging experience for players outside of the console or PC, working on challenging projects that apply your education and critical thinking abilities to have an impact on business initiatives, working on machine learning models, analyzing KPIs, participating in the design and code review process and partnering with other engineers in a collaborative environment. Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture. Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms. Ability to write robust code in Python. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow) and libraries (like scikit-learn). Data Science (Franchise Models): Help develop and operationalize machine learning models that impact Game Operations, Marketing, CRM, and Business Planning. Contribute to the goal of understanding and improving consumer/player experiences. Programming proficiency in Python and/or R. Knowledge of Spark. Knowledge of data systems, relational databases, querying with SQL. Experience with engineering tools and methods (github, unit testing, continuous integration, etc.). Experience with machine learning tools (SciKit-Learn, TensorFlow, etc.). Experience building web frontends (Javascript, JQuery, D3.js, React, etc.). Data Science: Be a core component of the most successful Mobile gaming business through analytical excellence. Be part of a business that moves at breakneck speed and delivers the most engaging experiences to our players and fans. Specialize in one of the following areas: deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer graphics, or recommendation systems. Ability to write robust code in Python. Database querying (e.g., Big Query). Experience building and evaluating machine learning or statistical models. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow) and libraries (like scikit-learn). Proficient in object-oriented programming. Data Analytics: Be a core component of the most successful Mobile gaming business by working closely with internal teams across Product, Production, User Acquisition, Development, Design, Leadership, and other decision-makers on our games to deliver critical insights to support strategic business and marketing decisions.  Majoring or taking coursework in a related field (business intelligence, analytics, etc.). Familiarity with query languages (i.e. SQL) or enterprise data visualization software (i.e. Tableau). Familiarity with gaming, digital, entertainment industries, or scientific research fields. Your Mission   Explore game or player data in various contexts. Use modern data science methods to analyze data. Visualize and interpret analytical results. Spend a summer focusing on a meaningful project that directly impacts game development while having an unparalleled experience. Participate in learning and development tech talks to understand how our employees come together to launch AAA games. Our World  Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. jobTitle: Animation Director - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Animation Director - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R015786 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As an Animation Director, you will be expected to lead the Animation team by Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities driving, maintaining and creating high fidelity animations that align to our pursuit of ultimate player immersion. This Immersion is achieved by supporting the Narrative and Gameplay needs of our games, using Run-Time Action Cinematics, 1st and 3rd Person Gameplay and AI Animations. The ability to lead the team to identify and execute the “feel” the project dictates, is the prime directive. You will be joining our Passionate and Talented team of developers who, continue pushing our standards of quality and drive, that echoes throughout our studio. If you’re looking to contribute to the vision and direction of one of the most successful franchises in video game history, then Infinity Ward is the place for you. Work with Infinity Ward’s Studio Animation Director to manage, maintain, and support the animation style that is established for the project. Work with all Animation Directors, Leads and Producers of the project, ensuring Animation is created with the highest quality and delivered with the highest efficiency. Use Motion Capture and Hand-Keyed Techniques to create high-fidelity Run-Time Action Cinematics, 1st and 3rd Person Gameplay and AI Animations to convey the Narrative and Gameplay needs of the game. Implement and maintain Animations using Proprietary Tools within our Game Engine. Communicate with internal and external depts to ensure the highest collaborative, qualitative and efficient completion of team tasks Player Profile Minimum Requirements +8 years Leading Animation for Game Development An extreme passion for Animation, video games, and the entertainment it inspires and draws from An exceptional ability for Hand-Keyed Animation Excellent Maya Animation experience Understand all the roles within the Animation department Have a good understanding of the technology used in game design and development, its capabilities and limitations Capable of taking animation systems from concept to completion Can build good working relationships with other departments Has excellent communication skills, including tact and diplomacy We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Job Title Animation Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R015196 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a talented engineer with a passion for gameplay to join our team and be a key contributor in developing our technology to bring our future titles to life. As an Animation Engineer you will be working on developing the Call of Duty animation system used in our future titles. You will be working with engineers across multiple time zones and on technology that will be used by multiple games. You will be expected to drive the long term vision and detail the roadmap of the animation system for the years to come. What You’ll Do… Contribute to the animation capabilities and tooling for the Call of Duty game engine Support game teams and their content creators to build new games Collaborate with content creators and gameplay teams to learn and understand their needs Build positive relationships with animation teams across the Call of Duty franchise Actively and enthusiastically seek out help, code reviews, and advice To succeed you should have… The ability to understand and write effective C++ code A strong understanding of the fundamentals of 3D animation Communication skills for sharing ideas clearly, learning from others, and giving meaningful feedback Strong mathematics skills, including proficiency with trigonometry, and linear algebra Experience collaborating with content creators and technical artists Experience shipping AAA titles You’re a great fit if your philosophy is to… Commit to doing things the right way, even when it's difficult Value diversity and differences in others Ensure discussions include every voice that has something to say Enable technology that makes games accessible to every person who wants to play them Strive to learn from the knowledge and experiences of those around you We’d love it if you also have… Experience with building tools for content creators Familiarity with animation concerns in a multiplayer game environment Experience working with or contributing to in-house engine development Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://hub.activisionblizzard.com/s/us-benefits R015196

Proficient in a 3D software package like Maya or Max. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Gameplay Animator: Bring our game to life! You will work with a mentor to create exceptional key-frame animations for characters, environments, and objects. You’ll have opportunities to work with amazing character artists, riggers, and designers to take your animation from Maya to game. Proficient in Autodesk Maya…But a strong desire to learn beyond Maya. Exceptional communications skills. Your Mission Work with artist and animators on one of Activision's award-winning franchises.   Help make new characters, environments, concepts, animations, UI, and/or armor. Job Title Animation Internship - Treyarch Requisition ID R018399 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a hardworking and passionate Animation Intern with an interest in Viewmodel Animation to join our ranks! In this role you will be work with a team of industry veterans who will help hone and guide your animation skills for 1st person gameplay and performances in working on the Call of Duty franchise, where you'll use hand key animation techniques and implement animation content into the game. 1st person animation is the most essential form of animation for gameplay in Call of Duty, and this opportunity will teach you the importance of balancing the art of animation with the needs of gameplay design, and to learn the in’s and out’s of our 1st person animation pipeline. Our ideal candidate is someone passionate about animation, and who possesses a good understanding of animation fundamentals, hand key animation, and strives to make the gameplay experience fun for the end-user. What You’ll Do… Work directly with your Animation Intern Director to hone your craft of creating 1st person performances that adheres to animation fundamentals, while also being compelling, visceral, and a complement to the gameplay design needs of a AAA title Learn the workflow process for creating dynamic and high-quality motions to be applied to in-game abilities for great player experiences and interaction with their characters Through guidance and tutoring, acquire the knowledge of our gameplay animation pipeline, the way animations are technically processed, and implemented into the game engine Study the standard techniques of AAA gameplay animation Become efficient with industry standard applications like Maya, Motion Builder, Perforce, and other programs that is used across many studios To succeed you should have… Proficiency in Autodesk Maya An Animation Demo reel demonstrating a proficiency in 1st person viewmodel animation. Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, a positive attitude and an eagerness to learn and expand your arsenal of skills in gameplay animation A passion for games with an ability to analyze and recognize competitive products for their strengths and weaknesses We’d love it if you also… Are a graduating Senior or Post-Graduate (up to 1 year) student, majoring in Fine Arts, Visual Art, or Computer Animation We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We expect to be back in office for our summer 2023 internship and successful candidates will be expected to relocate and be onsite in Los Angeles for the duration of it. Treyarch will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Job Title Animator, Multiplayer -Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R017362 Job Description Your Platform: Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As an Animator, Multiplayer, you will become part of a tight-knit team that prides itself on creating in-game and cinematic animations that are sophisticated and believable. Working with the department lead, you will receive shot assignments or animation tasks that contribute to furthering understanding of character and/or action and advance the emotional and gameplay goals of the project. Completing your work will require you to build relationships with many production disciplines, such as Design, Engineering, and Environment, as you all collaborate to achieve the best visual and narrative results for each game. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Use traditional animation fundamentals to craft game motions that range from stylized to hyper-realistic. Demonstrate a strong understanding of camera animation and cinematic framing, as well as shot continuity and facial animation. Respond well to feedback and be willing to iterate multiple times to achieve the polish level we need to deliver AAA titles. Troubleshoot tool implementations and spearhead workflow improvements in order to increase the efficiency and creativity of the team. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Shipped at least 1 game as a gameplay animator Familiarity with the animation integration process and animation state machines Knowledge of Cinematic and Motion Capture Editing and cleanup Strong animation fundamentals with a focus on human movement Ability to adapt to new tools and tech Excellent skills animating in the Maya environment Strong problem-solving skills both technical and cross-department Ability to think philosophically about character movement Extra Points An understanding of character creation (modeling, texturing, and rigging) is a bonus. An interest in participating in live previs shoots to help clarify tone, choreography, and pacing for mocap actors Ability to mentor Junior Animators We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Animator - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R017072 Job Description Your Platform Toys for Bob, a collaborative team of stellar individuals that have inspired love, joy, and laughter through epic AAA entertainment for more than 30 years, is open to remote work! Our passion for developing award-winning games with diverse genres includes the Crash Bandicoot®, Call of Duty®, Overwatch®, Spyro®, Skylanders®, and Tony Hawk® franchises. We are constantly evolving and support our growing employees to be as innovative as they can be. Toys for Bob’s experienced developers are looking for creative individuals ready to take on exciting and new projects. Join us! Toys for Bob is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, visit us at www.toysforbob.com and @ToysForBob on Twitter. Your Mission As an Animator, you will create and edit photorealistic 1st and 3rd-person animations for COD projects. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of animation principles and can problem solve with riggers and technical designers. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work directly with the Lead, Sr. Animators, and Designers to identify and implement the animation needs of the game. Plan, animate, implement and support complex animations. Build great animation using motion capture data or making original work through keyframe animation. Collaborate effectively with other teams, including art, design, and audio. Manage day-to-day development issues, identify problems, and drive creative solutions to fix them. Own animation sets and/or scenes. Implement and maintain animation assets delivered by outsourcing. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 3 - 5 years of animation experience in the game industry. Broad knowledge of gameplay and cinematic keyframe animation. Knowledge of Motion Capture Editing and cleanup. You are self-motivated, open to learning and expanding your knowledge. Excellent communication skills, time management, and work ethic. Experience with Maya. Bonus Experience Experience with facial animation. Experience animating non-humanoid characters. Experience with cinematic layout and animation. Passion for first-person shooters. Experience creating and editing stylized 1st and 3rd person animations. jobTitle: Art Asset Production Coordinator- Raven Software
jobDescription: Job Title Art Asset Production Coordinator- Raven Software Requisition ID R019027 Job Description Your Mission As an Art Asset Production Coordinator at Raven Software, you will interface directly with Producers, Artists, & QA at Raven and across the wider Activision umbrella. A qualified Coordinator is organized, professional, personable, courteous, hard- working, an effective communicator and loves working with people. This role is a junior level position for aspiring art focused producers. The ideal candidate knows their way around production tools such as Shotgrid and JIRA. This is an exciting opportunity to join an award-winning video game developer, and work with some of the best gaming talent in the world! General Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Legal Funnel- Main POC for Raven interfacing with our legal team for art approvals. Preemptive legal updates- Providing guidance and direction to teams that are creating new content on how assets should be constructed from the start to avoid legal issues. Safe Branding/Graphics- Working with legal to get graphics/names approved. Creating tickets, providing updates to dev team when legal requests changes, updating legal when changes have been made. Real Branding/Real People- Working with legal to get approval to use real world people, real world branding, IP’s outside of our own. Asset Approval- Working with legal to get new/ported assets approved. Creating tickets, providing updates to dev team when legal requests changes, updating legal when changes have been made. DEI Funnel- Main POC for all issues concerning DEI. Assisting in the vetting of assets that could be sensitive to the call of duty brand. Asset Approval- Working with DEI to get sensitive assets vetted and approved. Providing context and updates to team when updates are expected to help the team work towards better practices for the future Theme Vetting/Approval- Taking new themes, game modes, maps, etc and getting them vetted by the DEI team to ensuring sensitivities are considered. Script/Narrative Approval- Taking narrative and scripts and getting them vetted by the DEI team to identify language, themes, locations, events that could pose concerns. Localization (LOCS)- Main POC for issues concerning LOCS. Sitting in meetings, compiling meeting notes, working with asset team on translations. Regional sensitivities Translations (Scripts, Assets/Graphics, Subtitles) Localized builds/bugs Regional builds spin-offs- Working with localization to ensure that the regional and localized changes for region specific skus are functioning. Working with the LOCS team to resolve any issues. And Asset spin-offs Player Profile Familiarity with Call of Duty & Warzone products and associated content types Adaptive planner and problem solver Effective communicator, verbally, visually, and in explicit written form. Works well in a fast-paced and pressure packed environment Solid time management skills Ability to multitask and prioritize competing tasks Ask good questions Understands the basics of game development and production Passion for learning and expanding knowledge Professional, respectful, approachable personality Exhibits self-awareness and emotional maturity Extra Points Proficiency with the use of production tracking tools such as Shotgrid / JIRA We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title Art Director Requisition ID R018583 Job Description Project: WarZone Reporting To: Art Department Director Department: Art Location: Madison, Wisconsin Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to define the inspirational aesthetics and art behind the immersive visuals and distinctive experiences that define WarZone and the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. As a leader you are a motivational catalyst for the art team. As an artist, you will help define the look and quality of the COD style. You have the flexible mindset and personality essential for collaboration with some of the most talented and passionate developers in the industry. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated teammate to help tell our story. You Will… Collaborate with team leadership to envision and refine epic visual content for world-class WarZone player experiences. Be an ambassador for the studio and Art department by collaborating with and maintaining good relationships with all other departments, ATVI studios, and vendors. Primary driver and guide who oversees external concept assignments, define workflow and development stages, review work and provide feedback. Partner and coordinate with internal and external partners to assess multi-studio development contributions to WarZone. Personally generate supportive visual materials for the team in the form of reference, style guides, mood boards, storyboards, or concept as needed. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Inspire and mentor fellow artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and attitude. Encourage artists to thrive on open and welcome constructive criticism. Contribute creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 3+ total years in the games industry working in an artist capacity, with at least 1 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. 2+ total years in the games industry working in an art director or concept director capacity, including the tasking of concept art, providing feedback directly to concept artists regarding work in progress, and ensuring quality concept outcomes in support of prop or environment artists Passionate and egoless attitude that welcomes feedback and criticism, and enjoys working in a collaborative, iterative, and agile process. Strong artistic skills including proportions, perspective, rendering light on form, value, composition, storytelling, and color theory regarding environments, architectural forms, and graphic design. Strong knowledge of digital image creation and editing software. Impressive communication and strong problem-solving skills. Solid understanding of game art with ability to explore a wide variety of ideas that push the Call of Duty style. Strong portfolio demonstrating focus and commitment to concept art of realistically styled subject matter and a demonstrated proficiency in traditional art skills and digital painting; ideally demonstrating the creative process from dynamic sketching to refined renders. Basic 3D experience in game engine and modeling software; familiarity with game engines sufficient to browse in-engine content (materials, models, etc). Content organization and documentation skills including file structures, content in applications and workflows. About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. jobTitle: Art Specialist - Vista Periphery - Infinity Ward
jobDescription: Job Title Art Specialist - Vista Periphery - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R017631 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As an Art Specialist (Vista Periphery) you will create photorealistic and game-ready Vista/Periphery elements. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Tackle general art disciplines in terrain, structure, props and foliage for Vista substitutes. Lead by example through industry high level content. Good judgement for optimal texture resolution for distanced elements. Work revisions are due to direction rather than quality. Plan and prioritize tasks to ensure best possible results in pre-production. Possess a high level of ownership, creativity and independence; requiring little oversight. Proactively help troubleshoot and fix content problems. Evaluate and help solve performance concerns. Ability to mentor others as needed within the environment team. Create documentation of processes for others to follow as needed. Player Profile Experience 6+ years of world building experience with an industry leading level editor: UE4, Unity, etc. Knowledge & Skills Advanced experience with terrain and landscape generators. World Machine, World Creator or similar software. Advanced Vista and Periphery Art skills; Creating vast and detailed photorealistic landscapes. Sensitivity to game art budgets with strong understanding of silhouette and composition. Strong foundational Art skills; Understanding of composition, form, color and light in relation to crafting environments. Strong narrative and environmental story telling skills with regards to set dressing and world building. Advanced knowledge of physically based material workflows and shaders. Advanced skill in: Max or Maya, Blender, Photoshop and similar software. Key Attributes Self-motivated, independent, and proven ability to self-manage and meet deadlines. Extra Points Drone Photogrammetry experience a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title Artist, Game Capture Requisition ID R013836 Job Description YOUR MISSION Work as an Artist and hone the skills that require you to run a capture session. You will help support capture directors with capture sessions, and shoot a second camera on most shoots. In addition, you will help lead the charge on the game engine and editor workflow. The below list is not exhaustive or exclusive, we don't expect every applicant to hit every item here. Above all we are looking for unique creative voices from varied backgrounds to help our work truly stand out, so if you have incredible visual ideas and can shape them to our brand’s needs apply today! Daily Responsibilities This role includes but is not limited to the following tasks/duties: Your duties will focus on being a second camera on smaller group shoots, writing out shot lists, and taking point on short form social content and other non group capture work. Use the proprietary game engine and game editor toolset to create unique and compelling scenarios and cinematic assets for our videos. Help with the research and development of new camera tools and capture processes. Do some editorial work as required and help to make and manage footage selections. Work with various game debug systems and be able to troubleshoot common build & capture issues. Troubleshoot technical issues, including builds, PC workstations, dev kits etc. Fill in as camera operator, when the lead capture director is unavailable. Manage builds and communicate with other teams to troubleshoot issues. DESIRED Skills Requires an understanding of cinematography (composition, lighting, camera movement etc…). Knowledge of game engine animation and/or camera sequencing tools such as Unreal Sequencer, Unity Cinemachine or other similar proprietary tools. Comfortable working in Premiere Pro or other video editing programs. Ability to multitask while maintaining professionalism and composure while working under tight deadlines. Focused, good listener and able to take constructive criticism. Strong technical and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication skills. Video game industry or agency game capture experience is a plus. A passion for film and other cinematic media. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent work experience preferred. 2 Years capture experience at a video game company or external agency preferred. PLUSES Passionate gamer on next-gen platforms and PCs, with a focus on Call of Duty/other Activision titles Real world experience in cinematography or photography Knowledge of game modding or machinima style work Basic Familiarity with 3D design programs such as c4D, Maya or Blender Understanding of game development, the full cycles and processes behind how a game is made Familiarity with the motion capture process An interest in virtual production We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. jobDescription: Job Title Associate Capture Team Lead Requisition ID R018743 Job Description As a part of Marketing Creative at Activision, you will lead the capture team to create industry leading game capture and help guide and teach the next generation of game capture directors. You will be responsible for helping your team hone the skills they need to be expert photographers, cinematographers and directors, and be elevating the bar on what is possible in the realm of game capture across Call of Duty® and other Activision titles. This is a people manager focused role, a deep understanding of photography is required alongside a passion for helping train and mentor others in their careers. The below list is not exhaustive or exclusive, we don't expect every applicant to hit every item here. Above all we are looking for unique creative voices from varied backgrounds to help our work truly stand out, so if you have incredible visual ideas and can shape them to our brand’s needs apply today! Daily Responsibilities Working closely with our Capture Team Lead you will manage and train a team of game capture artists across both video and screenshots disciplines with a focus on virtual photography, helping to elevate the team’s understanding of photography techniques and composition in virtual environments. Oversee screenshots requests and give critical feedback, working with the ACD to ensure the creative briefs are being met and presenting the work to stakeholders as needed Provide regular 1 on 1’s with the artists to provide feedback and mentoring and conduct employee reviews and assessments to help grow our artists careers Assist with hiring and onboarding of new artists Document and maintain capture processes and training materials, providing a robust onboarding and training program Seek out learning opportunities for the team that help inspire and elevate their work Collaborate with Creative Leads, ACD’s and Story team on creative concepts and take point on projects as needed Help with the research and development of new in-game camera tools and capture processes, and working with our game studios to implement them Work with proprietary debug tools and troubleshoot technical issues, including builds, PC workstations, console dev kits, etc. Educate and advocate across the org on what game capture best practices are and our team’s capabilities DESIRED SKILL SET An expert understanding of photography (composition, lighting, camera movement, etc…), able to create breathtaking cinematic captures in virtual environments. Experience with a wide range of photography techniques and mediums Expert knowledge of the Adobe Suite, with a focus on Photoshop. Management/team leadership experience Proven experience working with video game graphics, textures, lighting, and tools Comfortable working in a game editor and with animation and/or camera sequencing tools such as Unreal Sequencer, Unity Cinemachine or other similar proprietary software Strong technical and troubleshooting skills with both PC and consoles Able to effectively plan complicated action sequences involving the blocking of action and correct camera placement A passion for photography, film and other cinematic media. Strong technical and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication skills. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent work experience. PLUSES Video game industry or agency game capture experience. Avid gamer on next-gen platforms and PCs, with a focus on Call of Duty/FPS titles. Real-world experience in cinematography or photography. Knowledge and understanding of VFX/3D design programs such as After Effects, C4D, Maya, or Blender. Understanding of game development, the full cycles, and processes behind how a game is made Knowledge of the motion capture process. Interest in virtual production. Job Title Associate Creative Director Requisition ID R017931 Job Description OUR WORLD Activision Blizzard, Inc., a member of the S&P 500, is the world’s most successful standalone interactive entertainment company. We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world through franchises including Activisionʹs Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzardʹs World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and Kingʹs Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™. The company is one of the Fortune ʺ100 Best Companies to Work For®ʺ. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, Activision Blizzard has operations throughout the world, and its games are played in 196 countries. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the company’s website, www.activisionblizzard.com YOUR MISSION As an ACD on the Marketing Creative CoD Video Team, you will operate as a creative and operational leader for a team of leads and artists managing full creative strategy of industry leading video content. You will concept high-quality media content and campaigns, lead the pitch, and guide your team through production while providing positive and constructive feedback to seasoned creatives. You are a creative partner with our Marketing and Studio teams, working closely together to tailor all assets from a 10-foot or 10,000-foot view to help build creative that pushes the boundaries of the Call of Duty brand, while delivering signature AAA content for our players. Your Responsibilities Collaborate with the team to develop and deliver top-quality creative for all aspects of marketing campaigns – Video, Design, Motion Graphics, and any other evolving areas of the digital landscape. Ability to concept and pitch full media campaigns to senior partners and leadership while maintaining continuity across multiple types of executions. Oversee full production of assets, while providing creative direction and insight at all levels of creative. Lead by example and with positive influence a team of leads and artists that are both full-time and contract. Ensure industry leading quality through effective creative direction and feedback. Exercise critical thinking and poise under aggressive timelines, showing confidence in the ability to adapt creative when the scope of a project needs to shift. Ability to interpret business and analytical insights and adapt them to creative to meet Marketing goals and critical KPIs. Foster and maintain healthy cross-functional relationships with Marketing, Studios, and any other internal teams that require support for art asset generation either with us or externally. PLAYER PROFILE Creative leader with experience leading full video media campaigns with ranging multiple assets types and points of distribution, from digital to broadcast. Managed full trailer production including conepting, pitching, resource management and client interaction. Expert in editing with Adobe Premiere CC, with intermediate experience and knowledge in After Effects, Photoshop, and other relevant editorial software and plugins. Experience leading long and short from trailer production including conepting, pitching, resource management and client interaction. Passion for gaming with a deep knowledge of Call of Duty and the first-person genre. Strong creative ideation with a solutions-oriented mentality when under pressure. Passion for the craft with a willingness to contribute at all stages of production. Portfolio demonstrating original, high-quality video and media campaign work. 5+ years of experience in the video game industry leading equivalent forms of assets at either internal/external marketing services or creative agencies. 3+ years of management experience overseeing multiple levels of creatives. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent experience preferred. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Job Title Associate Lead Level Designer Requisition ID R014958 Job Description Your Mission Working with the Lead Level Designer, your mission is to inspire, mentor, and lead a portion of the level design team towards creating highly tuned player-first experiences that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You will be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. You will provide your team with guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Our Associate Lead Designers are role-models that not only manage the team through challenge and change, but also build up individuals into highly engaged, efficient, and effective teammates. You must thrive in a challenging and often ambiguous environment. An agile and flexible mindset is also necessary since this position actively partners with a variety of internal and external partners. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated leader to help tell our story. You will… Collaborate with the Lead Level Designer and Creative Directors to deliver world-class player experiences. Manage, supervise, and mentor a group of Level Designers. Provide your team with guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Research subject matter relating to objectives to ensure an authentic experience. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently execute high-level direction. Clearly and effectively pitch designs and features using multimedia tools. Work in Radiant to create play-spaces that are engaging and immersive. Assist in defining team goals, action plans, and schedules for the project. Be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. Lead, task, mentor and conduct one-to-one meetings with other Level Designers. Provide your team with guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Play builds of games in-progress and provide concise and prioritized feedback to both internal teams and external partners. Interface with other teams to ensure level requirements and plans are understood. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Possess a comprehensive understanding of the design process spanning all facets of the game. Work closely with our user-testing teams during play-balancing to provide expert feedback. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 6+ total years in the games industry working in a level design capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. 2+ years as a Lead Level Designer, with at least 2 shipped titles as a Lead Level Designer. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Rock-solid communication skills. Strong understanding of geometry building, flow, and layout. Solid understanding of level design with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Strong problem-solving skills. Hunger for gaming (especially online) with a broad range of game experience. Extra Points Profound understanding of the Call of Duty franchise and Warzone. Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the F2P games space. Prior experience working on a games-as-a-service product. Experience with visual software (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.). Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Job Title Associate Lighting Artist - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R010109 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. Assist in the documentation and communication of technical and process guidelines for lighting creation and implementation Player Profile Minimum Requirements 1-3 years industry experience with at least 1 title shipped on XBOX\PS4 platforms Proven ability to produce compelling visuals through lighting on these platforms, showcased in a portfolio demonstrating considerable range of experience with lighting of environments, characters and cinematics Proactive, self-motivated, and results-oriented; able to translate visual reference or concept effectively into the game without direct supervision Expertise in development & implementation of lighting systems and post-process effects Excellent understanding of color and color theory, space, material and light in relation to their application in games Excellent understanding of game engines, tools, pipelines and development processes Able to collaborate with the team leads to achieve solutions that work for all disciplines Open to feedback but also possessing an excellent capacity to solve creative and technical problems, and present a compelling vision Ability to research and develop lighting techniques; envision or address tools needs, report and solve bugs Proficiency with color grading and shader development Digital matte painting experience; skybox generation through digital matte painting techniques and/or procedural tools, such as Vue Unreal experience preferred Knowledge of Maya, Materials, and scripting a plus We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. jobTitle: Associate Manager, Global Experiential Marketing – Call of Duty
jobDescription: Job Title Associate Manager, Global Experiential Marketing – Call of Duty Requisition ID R018961 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously disrupted the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. With a history of delivering iconic game changers -- like Pitfall®, Tony Hawk®, Guitar Hero®, Crash Bandicoot™, Skylanders™ and Call of Duty® -- our obsession is delighting our players around the globe. Focused and committed to innovation, we consistently deliver the most beloved, engaging and successful entertainment. And while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a passionate, dedicated and diverse team of people producing greatness together. So, if you’re interested in our biggest priority, it’s our people. We’re currently driving the next era for our company and community by creating amazing experiences for fans and continuing to make Activision an inclusive place where everyone can thrive. Join us, make history. To learn more, check us out at www.activision.com, https://blog.activision.com or @Activision on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Your Mission As an Associate Manager on the Global Experiential Marketing team, you will be a contributing part of bringing experiential marketing activations to life (physically and digitally) for both mainline and live ops Call of Duty campaigns. You are a self-starter able to influence cross-functional teams, be an evangelist for the brand, and a voice of the consumer. Responsibilities For The Role Experiential and Culture Expert – Develop expert understanding of competitive trends across gaming, entertainment, culture, and event industries. Be a part of bringing big and new ideas to the table and collaboratively build on others’ concepts that deliver engagement and create a passion for our brand. Share your passion for storytelling. Project Management – Assist Experiential Marketing team in creating and managing project management tools for all events including: workback schedules; RASCIs; asset trackers; budget trackers; etc. Create event status decks and recap decks and feel comfortable presenting to cross-functional teams. Coordinate and own specific event elements including, but not limited to press and influencer programs; travel, hospitality & gifting; and hands-on gameplay executions. Agency & Vendor Management – Confident and comfortable managing day to day agency/vendor communication, as assigned. Based on your experience, provide an ideal list of vendors and suppliers who can be utilized for gifting, production, and support. Trafficking and Coordination – Manage trafficking of invoices, new vendor set-ups, contract requests and SOWs within internal channels (e.g., legal, finance, GIS, IT). Manage Event Tracker and lead Cross Functional event meetings. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree 3+ years experience in brand marketing, live or digital event production Demonstrated experience in project management with the ability to work across multiple teams and timelines Passion for gaming, cultural trends and events When safe and appropriate to do so again, travel may be required Strong analytical, verbal, written and presentation skills Proven track record of managing high pressure situations and exuding confidence Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills Results oriented, collaborative problem-solver, and self-motivated Well organized, detail oriented and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment Proficient using the latest versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Keynote, Slack, SharePoint, Google Docs, Zoom, PC and Mac We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Associate Mobile Security Engineer Requisition ID R018682 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland and Japan. This role is expected to begin and continue as a remote position or an interim remote position if desired. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers are action-oriented and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As an Associate Mobile Security Engineer, you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a rapidly changing threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and quick reaction to emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming, analysis, and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an agile team of security experts, you are expected to be a subject matter expert. You will be working directly on game integrity in addition of our overall mobile security capabilities. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of mobile game features, ensuring known exploits are mitigated and potential threats are addressed. Work closely within the security team to identify the best course of action to proactively protect game features and implement countermeasures. Identify emerging threats, build remedial plans, and implement countermeasures in a timely manner; monitoring and measuring effectiveness of those efforts. Be a priority resource, working side-by-side with game engineers. Perform R&D into both new mobile security techniques and technologies, building a toolbox of robust capabilities. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Familiarity with reverse engineering and advanced debugging. Ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Familiarity with malware detection methods. Familiarity with mobile app stores and mobile applications distribution processes. Extensive knowledge of iOS and/or Android operating systems. Strong Java and/or Objective C development skills on mobile titles. Understanding of assembly code and lower-level iOS and/or Android operating systems. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Understanding of source control best practices, particularly hands-on knowledge of Perforce. Knowledge of social engineering Knowledge of malware analysis Knowledge of industry best practices for protecting applications and writing secure code. Security-oriented role on previously published games or apps. Working as part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Knowledge of networking protocols at low (TCP/IP, UDP) and high level (HTTP). Knowledge of packet capture techniques and interception proxies. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide!
