Craft Job Description: JOB TITLE: Capture Team Lead DEPARTMENT: Marketing Creative REPORTING TO: Associate Creative Director, Capture LOCATION: Santa Monica, California YOUR MISSION As a part of Marketing Creative at Activision, you will lead the capture team to create industry leading game capture and help guide and teach the next generation of game capture directors. You will be responsible for helping your team hone the skills they need to be expert cinematographers and directors, and be elevating the bar on what is possible in the realm of game capture across Call of Duty® and other Activision titles. The below list is not exhaustive or exclusive, we don't expect every applicant to hit every item here. Above all we are looking for unique creative voices from varied backgrounds to help our work truly stand out, so if you have incredible visual ideas and can shape them to our brand’s needs apply today! Daily Responsibilities Lead and manage a team of game capture artists and capture directors Collaborate with Creative Leads, Editors, and ACD’s on creative concepts and overall video direction across multiple projects and game titles. Direct video projects for Game Capture Communicate with our partners regarding their feedback, working closely with our Producers, Designers, Editors, and other Capture Artists to ensure clarity and understanding. Provide training, mentoring, and feedback to our team of artists. Help with the research and development of new in-game camera tools and capture processes. Light editorial work as required and help to make and manage footage selections. Work with proprietary debug tools and troubleshoot technical issues, including builds, PC workstations, console dev kits, etc. Manage all equipment, hardware, and software in our capture lab Explore creative new ways to shoot game content Work with the scheduling team to properly delegate work out to your team Educate and advocate across the org on what game capture standard processes are and our team’s capabilities Desired Skills An expert understanding of cinematography (composition, lighting, camera movement, etc…), able to create breathtaking cinematic capture in virtual environments. Experience with directing a room of up to 20+ capture techs at one time whilst running the main camera. Proven experience working with video game graphics, textures, lighting, and tools Strong technical and troubleshooting skills with both PC and consoles Able to effectively plan complicated action sequences involving the blocking and movement of player characters and cameras. Deep understanding of the editing process and how to plan shots that flow together for an edit. Able to learn new tools and processes quickly, often proprietary technology with no manuals included. Knowledge of Premiere Pro or other video editing programs. A passion for film and other cinematic media. Strong technical and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication skills. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent work experience. PLUSES Video game industry or agency game capture experience. Experience working in a game editor environment using animation and/or camera sequencing tools such as Unreal Sequencer, Unity Cinemachine, or other similar proprietary tools. Avid gamer on next-gen platforms and PCs, with a focus on Call of Duty/FPS titles. Real-world experience in cinematography or photography. Knowledge of game modding or machinima workflows. Knowledge and understanding of VFX/3D design programs such as After Effects, C4D, Maya, or Blender. Understanding of game development, the full cycles, and processes behind how a game is made Knowledge of the motion capture process. Interest in virtual production. Experience working in the video game industry Having management/team lead experience We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. COVID-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position but may transition to working in the office eventually. OUR WORLD Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the company’s website, www.activisionblizzard.com Our ability to build immersive and innovative worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R014912

Job Title Creative Team Lead, Mobile UA Requisition ID R018573 Job Description Your mission As a Creative Lead (Video) you will coordinate all Call of Duty & Warzone video assets crafted for Marketing and Studio teams that are produced by Marketing Creative. This role acts both as a project manager and people manager, responsible for leading artists to help produce industry-leading content with a focus on trailers, paid social and organic social media assets. You will be supervising the creation and maintaining of campaign-level creative across multiple asset types and customer groups. You are also a thought-leader, setting an example for the entire creative team while providing guidance, mentorship, and unlocking new creative techniques across subject areas and workflows to push creative forward. This position reports into the Associate Creative Director, Video and will work closely with 3D artists (Cinema 4D, Unreal Engine), editors, capture directors, sound designers, motion graphic artists, designers, copywriters, internal collaborators and external partners. Your Responsibilities Provide creative direction on trailers and video content ranging across fields of gameplay capture, editorial, sound design, music editing, and post FXs. Collaborate closely with multiple leads on creative strategy for upcoming campaigns. Partner with other leads and creative producers to strategize content. Ability to concept, develop, and pitch full media campaigns while maintaining continuity across multiple types of executions. Write, review, and revise outlines, storyboards, shot lists, and other video-supporting documentation. Lead by example and with positive influence a team of leads and artists that are both full-time and contract. Fully run projects from start to finish and delegate efficiently. Ensure industry-leading quality through effective creative direction and hands-on contribution. Experience leading creative teams with the ability to give clear and effective feedback. Encourage as a leader through peer influence and example-setting. Player profile Authority in editing with Adobe Premiere CC, with intermediate to advanced knowledge in After Effects. Supporting knowledge in Photoshop, and other relevant editorial software and plugins. Foundational knowledge of full film or game trailer production, including cinematography, game-capture, sound design, and motion graphics. Experience leading long and short from trailer production including concepting, pitching, resource management and client interaction. Ability to work under tight time constraints and prioritize projects with a high degree of autonomy. Support producers, account coordinators, and other artists in all aspects of production. Passion for gaming with a deep knowledge of Call of Duty & Warzone and the first-person genre as well as a passion for the craft with a willingness to chip in at all stages of production. Open to feedback, good listener, and able to give and take creative critique. Strong creative conceptualization with a solutions focused demeanor. Portfolio demonstrating original, high-quality video and media campaign work - 3D characters a plus. 5+ years of professional experience in the gaming entertainment industry, leading equivalent forms of assets at either internal/external marketing services or creative agencies. 2+ years of management experience coordinating creatives. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent experience preferred. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. About Activision Blizzard Our mission, to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment has never been more important. Through communities rooted in our video game franchises we enable hundreds of millions of people to experience happiness, thrill and achievement. We enable social connections through the lens of fun, and we foster purpose and a sense of accomplishment through healthy competition. Like sport, but with greater accessibility, our players can find purpose and meaning through competitive gaming. Video games, unlike any other social or entertainment media, have the ability to break down the barriers that can inhibit tolerance and understanding. Celebrating diversity is at the core of our culture and ensures we can build games for players of a diverse set of backgrounds in the 190 countries our games are played. As a member of the Fortune 500 and as a component company of the S&P 500, we have an outstanding track record of delivering superior shareholder returns for over 30 years. jobDescription: Job Title Digital Marketing Coordinator Requisition ID R018704 Job Description What we’re looking for: As a Digital and Social Media Marketing Coordinator at Activision, you will work with the Call of Duty team as a highly organized and driven member to provide support to the Digital Marketing department as we execute our social media campaigns domestically and internationally. This is a rare opportunity to join the marketing team behind the biggest franchise in gaming and entertainment history and grow in the digital marketing department. You will have the opportunity to work with best in class creative partners and cross functionally within our organization. Responsibilities Key point person responsible for coordinating, scheduling and publishing our extensive Call of Duty franchise communications/assets on social media Assist on large scale digital marketing projects, working in close partnership with our internal digital marketing team, external agencies, and marketing partners Maintain a working calendar of all major digital marketing beats and share with cross-functional partners Collaborate with international teams on global creative role out Upload and manage social media content (videos, gifs, etc.) Assist in QA of creative, social media copy and website assets Provide support for localized marketing asset clearances and final asset distribution to our printers, retailer partners, promotional partners, and international territories Work with cross functional partners on 360 campaign roll out and alignment. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Experience with major social platforms and their best practices (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, etc.) Experience using social media planning and publishing tools (Opal, Sprinklr, etc.) Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Must be able to interact and communicate effectively with all departments. Must be self-directed and reliable in planning and completion of tasks. Detail-oriented, highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment and adapt to change without notice. Strong interest in the gaming industry is a plus Experience in video game marketing or other entertainment/high volume industry roles preferred 2+ years experience in social media and digital marketing We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us! R018704

Job Title Director, Corporate Strategy & Business Development Requisition ID R006159 Job Description Job Title: Director, Corporate Strategy & Business Development Reporting To: Chief Strategy Officer Department: Corporate Strategy & Business Development Location: Santa Monica, CA Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission Corporate Strategy and Business Development is a critical and high-caliber team focused on the top strategic priorities for Activision Blizzard. The team is responsible for setting the corporate strategy and driving long-range planning for the Company, driving M&A and corporate development initiatives, and working closely with senior leaders in Activision Blizzard’s Business Units on key initiatives. This is a high-profile team working with a diverse mix of both internal and external stakeholders, and Corporate Strategy alumni can be found in various leadership roles across the Company. Responsibilities The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to The Director role in Corporate Strategy and Business Development is a unique and highly visible role at Activision Blizzard that offers an accelerated trajectory into leadership roles within the Company for highly talented individuals. The successful candidate will support the team’s M&A and corporate development efforts to proactively source and evaluate M&A and partnership opportunities, while grooming a team of highly talented individuals to take on leadership roles within the Company. Corporate Development and M&A Develop overall M&A strategy for the enterprise; illustrative transactions include ~$19B merger with Blizzard / Vivendi Games, ~$6B acquisition of King, sale of Destiny publishing rights to Bungie, acquisition of MLG Develop and monitor pipeline of potential M&A and partnership opportunities Support evaluation and execution of M&A opportunities, including managing analysts to conduct due diligence, develop business cases, build detailed financial models (DCF, comps, accretion / dilution), and work closely with internal leaders and external advisors Partner with business unit leaders to help shape M&A agenda Corporate and Business Unit Strategy Actively participate in key corporate strategic planning processes, working across businesses and functions to frame the corporate strategy and drive alignment and execution on key initiatives Develop deep relationships with business unit leadership and work closely to support the execution of key strategic priorities for the different business units Player Profile Bachelor’s degree, and MBA highly desirable, with 7+ years of work experience, ideally in investment banking, private equity, and/or corporate development at a leading media or technology company Proven ability to lead teams in a fast-paced environment and groom high-caliber talent on an accelerated career trajectory Proven ability to manage complex M&A and other transactions, working with a broad range of internal stakeholders and external advisors Exceptional quantitative skills and financial acumen Ability to develop deep trust-based relationships and influence different stakeholder groups directly and indirectly Ability to effectively balance multiple simultaneous priorities and deadlines with tight timelines Exceptional problem-solving, decision-making and quantitative skills Self-starter and comfort with ambiguity; must be self-directed and proactive starting day 1 on the job Persuasive communication skills (written and verbal), including the ability to tailor communications to a broad range of internal and external audiences Broad network and deep passion for interactive entertainment and technology Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Director, Production Validation Testing Requisition ID R018860 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility and creativity to improve the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB Your Mission As a Director of Production Validation Testing, you will lead a world class testing team that validates the security of our games, and the platforms they rely on. The team’s activities consist of penetration tests, red and purple team exercises, attack surface mapping, and bug bounty. The team is dedicated to finding vulnerabilities before threat actors, whether they are in technology, processes, or people. We are looking for a leader to grow a strong team while spearheading the strategic direction for offensive testing. You will report to the Vice President of Business Unit and Product Security and will work closely with leaders across security, operational, and studio teams. You will play an important role in influencing the Information Security team’s strategy through risk identification pre- and post-production. This is an opportunity to shape an impactful and respected team in a growing centralized Information Security organization. If you are passionate about information security, we would like to hear from you – even if you think you may not meet all of the requirements! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Lead and develop a deep technical penetration testing team across multiple world-wide locations. Coordinate the delivery of penetration testing, red team, attack surface mapping, and bug bounty. Own the strategic direction and evolution of the team, including setting and prioritizing goals. Write and deliver high-quality documents for technical and non-technical audiences. Capture and report metrics that measure risk exposure program performance. Experience Player Profile: 5+ years of experience in a technical security people leadership role. 5+ years of experience in penetration testing or other offensive security roles. Experience leading remote, geographically distributed teams. Experience communicating with a wide range of technical & non-technical partners and senior leadership. Knowledge And Skills Technical knowledge of adversary Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs). Ability to exercise good judgement, problem solve, and make decisions in the face of ambiguity and imperfect knowledge. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to identify and communicate the business impact of threats and risks to partners and team members. Key Attributes Interpersonal and communication skills to effectively gather information and build positive relationships across diverse teams. Ability to work effectively with employees at all levels of the organization. Ability to balance multiple contending priorities. Passion for promoting a team culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. Flexible thinking, ability to adapt to change, and the perseverance and resilience to introduce change gradually. Must be willing to travel occasionally. Extra Points Certifications such as OSCP and CREST. Knowledge of secure system design practices and principles. A curiosity about gaming or learning more about the gaming industry. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. The team’s activities consist of penetration tests, red and purple team exercises, attack surface mapping, and bug bounty. We are looking for a leader to grow a strong team while spearheading the strategic direction for offensive testing. You will report to the Vice President of Business Unit and Product Security and will work closely with leaders across security, operational, and studio teams. You will play an important role in influencing the Information Security team’s strategy through risk identification pre- and post-production. This is an opportunity to shape an impactful and respected team in a growing centralized Information Security organization. If you are passionate about information security, we would like to hear from you – even if you think you may not meet all of the requirements! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Lead and develop a deep technical penetration testing team across multiple world-wide locations. Coordinate the delivery of penetration testing, red team, attack surface mapping, and bug bounty. Own the strategic direction and evolution of the team, including setting and prioritizing goals. Write and deliver high-quality documents for technical and non-technical audiences. Capture and report metrics that measure risk exposure program performance. Experience Player Profile: 5+ years of experience in a technical security people leadership role. 5+ years of experience in penetration testing or other offensive security roles. Experience leading remote, geographically distributed teams. Experience communicating with a wide range of technical & non-technical partners and senior leadership. Knowledge And Skills Technical knowledge of adversary Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs). Ability to exercise good judgement, problem solve, and make decisions in the face of ambiguity and imperfect knowledge. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to identify and communicate the business impact of threats and risks to partners and team members. Key Attributes Interpersonal and communication skills to effectively gather information and build positive relationships across diverse teams. Ability to work effectively with employees at all levels of the organization. Ability to balance multiple contending priorities. Passion for promoting a team culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. Flexible thinking, ability to adapt to change, and the perseverance and resilience to introduce change gradually. Must be willing to travel occasionally. Extra Points Certifications such as OSCP and CREST. Knowledge of secure system design practices and principles. A curiosity about gaming or learning more about the gaming industry. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Job Title Team Name: Director, Risk Management Requisition ID R018526 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility and creativity to improve the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB How You Contribute to Our Vision: Key Responsibilities Responsible for leading and maturing our governance, risk and compliance discipline across application and infrastructure security for on-prem, OSS and cloud-based environments. Define and implement a robust and business appropriate risk and issue management discipline in support of internal and external cybersecurity risk management. Interlock with customers to represent ABK's security posture and standards, and bring customer feedback to security and product teams. Operationalize discipline for ongoing internal and external compliance and maintenance of security audits and evidence. Collaborate with cross company teams to drive an environment of continuous security improvement. Use overall data and findings to identify and recommend enhancements and changes to increase product and infrastructure security posture. Support security operations to provide the protection of the confidentiality, availability, and integrity of customer data and building/maintaining customer trust. Partner with product/engineering, corporate operations, and employees to build and maintain a security-aware culture where everyone understands and plays their part. Provide thought leadership on modern security operations and help lead our infrastructure security organization in creating trust through security. Embody a continuous improvement discipline for personal and career growth. Mentor and grow infrastructure, application security and cloud security engineers. Skills And Attributes You have a risk based approach to project prioritization. You have a track record of stepping up and leading successful complex security projects including roll-out of security discipline to engineering, operations teams. Proven track record of customer interaction including support for pre- and post-sales activities and support for customer enablement teams. Experience with support for internal and external audit activities including evidence gathering and management, interaction with auditors and management of audit timelines. Experience with application security disciplines including security reviews, testing, and management of findings through to remediation. Experience with operational security disciplines including asset and inventory management, vulnerability scanning and patch/update disciplines for the management of findings through to remediation Experience implementing and/or running an issue management discipline to ensure a robust lifecycle for the management of findings and issues, balancing security standards and operational realities. Experience with containerized applications, and technologies, such as Kubernetes. Experience working in a continuous delivery/continuous deployment environment. You have a desire to stay ahead of the latest industry trends and technologies; a track record of sharing contributions to the wider security engineering community and a commitment to continuous learning. You believe security should make it easy to do the right thing. You are an expert at leading collaborative efforts involving large groups. Expert at building consensus within and across engineering teams. Minimum Requirements 5-8+ years experience managing high performance security teams with Outcome driven results KPI based measurements 3-5+ years of experience Managing application and/or operational security, including IaaS, PaaS, SaaS Defining/implementing cloud-native based security best practices Operationalizing and running governance, issue and risk management disciplines Leading or supporting external audit activities such as PCI Demonstrated history of employee engagement through coaching and mentoring, and leading both individuals and managers Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to identify and effectively communicate the business impact of cybersecurity risk to stakeholders and team members. The ability to solve security problems without saying "No". Preferred Qualifications Certifications such as ISACA Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), (ISC)2 Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), (ISC)2 CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional). Experience with AWS cloud security best practices * This role is expected to begin and continue as a remote position.* We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title Engineering Director Requisition ID R010094 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission As an Engineering Director you will be take ownership for the execution of key components across our technology roadmap, guiding a focused team of engineers to build and refine components, tools, and capabilities to support Game Security initiatives. Working directly with senior management in the Game Security group, you will be entrusted and empowered to deliver mission critical capabilities that protect the safety and security of our major franchise titles. As a battle tested engineering leader, you will help navigate roadblocks, define solutions, and focus resources to deliver best of breed solutions in support of our mission. Taking direction from Game Security leadership, you will be empowered and encouraged to be a proactive, inventive, and trusted resource to mentor and guide a highly skilled engineering team. A concise understanding of the full software product development lifecycle, supported by a solid track record of managing the delivery of complex technology solutions, is essential to be successful in this role. This role is highly suitable for somebody who not only garners respect as a professional and knowledgeable engineering team leader, but isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and get the job done – getting hands-on with the team will be highly encouraged. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Responsible for full product development lifecycle, from gathering requirements, to prioritizing features, assisting engineers writing specifications, reviewing execution plans and ensuring alignment against strategic technology development goals. Work with Game Security leadership to align technical requirements across multiple stakeholders. Resolve ambiguity, highlight risk, and provide predictable estimates for deliverables. Balance resources across multiple projects already in flight, and build plans for upcoming roadmap deliverables. Identify risks early and often, and suggest mitigation strategies that consider multiple paths and pragmatic solutions. Be able to offer alternative approaches, balancing technology and business requirements against time and resources. Provide hands-on engineering leadership by example, offering guidance and mentorship to engineers. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 7+ years of technical product ownership, engineering team management in support of videogame development at engine, tools, or feature-level, or similar experience. Experience with defining and leading platform initiative and/or complex software engineering projects. Deep experience with each stage of software development lifecycle, from inception, design and implementation, through to QA and deployment; translating requirements into effective engineering execution. Experience in practicing agile development practices, and strong working knowledge of a variety of project management techniques. Be able to practice what you preach – diving in and contributing directly to development efforts when necessary. Able to proactively navigate roadblocks with effective solutions. Can breakdown complex projects into manageable phased deliverables. Skills To Execute Successfully Exceptional communication and leadership skills. Facilitator who clears roadblocks for the engineering team, taking ownership to keep things moving. Highly technical acumen – understand key problem domains and how to leverage innovative modern software engineering techniques. Be able to juggle multiple priorities – able to keep things moving and stay on track. Technical Requirements Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. Strong C/C++ development on game titles, including some understanding of assembly code, and solid understanding of source control best practices and hands-on knowledge of P4. Job Title Engineering Manager, Ads Platform Requisition ID R017526 Job Description Roles/Responsibilities Technically strong hands-on people manager Partner with Architects, Product Managers, and engineers to build one of the world’s largest mobile game advertising platforms Work with the product team & stake holders to understand the business requirements and translate them into the development/design tasks Evaluate and choose the right technology stack and build the Ads & Monetization platform to handle billions of requests per day and tens of thousands of requests per second Coach, mentor and guide the technical and professional development of team members Inspire the team to be autonomous, grow people's careers, and build technical leaders within the team Own the overall goals of uptime and scalability of the platform Qualifications BA/BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience 7+ years of experience leading the development of low latency high performance scalable services Led a team of 5+ engineers, and have 2+ years of engineering management experience Strong knowledge in Java or related backend technology stack Experience with SQL & No-SQL database technologies like MySQL, Oracle, BigTable or similar Experience working in a cloud-based environment with Google Cloud Platform or AWS or similar Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to work in a collaborative team environment Experience with building large scale distributed applications Strong understanding of messaging & streaming technologies like Pub/Sub, Kafka, Kinesis or similar Preferred Qualifications (Bonus Points) Knowledge and experience in CI/CD, test automation, Jenkins, Gradle and related technologies Experience with open-source technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Google BigQuery Focused on usability, maintainability, and quality, building for the long term Knowledge of advertising platform & technology R017526

Job Title Engineering Manager Requisition ID R016495 Job Description Engineering Manager - Progression - Game Services Want to be responsible for the awesome gaming experience of hundreds of millions of players? How about building a scalable platform that enables key revenue-driving and player engagement features in world-renowned games? We're looking for an Engineering Manager to lead a development team in Vancouver that designs, builds, runs, and evolves our game progression, rewards, and player engagement services platforms for the Call of Duty franchise and other popular Activision titles. The Game Services department is responsible for delivering core capabilities in the Demonware online platform and developing new online services and features to support the future of the online gaming market. The development is geared towards low-latency and large-scale distributed systems that can handle millions of concurrently connected users. This role will have a large impact on the online and multiplayer experience for AAA multiplayer games, including Call of Duty. In This Role, You Will Provide direction and strategy for our products. Understand what the big picture is and how to get there. Own the relationship with customers and game studios in relation to your products. Understand their needs and provide an exemplary service personally and through your team. Management of goals, performance, and career advancement for direct reports. Holding reports accountable to their expected contribution for their level. Provide career direction for direct and indirect reports, helping them establish a personal career path and continuously develop themselves. Collaborate with the project manager to map out and deliver team objectives and priorities for the year based on company goals and studios’ requirements Organize and coordinate team members to effectively work on features together and with other teams in Demonware Ensure the software produced by the team achieves the quality bar we expect for our products Collaborate with HR and recruitment on various people and recruitment needs Your Profile 2+ years of experience in similar leadership role (other combinations of technical skills and experience may be considered) Experience working in a game studio or providing online services to game studios is a plus. Ability to engage, develop, and retain high-performing engineers. Willingness to travel and accommodate a flexible work schedule that includes being on-call. Previous experience building and leading high-performing software development teams. Expertise in effective project management processes, software development methodologies, and their application Experience providing feedback and input to technical discussions, ensuring sound engineering is applied in problem solving and technical decision making Experience in Python, MySQL and Kafka is a plus What Demonware Offers Relocation Support, 25 days of vacation, RRSP matching program and top-tier medical, dental and life insurance coverage for you and your dependents and perks. About Us Demonware is an independently-run part of Activision Blizzard. We run every part of the players’ online experience, from logging in to matchmaking to climbing the leaderboards, for popular video game franchises such as Call of Duty, Tony Hawk Pro Skater, Crash Bandicoot and Skylanders. The work we do together every day impacts almost half a billion players around the world. We solve big company challenges with a small company feel. We are technology-driven with a culture of openness. This means collaborating to solve interesting challenges, enjoying the freedom to talk to anyone, and always feeling respected. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much. R016495

Job Title Environment Art Internship Requisition ID R017315 Job Description Environment Art Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile Must be a current student pursuing their bachelors, masters, or PhD and graduating May 2023 or later. Available for a 12-week internship starting late May or late June. Can demonstrate strong artistic sensibilities, robust technical skills, and strong work ethic. Passionate about learning what it takes to be a successful artist in the video game industry. Candidates must apply with a resume and portfolio link to be considered. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Skilled in a traditional modelling package like 3DS Max or Maya. Experience with creating PBR materials with high quality textures and efficient UV’s. Strong sense of composition and layout. Enthusiasm for participating in the critique process and ability to execute on feedback. Environment Artist – Remote Teams: With focus on creating 3d game environments, this position will teach you how to build compelling 3d environments in a creative environment working with and supporting a global team of artists.   Good sense of composition and layout. Good knowledge of using Game Editors, such as Unreal or Unity. Interest in games, game-design and crafting FPS game environments. Enthusiasm for participating in the critique process and ability to execute on feedback. Good communicating skills with a strong interest in collaborating with other artists across the world. Your Mission Work with artist and animators on one of Activision's award-winning franchises.   Help make new characters, environments, concepts, animations, UI, and/or armor. Job Title Environment Artist - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R018319 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history – and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are building a culture of collaboration and seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile Environment Artist to join our team in Carlsbad, California. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Be Doing… Work with our Art Director and team to establish an iconic look for our world within the ambitious parameters set forth by our game designers. Work with our technical artists to establish an efficient environment content pipeline and identify possible needs and tools necessary to keep environment asset creation as streamlined as possible. Work hand in hand with a team of level designers, artists and lighters to develop levels from prototype to completion. Troubleshoot technical and artistic issues and maintain an awareness of level performance during development. Communicate and collaborate effectively with team members, production and management to ensure that project goals are defined and met on time. Craft visually stunning, atmospheric, effective and efficient 3D models of natural and architectural environments with strong drawing, texturing, and lighting skills and an excellent sense of spatial relations and structural logic. To succeed you must have… 3+ years of experience crafting high-quality 3D architecture, environments, and levels for AAA games. The ability to demonstrate and execute multiple art styles. A basic understanding of shaders, with preference given to those who are adept in material. creation, lighting solutions, and environmental effects. The ability to receive, give, and apply feedback effectively. High proficiency in Maya or 3ds Max, Photoshop and Zbrush. Experience with the real-time engines and have spent a considerable amount of time "in-editor". A passion for gaming, a contagious, positive demeanor, and be someone who takes pride in everything they do. We’d love it if you also have… A foundation in traditional art with ability to concept ideas. Additional experience in lighting, VFX, design, etc. Outstanding visual and technical understanding of 3D modeling and texturing. Architecture or cinematography experience. Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects. Please include a shot breakdown specifying what you were directly responsible for creating. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! High Moon Studios Founded in 2002, High Moon Studios is an award-winning studio developing for the Call of Duty® franchise, with past development on over 15 titles including Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone, Bungie’s Destiny 2: Forsaken, and Transformers: Fall of Cybertron. We employ more than 170 people in Carlsbad, CA, a seaside city in San Diego County. Our pride is our people and the experiences we have successfully created for our fans. High Moon's talent is comprised of gifted entertainment and technology professionals responsible for some of the most successful games ever made. We have award-winning developers, published artists and specialists recognized as among the best in their fields. Our studio has a history of using innovative techniques designed to boost productivity and product quality, which in turn enhances our studio's quality of life. Strong understanding of modular workflows as it relates to architectural assembly and asset creation. Advanced knowledge of physically based material workflows and shaders. Job Title Expert Animation Engineer - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R018364 Job Description Job Description Your role Activision’s Central Animation Technology Group is looking for dedicated Animation Engineers to join our growing team focused on the future of Animation in our games. Our group’s goal is to make radical improvements to the way our characters move and behave. We are seeking engineers with a passion for realistic human and creature movement. The successful candidate will be ready to tackle the wide variety of engineering challenges vital to deliver believability and style across diverse situations and game modes. Strong 3D math and linear algebra. Experience working directly on low-level game animation systems. Good knowledge of animation topics such as inverse kinematics, blend trees, ragdolls, state machines and secondary motion techniques. Capable and eager to take a leading role on projects. Multitasking: ability to work on multiple tech threads with different teams Optional These are not firm requirements, but we would be especially interested in talking to anyone with experience of: Credited on 1 or more AAA game titles for PC or consoles. Familiarity with content creation tools such as Maya. Experience with mentoring, hiring or leading teams. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. jobTitle: Expert Character Artist - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Expert Character Artist - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R017301 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand-new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create innovative technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to fuel your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Your mission is to create authentic characters that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. Your broader experience with game development and the character pipeline will help you work collaboratively with designers, concept artists, technical artists and animators to ensure that you are always putting gameplay first when it comes to developing outstanding characters. In short, you’ll be part of a close-knit, collaborative community of artists, engineers and designers whose sole goal is to make a truly epic and immersive game experience. Responsibilities Share your passion and knowledge of character art in the films and games industry. Collaborate with Art Directors, Producers, Animators, and Tech Artists to deliver realistic characters for best-in-class player experiences. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Champion standard processes and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Collaborate with other teams to ensure art requirements and plans are understood. Supply creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. Minimum Requirements 8+ total years in the games industry working in an art capacity Strong understanding of creating character art assets in multiple major 3D and 2D packages (3DS Max or Maya, Zbrush, Photoshop, and Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, PS, PC). Excellent understanding of Physically Based Rendering systems and techniques. Possesses in-depth understanding of game engines, pipelines, and processes. Comprehensive understanding of human anatomy, and clothing and a keen eye towards form, shape, structure, and silhouette in regards to modelling. Rock-solid communication and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to thrive in a challenging and often ambiguous environment. Strong understanding of game art with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Inspiring portfolio demonstrating focus and commitment to realistic characters and current gen 2D/3D asset creation; ideally demonstrating organic and hard surface character, clothing, and equipment/accessory models with high-quality materials and textures. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. jobTitle: Expert Core Physics Engineer - Raven Software
jobDescription: Job Title Expert Core Physics Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R017054 Job Description As a Expert Core Engineer, you will be optimizing, enhancing, and developing new physics simulation systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA engine technology. This is a great opportunity to be part of a passionate team that defines and shapes the technology of our upcoming Call of Duty titles. You will be developing the engine physics systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in engine development and physics simulation systems. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design, modify, optimize, and debug physics simulation systems and middleware Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teams Participate in the performance and code review process Contribute to the design and roadmap of industry-leading AAA engine technology Collaboration and co-development with other engineering teams Player Profile We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Background in using, profiling, and optimizing core engine systems Development experience with physics systems Strong background in 3D math Background with parallel programming and multi-threaded engine systems Understanding of computer architecture and memory systems Strong background in C/C++ Solid debugging skills, including ability to debug at an assembly-level when necessary 5+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Creative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-oriented Demonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Extra Points Experience with commercial game physics APIs (Havok, PhysX, etc.) Development experience with a gaming platform (console, PC, and/or mobile) Background with physics-based ragdolls, cloth, and IK systems Familiarity with a digital content creation tool (Max, Maya, Houdini, etc.) Experience with rigid-body dynamics, collision detection, and/or contact/collision resolution Demonstrated work with modern consoles and toolchains About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. jobTitle: Expert Gameplay Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Expert Gameplay Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009892 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and dedicated development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As an Expert Gameplay Animator, you will be expected to create high fidelity 3rd person Player Character animations that align to our pursuit of ultimate player immersion. This Immersion is achieved with Animations that support a strong understanding of human locomotion and its underlying principles. The ability to analyze and de-construct the human range of motion, completing the “feel” the project dictates, is the prime directive. You will be joining our Passionate and Dedicated team of Animators who, continue pushing our standards of quality and drive, that echoes throughout our studio. If you’re looking for the right environment to display and master your talents, then Infinity Ward is the place for you! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Use Motion Capture and Hand-Keyed Techniques to create high-fidelity 3rd person player Animations that are genre-defining Implement and maintain Animations using Proprietary Tools and always evolving Animation engine Communicate and collaborate with the most passionate team of engineers and designers to blur the line between NPC behavior and Player movement Player Profile Minimum Requirements +5 years of Game Development experience A strong passion for Animation, video games, and the entertainment it inspires and draws from An exceptional ability for Hand-Keyed Animation Excellent Maya Animation experience Responsible for taking animation systems from concept to completion Collaboratively work with multiple people and fields to maintain the look and feel of the project Provide and receive feedback from Animators on a regular basis to maintain the look and feel of the project We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Expert Hard Surface/Weapons Artist Requisition ID R018731 Job Description Project: WarZone Reporting To: Lead Asset Artist Department: Art Location: Madison, Wisconsin Why Raven? RAVEN SOFTWARE, thriving after 30 years and a major contributor to the Call of Duty® franchise, is seeking an EXPERT WEAPONS ARTIST to drive weapon content on Warzone. Your Mission As our Warzone Expert Weapons Artist, you are a key driver in cross-studio collaboration efforts, working closely with partner studios and external developers to create riveting and authentic interactive weapons that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You will be a trusted gatekeeper of 3D weapon aesthetic quality, performance, efficiency, and technical guidelines that you and other artists adhere to. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated leader to help tell our story. You Will… Share your deep passion and knowledge of crafting 3D weapons assets and your drive to develop authentic results. Research subject matter relating to objectives to ensure an authentic experience. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver highly detailed and compelling weapons in accordance with design guidelines, deadlines, and technical requirements. Work with riggers and animators to ensure asset functionality fully meets in-game expectations. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Inspire mentor and train fellow artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and attitude. Encourage artists to thrive on open and welcome constructive criticism. Contribute creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 2+ total years working as a Senior, Lead, or Expert hard surface/weapons 3D artist. Inspiring portfolio demonstrating a focus and commitment to excellent 3D hard surface and/or weapon, vehicle models and process. Highly skilled in all areas of 3D modeling principles and techniques. Experience with High poly to Low poly modeling texture baking workflows. High proficiency with Maya/3DS Max & Fusion 360, other experience in Blender is a plus. Deep understanding of Substance Painter and PBR texturing guidelines to produce cinematic quality textures. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Proven communication and problem-solving skills. Extra Points… Eye for hard surface design and strong understanding of ergonomics Additional experience in traditional art Understanding of photogrammetry and how it pertains to model and material creation About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. jobTitle: Expert, Security Architect - OPEN TO REMOTE
jobDescription: Job Title Team Name: Expert, Security Architect - OPEN TO REMOTE Requisition ID R017059 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission Activision, the publisher of the hit Call of Duty franchise, is looking for a passionate system security / information security architect to join our Activision Blizzard King (ABK) Security Architecture team. If you are an avid gamer with a security and systems engineering background, come be a part of our team. The Security Architect will support ABK Security Architecture and other business partner teams to find opportunities to improve the security posture of the various functions within the organization. You will take overall responsibility for both designing and testing new controls. You will develop in house proof of concepts and engage vendors to identify suitable commercial products. You will contribute to the overall information security risk analysis effort and establish and monitor security KPI’s. This role reports into the Director, Security Architecture and maintains good relationships with all line-of-business technology groups. You will work closely with several key individuals and teams and will be part of a dedicated team of security engineers and architects who demonstrate superb technical competency, delivering critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance and security across our enterprise. Qualified candidates will have a background in IT, computer, security systems analysis and engineering. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Provide technical leadership and decision making for all aspects of security architecture across IT programmes and solutions Function as a Cloud Security SME and influence our security posture Communicate ideas effectively and gain alignment across multiple stakeholders Identify gaps in our current processes, workflows and design architectures and recommend changes or enhancements as needed Work with other teams to drive new projects, product implementations configuration reviews, ensuring that best practice standards are maintained Determine project based security requirements by evaluating business use cases in line with overall security posture and risk tolerance. Prepare security related assessment reports with clearly documented findings and recommendations Oversee technology procurement choices for security systems and system controls in partnership with security research and findings Work closely with various teams to continually improve our security offerings while reducing our exposure to risk, including supporting the teams during security related incidents Perform security assessments and due diligence exercises on both in-house and third party systems/vendors and evaluate the findings, making “go” / “no-go” decisions as required Track and evaluate changes in the threat landscape, ensuring that prompt and proactive changes are made to our security systems and strategies when needed Act as an advocate for security and the team in all tasks and engagements, not just architecture specific Player Profile Minimum Requirements Expert knowledge of cloud computing providers and their related security controls Excellent knowledge of cloud security best practices and solutions in cloud security posture management and cloud security workload management tools Proven work experience as a system engineer or information security engineer Detailed technical knowledge of operating systems and database security Solid understanding of risk-driven security architecture and zero trust architectures. Experience hardening clients, servers and networks services Deep knowledge about the current security threat landscape and common tactics, techniques and procedures used in offensive security Experience defining Identity and Access Management frameworks Experience with network technologies, security, and monitoring tools Hands-on experience with log collection, normalizing, and management; security infrastructure and policies; and risk mitigation Thorough understanding of the latest security principles, techniques, and protocols Ability to problem solve independently and collaborate as a team to solve complex problems in support of the team’s mission Demonstrable experience in installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Microsoft Windows and/or UNIX/Linux based environments Knowledge of industry best practices for foundational security elements including network devices and system-level hardening Extra Points Knowledge of containerization software: Docker, Kubernetes Knowledge of shell scripting, Python, Perl Knowledge of Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) products. Knowledge of Devops and Infrastructure as Code frameworks. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. Job Title Expert Sound Designer Requisition ID R015777 Job Description Your Platform We are very open to remote workers for this role! If you reside in one of the 4 countries where SHG currently operates, we can explore remote work arrangements in compliance with local employment laws and our company guidelines. Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering, and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting upcoming projects. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission Sledgehammer Games is looking for a passionate and experienced Expert Sound Designer to help create a fresh new AAA aural experience for our next project. You will work closely with the Audio Director and play a fundamental role in establishing the core sonic aesthetic of our projects. You will play an integral role in maintaining a quality bar reflective of our award-winning team. You will work with audio department members to give feedback as well as mentor members of our team to help them become better sound designers. You will be involved in virtually every aspect of game audio content development alongside one of the most passionate and experienced audio teams in the industry. Establishment and oversight of the audio aesthetic for all projects. Maintain audio quality throughout the development cycle. Mentor members of the sound department to become the best sound designers they can be. Interactive and linear sound effects design. In-depth real-time audio-control scripting. Audio asset implementation. Mixing & mastering. Field recording. Audio tools & run-time systems design collaboration. Player Profile Demonstrated creative and technical achievements in sound design. Ownership of several major aesthetic and creative pillars for multiple projects. Minimum ten years of experience in game audio development. Shipped at least five major titles. Fluency in game audio implementation systems. Understanding of PS4/5, XBOX One/Series X, and PC audio functionality, capabilities, and limitations.
