Job Title Expert Technical Artist Requisition ID R017288 Job Description Job Title: Senior Technical Artist, Solid State Studio Your Mission Welcome to Solid State Studios. We’re a new in-house studio within Activision, dedicated to developing the best AAA mobile games in the world. Our first project is Call of Duty®: Warzone™ Mobile, and we’re looking for great talent, passionate about their work, who share our belief in what AAA experiences on mobile can and should be. We’re incredibly excited to build out our teams and get to work, and invite you to join us in making something special! Your Profile Solid State Studios is currently seeking an experienced Technical Artist for the studio that will have both project and studio responsibilities. Your mission is to play a critical role in developing responsive art tools and user-friendly workflow solutions for the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. You are a self-sufficient teammate who takes ownership of critical tech art tasks, acts as a bridge between the art and engineering teams, and proactively and independently solves challenges. You also have an agile and flexible approach, and excellent and persuasive communication skills, as you will actively partner with some of the most dedicated and passionate developers in the industry. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and committed teammate to help tell our story. Responsibilities Share your deep passion for technical art knowledge and your drive to improve and expand upon content creation pipelines and tool sets. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Collaborate with Artists and Engineers to deliver innovative tool solutions that will help artists develop epic visual content for world-class player experiences. Spearhead tech art development for specific projects, and initiatives to standardize solutions across the organization. Champion processes and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. Inspire and mentor fellow tech artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and attitude. Encourage artists and engineers to thrive on open and welcome constructive feedback. Contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. Minimum Requirements 6+ total years in the games industry working in a tech art position, with at least 3 shipped titles in the AAA console / PC / Mobile space. 2+ years and at least 1 shipped title as a Senior Tech Artist. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Comprehensive understanding of scripting languages. (Python, JavaScript, C#, C++, MAX Script, or MEL) In depth knowledge of memory and performance impact from a content creation perspective. Experience writing and/or debugging shaders Excellent understanding of Physically Based Rendering systems and techniques. Possesses in-depth understanding of game engines, pipelines, and processes. Rock-solid communication and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to thrive in a challenging and often ambiguous environment. Strong understanding of game art with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Extra Points Familiarity with Call of Duty IP and storylines First Person Shooter development experience Previous experience working on mobile platforms Your Platform It takes the industry’s best talent to make entertainment history, and while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a driven and diverse team of people producing greatness together. We’re looking for developers from mobile and PC backgrounds passionate about their work and who believe in realizing the potential of mobile gaming as much as we do. Our World We’re highly collaborative, relaxed, and deadly serious about creating incredible entertainment for passionate players around the world. We approach mobile development as a craft, and our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got you covered! Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. jobTitle: Expert UI Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Expert UI Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R017413 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create state of the art technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to unleash your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As an Expert UI Engineer you will be actively coding and engineering UI screens for various aspects of the game. You will need to possess practical knowledge of LUA scripting language with the ability to implement content into the game engine. Qualified candidates will need to have a strong background in engineering human graphical interfaces and have a well-rounded understanding of user experiences applicable to console games. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Develop, modify, and debug UI software in script and C/C++. Deploy, evaluate performance, optimize and test UI software on PC and console platforms. Collaborate with other internal departments. (art, design, audio, QA, etc.) Co-develop and collaborate with other Activision studios. Document software and features for internal and external engineering teams. Participate in the scheduling, design, performance and code review process. Mentor more junior engineers and be an efficiency multiplier for the team. Player Profile Requirements 5+ years of UI development experience. 1 shipped product working as a senior UI engineer. Demonstrated proficiency in and knowledge of C/C++, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques. Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members. Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented programming. Creative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-oriented. Demonstrated ability to write efficient, clean, readable, portable, and reliable code. Pluses Aptitude for UX design. Background in ActionScript programming. Background in C# programming. Background in Lua programming. Experience with console development. (360, PS3, Xbox One, PS4) Closely collaborated with offsite engineers on a large project. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Expert VFX Artist - Warzone Requisition ID R018797 Job Description Project: WarZone Reporting To: Lead Asset Artist Department: Art Location: Madison, Wisconsin Why Raven? RAVEN SOFTWARE, thriving after 30 years and a major contributor to the Call of Duty® franchise, is seeking an EXPERT WEAPONS ARTIST to drive weapon content on Warzone. Your Mission As our Warzone Expert Weapons Artist, you are a key driver in cross-studio collaboration efforts, working closely with partner studios and external developers to create riveting and authentic interactive weapons that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You will be a trusted gatekeeper of 3D weapon aesthetic quality, performance, efficiency, and technical guidelines that you and other artists adhere to. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated leader to help tell our story. You Will… Share your deep passion and knowledge of crafting 3D weapons assets and your drive to develop authentic results. Research subject matter relating to objectives to ensure an authentic experience. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver highly detailed and compelling weapons in accordance with design guidelines, deadlines, and technical requirements. Work with riggers and animators to ensure asset functionality fully meets in-game expectations. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Inspire mentor and train fellow artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and attitude. Encourage artists to thrive on open and welcome constructive criticism. Contribute creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 2+ total years working as a Senior, Lead, or Expert hard surface/weapons 3D artist. Inspiring portfolio demonstrating a focus and commitment to excellent 3D hard surface and/or weapon, vehicle models and process. Highly skilled in all areas of 3D modeling principles and techniques. Experience with High poly to Low poly modeling texture baking workflows. High proficiency with Maya/3DS Max & Fusion 360, other experience in Blender is a plus. Deep understanding of Substance Painter and PBR texturing guidelines to produce cinematic quality textures. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Proven communication and problem-solving skills. Extra Points… Eye for hard surface design and strong understanding of ergonomics Additional experience in traditional art Understanding of photogrammetry and how it pertains to model and material creation About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. Job Title External Development Coordinator (Characters) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018889 Job Description Treyarch is looking for an External Development Coordinator to help us develop our next AAA title. As a coordinator, you will interact directly with some of the best talent in our industry, helping to create the Characters seen by fans all over the world. This is an opportunity to learn how Characters for some of the biggest titles in games are created. The ideal candidate should have a background in 3D modeling and texturing, preferably with some amount of Character modeling experience, with experience in both high and low polygon techniques, have a passion for creating high quality models, and is extremely organized and has strong communication skills. Experience with 2D concept is a plus as well. What You'll Do... You will be hands on with art assets, becoming familiar with Treyarch’s pipelines and methods for creating outstanding art, from concept to final game character Work directly with the department Lead and Senior Artists as well as the outsourcing manager Assist artists in assembling assets needed to send to outsource studios Maintain the latest build of the game for testing models, coordinate with Seniors and outsourcing studios for feedback To succeed you should have… Detail oriented and very organized, with excellent communication skills Education focused on 3D art, degree in art production a big plus 1+ year(s) of 3D modeling experience, in the game industry a plus Interest and experience in Character Art a big plus Experience with Maya, ZBrush, and Substance Painter a plus Shotgun experience a plus A positive attitude and ability to work on a multi-discipline team We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R018889

jobTitle: Game Designer / Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Game Designer / Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R012896 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Technical Multiplayer Designer this person will create innovative gameplay systems, fun over the top game-modes and visceral in-game moments for Modern Warfare II. Applicants should have the ability to show game-modes or gameplay systems that you have personally scripted for an existing title or personal project. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work daily to improve the quality of our multiplayer experience through play-sessions and feedback. Think like a Programmer to solve problems and accomplish a vision. Write gameplay script to provide player passives, build unique player equipment, manage player inventory, track player stats, define gameplay rules, manage player progression and more. Provided high-level direction: own a feature or feature set from start to finish. This includes fleshing out the design and then requesting all needed audio, art, animation, vfx and code. Continue to iterate on the design and integrate these requested items as they come in. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Minimum of three 3 years of game industry experience as a Scripter or Programmer. Knowledge and prior experience with a C style programming or scripting language. Strong game design skills: Applicants must be able to intelligently discuss the strengths and weaknesses of recent games and be able to list techniques used to make fun FPS combat. Ability to collaborate well with your team. Efficient at prioritizing to meet deadlines. Communicate progress with the Directors well and frequently. Extra Points MP debugging experience. Computer Science degree. History of playing a variety of game genres both digital and not. Note: If your strength is on the technical side and you’re looking to make a shift from Engineering to Design we want to hear from you! We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Job Title Game Development Internship Requisition ID R017382 Job Description Game Development Internship Your Platform At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing to. Interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile Must be a current student pursuing their bachelors, masters, or PhD and graduating December 2023 or later. Available for a 12-week internship starting in late May or late June. Passionate about learning how to be a successful engineer in the video game industry. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Internship Opportunities Gameplay: Partner across teams developing gameplay, graphics, audio, and systems for our games. You will be working on a shipping title, with a mentor, on a team managing multiple projects against competing deadlines. It may be the biggest challenge you have faced, but your strong technical skills, initiative, and commitment will get you through. Proficient in a programming language, preferably C++ or C#. Knowledge of mathematics for 3D graphics, particularly linear algebra. An eagerness to collaborate and innovate on game side code. A passion for significantly impacting game development. Strong communication. Proven game programming experience (personal or professional). Network: Work in a team that connects millions of players across the world to unique and relevant experiences. Networking engineers address some of the most technically complicated problems in video game development. Be on the forefront of addressing them. Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C#. A strong desire to pioneer on innovative network technology. Familiarity with how netcode works. Tools: Help us build the tools we use to create our games. Create user experiences for proprietary tools and provide unique value to a small team of passionate engineers. We help content creators be really creative, really fast. Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C#. Knowledge of WPF. A strong desire to significantly impact the way games are made. Automation: This team supports the continuous development, automation, and improved workflows and iteration times for our studios. Solid understanding of C++ and/or C#. Comfortable working in Unix and Windows. Strong understanding of Python, Bash, and/or JavaScript. Understanding of git. Docker knowledge is a plus. Game programming experience (personal or professional). Experience programming in at least one scripting language (Lua, Python, Perl, etc.). Graphics: Build upon advancements in graphics technology to push the boundaries of what’s possible for future games. This is an amazing opportunity to get exposure to the most sophisticated graphics tools, and for you to bring your innovative ideas into the fold. Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++. Knowledge of mathematics for 3D graphics, particularly linear algebra. A passion for computer graphics technology and game engine development. Interest in programming for modern graphics backends (e.g DirectX 12, Vulkan, Metal). Mobile Engineering: Develop new features and systems for our upcoming mobile applications/games, coordinating across teams with designers, artists, and other engineers. Everyone on the team is empowered to influence the direction of the product, and the ideal candidate will have a passion to enhance quality and player experience. Strong programming skills (C#, .NET Core and Standard). Working knowledge of the Unity platform, performance analysis, and code optimization. Experience with implementing game feature logic in a client/server environment. Server Engineering: Are you an engineer who has a strong passion for gaming, programming, and finding simple, elegant solutions to complex problems? Take this opportunity to help our server teams optimize our game services and servers for current and future Blizzard titles. Proficient in at least one programming language, preferably C++ or C#. Knowledge of Python and SQL. Player-oriented approach and an aim to build operationally excellent services. Build Engineering: Join our Build Engineering team to focus on coordinating the end-to-end creation of a Call of Duty franchise game. You will work within our ecosystem of services that communicate with one another to provide the game content coding and automate the build process. Knowledge and application of C#. Strong understanding of Python. A self-starter with great communication skills. User Interface (UI): Join our User Interface team and work directly on the “front lines” to create the best possible experience for our players, including live ops pages, in-store game pages, events, and leader boards. Experience with C and C++. Familiarity with Unreal and Java/Javascript. A team player that has a passion for problem-solving. Your Mission Work with engineers on one of Activision Blizzard's award-winning franchises. Work closely with your team to design, implement, and debug software in C++ and other languages that drive the next generation of game development. Expand your skills and learn new technology. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. Job Title Gameplay Engineer - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R013476 Job Description Your Platform: Located in the San Francisco Bay Area and Melbourne, Australia – we’re the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our talented employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. As we head into decade II of development, we’re focused on constantly evolving, innovating and taking risks – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With world-class audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love what we do and work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for talented game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a Gameplay Engineer, you will work closely with content teams to push our gameplay systems to new heights of fun and visual fidelity, crafting new systems and improve existing ones to realize AAA-quality FPS gameplay. This is a phenomenal opportunity to work with a passionate engineering team and help craft ground breaking industry technology. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Collaborate with designers to build new gameplay systems. Support the design department by working on a variety of general tasks, to facilitate their efforts. Optimization work, related to performance and bandwidth improvements. Bug fixing and polish tasks. Player Profile ­Minimum Requirements 3+ years of experience in games. Fluency in 3D math, related to game programming. Fluency in C++. Strong design sensibilities and outstanding interpersonal skills. Steadfast work ethic and high personal standards of quality. Extra Points AAA play-control logic, especially on an FPS title. Modern animation techniques and blend trees. Networked game logic. Real-world AI methods. Rigid body kinematics. Extending an established code base. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Gameplay Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R017293 Job Description We are looking for a talented engineer with a passion for gameplay and a critical eye for game design to join our team in either Los Angeles, CA or Vancouver, BC. As a Gameplay Engineer, you will be working closely with our Design team to bring innovative game features to life. A Gameplay Engineer should be excellent at rapidly prototyping ideas and be capable of quickly turning a design specification from paper into a usable game system for further iteration. A successful Gameplay Engineer will have an “eye” for gameplay and a knack for understanding how to deliver exciting features that millions of fans are going to love. You should be able to get quickly familiarized with existing codebases and be able to write elegant, high performing extensible code that works well within a collaborative environment. What You’ll Do… Implement, debug and optimize major systems in C/C++ and other languages in the context of a large cross platform codebase Spearhead development of innovative gameplay experiences Contribute to game architecture and technical designs and postmortems Perform data and code analysis to identify improvement opportunities Provide mentorship to less experienced engineers To succeed you should have… 3+ years of proven experience in a Gameplay Engineering role or similar position with multiple shipped titles Proficiency in C/C++ Proficiency in scripting language such as Python or Lua Advanced knowledge of algorithms and data structures Advanced optimization and debugging skills Strong math skills – especially linear algebra and 3D vector math Game knowledge and an understanding of the design principles behind games Able to collaborate with other engineers and non-technical team members, and be able to adapt to a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges constantly evolve B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience And most importantly, a passion for making games We’d love it if you also have… Advanced programming specialty, such as low level network programming, High Level Shader Language (HLSL), SSE assembly, etc Expertise and passion in one or more of the following areas: AI, User Interfaces, Animation, or General Gameplay We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Job Title Gameplay Physics Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R016086 Job Description Do you like building reactive and dynamic worlds? Do you care about filling characters with the feel of life and fluid motion? At Treyarch, we want to push the capabilities of physics simulations, vehicle gameplay, motion synthesis and animation systems across the Call of Duty Universe! If that sounds appealing, then you could be an excellent fit for our Treyarch Gameplay team! We are looking for engineers with a strong background in math who can apply their skills to develop exciting features for Call of Duty. As a Gameplay Physics Engineer, you will be working closely with our designers, animators, artists, and fellow engineers to bring the Call of Duty experience to a whole new level for millions of fans to enjoy. What To Expect… To join our team, you will need to harness your strengths in C/C++ to debug, tune and optimize gameplay systems such as physics, vehicle simulation, character locomotion, cloth simulation, collision detection, destructible objects and more. What You’ll Do… Collaborate with designers, animators, and other content developers to craft immersive new gameplay technologies and features. Contribute to content and functionality designs. Improve physics, vehicle, animation, and other similar domain pipelines to boost team efficiency. Engage in playtests with your teammates and offer feedback, discuss gameplay, and analyze performance or game fidelity. Show newcomers how to build believable worlds and sharpen their skills through mentoring of less experienced engineering teammates. To succeed you should have… A strong passion for helping make games move well and feel fun and enjoyable for our fans. A college degree in Computer Science, or equivalent education or experience that enables you to work within our C/C++ code systems. The strong 3D math and linear algebra skills required to work on physics, animation, and dynamic simulation code. The ability to team up with dev partners across the studio and the Call of Duty franchise to brainstorm ideas, align on goals, roadmap, iterate, and get things to the finish line. You are a great fit if your philosophy is to... Commit to doing things the right way, even when it is difficult. Value diversity and differences in others. Ensure discussions include every voice that has something to say. Strive to learn from the knowledge and experiences of those around you. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title HRBP/Sr. HR Generalist Requisition ID R019030 Job Description Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to improve the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Are you a Senior HR professional looking for a new opportunity? We're looking for a Senior HR Generalist to join our team Your Mission The Senior HRG significantly contributes to the company’s performance by providing tactical and strategic solutions on critical talent, overall workforce efficiency, and enabling organizational capabilities that directly enables the outcome of the strategic objectives. This role is key to driving company growth, revenue, and creativity by fostering best-in-class development teams that build value for Activision. This role will lead and partner with centralized teams to carry out the following accountabilities in: talent attraction, sourcing, retention, succession, pipeline planning and workforce optimization; performance and total rewards management, employee efficiency, relations; policy interpretation and application. Additional responsibilities include organizational design, effectiveness; staffing models, talent capabilities, career progression initiatives, mentoring and training. This position requires a data-driven, analytical, collaborative and influential HR professional who can work effectively across a highly matrixed environment. Key Accountabilities Deliver a human capital plan driven by the annual and long-term planning, translating business requirements into effective and modern initiatives Lead organisational change efforts, ensuring employee and customer impact are at the forefront of decisions, and that organization changes are planned and thoughtfully implemented with strong process integrity. Accountable for the approach and outcome on employment matters; advising and influencing management around the people agenda to enhance intended performance and reduce people-related risks. Provide day-to-day mentoring to leadership on a variety of actions to allow them to grow and perform at their best. Drive integrity and accountability for the effective implementation of the annual HR cycle to facilitate valuable delivery, including workforce and talent planning, performance management, and total rewards. Analyze, report and use predictive people analytics as evidential reasoning to continuously improve the talent key performance indicators. Identify levers and develop strategies that measurably improve engagement and retention (e.g., talent assessments, engagement surveys, exit surveys) Create and maintain strong networks and relations (informal and formal) with employee resource groups, external partners, and leading industry and collaborator communities Actively participate in annual budget planning/staffing forecasting process Player Profile 5+ years of dynamic experience in all aspects of Human Resources organization design and development experience, including considerable organizational change, for a sophisticated and redefining business Experience assessing leadership and organizational talent; identifying talent gaps and effectively driving initiatives to address gaps Experience directly supporting senior leaders, influencing leaders to make better people decisions that achieve business results Comfortable using facts and data to build people-centric cases; for example, use of staffing models and other analytical tools Creativity and out-of-the-box thinking; high IQ, high EQ, passion, and strong critical thinking skills with a willingness to take reasonable risk and challenge the status quo Exceptional project and process leadership skills with a proven track record of delivering high-quality results in a fast-paced, complex, dynamic business environment Highest level of integrity with a proven track record of gaining trust from all levels of the organization Proven commitment to inclusion We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. R019030

jobTitle: Lead AI Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Lead AI Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009862 Job Description Job Description: Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create state of the art technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to unleash your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Infinity Ward - Austin is seeking a talented and passionate Lead AI Engineer to oversee game AI development. This is an opportunity to lead development on cutting edge AI in the world’s premiere FPS franchise. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work with the AI engineering team to craft best-in-class AI technology for our next AAA title. Work closely with the design and content teams to bring new AI characters and behaviors to life. Collaborate with the animation team to continue improving the visual fidelity of our AI. Contribute ideas for new AI architectures and technologies. Design, plan, and implement performant and optimized AI systems. Player Profile Requirements 5+ years of experience in games, simulation, or real-time AI. 1 shipped product working as a senior AI or gameplay Engineer. Worked with AI decision frameworks. Strong design sensibilities and outstanding communication skills. Excellent debugging and performance analysis skills. Strong knowledge of C++ programming and practices. Pluses Experience as a managing engineer. Experience with animation technology, such as blend trees, IK, motion matching. Experience with game networking systems. Working in and extending an established code base. Previous experience with scripting languages such as Lua or Python. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! Treyarch is looking for an extraordinary Lead Animator with experience in animation leadership experience. In this role, you will lead a passionate and talented animation team in crafting the highest quality weapon and locomotion animations, pushing the boundaries of gameplay immersion, storytelling, and creativity. The ideal candidate is passionate about animation and gameplay, and has a strong understanding of realistic body mechanics, animation principles, and strong leadership skills. A successful Lead Animator will collaborate across departments to push for that AAA quality and fun our studio is committed to achieve. We're looking for a strong communicator who is passionate about creativity and innovation in this role, where you will influence the direction of Treyarch's animation technology. If you possess a strong will to become an essential pillar of an outstanding animation team, to inspire those around you, and create epic moments in gaming, then this is the role for you! What you’ll be doing… Produce high-quality first-person animations using all the tools at your disposal, with a focus on weapons, locomotion, and gameplay Lead a team of dedicated animators, ensuring that all work is at the highest quality possible while staying on schedule, providing and receiving feedback from Animators on a regular basis Collaboratively work with multiple departments of different disciplines to maintain the look and feel of the project Drive improvements to our first-person animation pipeline, advocating for and exploring a wide variety of ideas to keep pushing the Call of Duty style of animation forward Implement and maintain Animations, using our proprietary tools within our game engine Represents the Gameplay Animation team in all meetings Identify potential areas of risk and work with other groups to mitigate them To succeed you should have… 8+ years of experience in the game industry Expert level first person animation skills and knowledge of animation implementation and debugging techniques A solid understanding of realistic body mechanics Expert level knowledge of Maya Demonstrated mentorship experience and excellent interpersonal skills We’d love it if you also have… Knowledge of weapon mechanics Experience in both stylized and realistic styles of animation Experience working with outsourcing teams Experience with Perforce A passion for video games and the Call of Duty franchise

In this role, you will lead a passionate and talented animation team in crafting the highest quality weapon and locomotion animations, pushing the boundaries of gameplay immersion, storytelling, and creativity. If you possess a strong will to become an essential pillar of an outstanding animation team, to inspire those around you, and create epic moments in gaming, then this is the role for you! What You’ll Be Doing… Produce high-quality first-person animations using all the tools at your disposal, with a focus on weapons, locomotion, and gameplay Lead a team of dedicated animators, ensuring that all work is at the highest quality possible while staying on schedule, providing and receiving feedback from Animators on a regular basis Collaboratively work with multiple departments of different disciplines to maintain the look and feel of the project Drive improvements to our first-person animation pipeline, advocating for and exploring a wide variety of ideas to keep pushing the Call of Duty style of animation forward Implement and maintain Animations, using our proprietary tools within our game engine Represents the Gameplay Animation team in all meetings Identify potential areas of risk and work with other groups to mitigate them To succeed you should have… 8+ years of experience in the game industry Expert level first person animation skills and knowledge of animation implementation and debugging techniques A solid understanding of realistic body mechanics Expert level knowledge of Maya Demonstrated mentorship experience and excellent interpersonal skills We’d love it if you also have… Knowledge of weapon mechanics Experience in both stylized and realistic styles of animation Experience working with outsourcing teams Experience with Perforce A passion for video games and the Call of Duty franchise We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R009334

Job Title Lead Audio Designer Requisition ID R018378 Job Description RAVEN SOFTWARE, thriving after 30 years and a major contributor to the Call of Duty® franchise, is seeking LEAD AUDIO DESIGNERS to manage our growing campaign and Warzone audio teams. As a game audio veteran, your mission is to inspire, mentor and lead a team of high-caliber audio designers in creating immersive and compelling sound effects that will be enjoyed by millions of players across the globe. Responsibilities Lead and develop audio team member careers while fostering our culture of continuous improvement. Assess needs and define goals, action plans and schedules with audio and cross-department leadership. Oversee the design and execution of features, pillars and projects to Raven’s high standards for game audio. Contribute to the creative aspects of sound design, implementation, mixing and troubleshooting game audio. Closely collaborate with outside departments and external partners/vendors to create world-class experiences. Manage, task, mentor, conduct one-to-one meetings and performance reviews with your direct reports. Develop your team by providing consistent guidance, goals, opportunities and resources. Empower audio designers to thrive on open and welcome constructive criticism. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Work with other teams to ensure audio requirements and plans are understood. Take an active role in improving our game audio development techniques and tools. Requirements Inspiring showreel that demonstrates your accomplishments and excellence in game audio. Please specify what portions you contributed to in any collaborative examples. No music is strongly preferred. 7+ years of game audio experience for multiple AAA titles. 3+ years leading audio designers on 1+ shipped title(s). Comprehensive understanding of audio recording, design, processing and mixing. Fluency in game audio implementation targeting console functionality, capabilities and limitations. Audio software proficiency using tools such as REAPER, Pro Tools, Waves, and other plug-ins. Adept at using recording interfaces, microphones and outboard processors. Experience with Windows and/or macOS, familiarity with productivity software such as word processors and spreadsheets. Receptive to evaluation of one’s own work, and skilled at communicating feedback to others. Pluses Active player of Call of Duty or other shooters is a plus. Game development accomplishments outside of audio is a plus. Scripting and/or programming skills is a plus. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! Job Title Lead Campaign Animator Requisition ID R017967 Job Description Job Title: Lead Campaign Animator Reporting To: Associate Animation Director Department: Animation Location: Madison, Wisconsin Your Platform Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We’re based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We have a unique vision for our industry. One that has and continues to inspire us. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our own mistakes. We treat each other with respect. After nearly 30 years, Raven Software is still thriving. We developed a team who cares about one another, our games and our players. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are growing. Our team is creative, highly intelligent, well-led and equipped to face this exciting future. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Raven Software is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.ravensoftware.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ravensoftware, and @RavenSoftware on Twitter. Your Mission As a Lead Campaign Animator, you will have a strong knowledge in creating in-game animations and how blending with the game narrative to bring these epic moments to the game. Working alongside experienced Raven artists and our highly skilled Animation Team to produce content for high profile games. Successful applicants should be comfortable with all levels of ownership, from team management and leadership, through to providing high-level feedback. You must be able to thrive in a challenging environment with an aptitude for critical thinking and analysis, boundless creativity, a good visual aesthetic, and with a deep passion for playing videogames. Experience in first-person shooter (FPS) games and extensive knowledge of the Call of Duty games is a huge plus. This is an excellent opportunity to become part of our highly talented team of proven developers who are passionate about making games. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Working with Creative and Gameplay Directors, Animation Directors, and Production teams to visualize and support all animation needs for the game including gameplay and scripted animation sequences Working with team of Animators to produce pre-visualizations for key gameplay moments and present concept ideas to the team Work with the Animation and Motion Capture teams to support both shoot preparation and directing during performance shooting Support and assist in trouble shooting technical issues relating to gameplay animation Partner with out-sourcing teams to identify work for external development and all files and documentation are delivered to vendors, providing animation direction and feedback, and working to ensure all content delivered meets quality expectations Lead a team of animators providing work assignments, feedback, and together with senior team leadership, ensuring we have the resources and talents to deliver on all campaign animation needs Work with the Technical Animation team contributing and providing feedback on rigs and help developing ever more efficient tools and pipelines As a team lead you will be involved in all areas of hiring and team growth including career development and 1:1 meeting with your direct reports, and all general duties focused on team management aimed at continuing to build the best team of animators in the industry Player Profile Minimum Requirements Expert knowledge in both 1st person and 3rd person gameplay animations and a strong understanding in the language of gameplay storytelling techniques Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university and/or seven plus years related experience in AAA video games, film, or equivalent Highly skilled in all areas of 3D animation principals and techniques, and a skillful awareness for timing, composition, and performance Can quickly learn and master new tools, processes, and pipelines. Expert in Autodesk Maya and other 3d software packages Communicate and collaborate effectively, providing direction to drive scene vision to other disciplines and departments Contribute and be part of a highly creative team, giving and receiving feedback Absolute passion for playing and making the industry’s best videogames Extra Points Essential - demo-reel demonstrating excellent examples of film or game development that supports your application Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. Job Title Lead Core Engineer Requisition ID R014818 Job Description We’re the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. As we head into decade II of development, we’re passionate about constantly evolving, innovating and doing things differently – which are some of the most exciting aspects of game development. With outstanding audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love what we do and work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission Core engineers architect, refactor, and maintain a variety of game and low-level systems. A core generalist will be flexible and comfortable jumping into a variety of subject areas including networking, physics, AI, UI, memory management, rendering, and more. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Architecting, refactoring and maintaining game and low-level engine systems. Designing, writing, debugging and refining core systems, features, tools and infrastructure as needed. Contributing extensively to the core engine Player Profile Minimum Requirements 5-8 years programming experience. Proficiency in and knowledge of C/C++, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques. Experience with profiling and performance tuning of code. Contributed extensively to the development of two or more shipped games, PC or console. Knowledge of common data structures and algorithmic solutions. Proficient with 3D math including linear algebra (vector math, matrices). Thorough knowledge of software design practices including modular architecture, event-driven architecture, and software design patterns. Ability to quickly understand and work with internal and externally developed code. University-level degree in Computer Science or related field. A strong passion for video games of many kinds. Bonus XP Experience with computer game technologies including: AI programming, physics, 3D programming, animation, collision detection. Demonstrated ability to write clean, readable, portable, reliable, and optimized code on modern game consoles. Contributed extensively to the development of at least three shipped console games. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a driven and passionate engineering team that defines and shapes our player's experience. Priorities Can Often Change In a Fast-paced Environment Like Ours, So This Role Includes, But Is Not Limited To, The Following Responsibilities Drive the architecture, implementation and support of products and processes Directly partner with engineers to help grow their technical skills in support of their career objectives Lead the engineering team in maintaining an achievable technical roadmap while being responsive and flexible to changes in the development landscape Set, exemplify, and uphold the best production processes and coding standards Collaborate across the studio, within the larger ATVI ecosystem, and with external teams Player Profile Minimum Requirements 10+ years of proven experience working in the game industry Shipped AAA titles on multiple platforms Expert level C++, supported by solid scripting skills in Python, Lua, C# or other Demonstrated ability to create and support growth targets for subordinates Able to own long term technical vision, with advocacy and refinement. Job Title Lead Environment Artist Requisition ID R017936 Job Description Job Title: Lead Environment Artist Reporting To: Art Manager Department: Art Location: Madison, Wisconsin Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of high-caliber artists in crafting unforgettable environments that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You will be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. You will provide your team with guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Our Lead Environment Artists are role-models that not only manage the team through challenge and change, but also build up individuals into highly engaged, efficient, and effective teammates. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated leader to help tell our story. You Will… Collaborate with Creative Directors, Designers, Engineers, Artists, Producers, and Animators to deliver epic visual content for world-class player experiences. Research subject matter relating to objectives to ensure an authentic experience. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Work in Radiant to augment play-spaces with artwork that supports game and story objectives. Be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. Define team goals, action plans, and schedules for the project. Provide your team with consistent guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Lead, task, mentor and conduct one-to-one meetings with your Environment Artists. Empower artists to thrive on open and welcome constructive feedback. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Collaborate with other teams to ensure art requirements and plans are understood. Contribute creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 8+ total years in the games industry working in an environment art capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. 2+ years and at least 1 shipped title as a Lead Environment Artist. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Strong understanding of visual narratives and creating art assets in multiple major 3D and 2D packages (3DS Max or Maya and Photoshop or Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, PS, PC). Possesses in-depth understanding of game engines, pipelines, and processes. Rock-solid communication and problem-solving skills. Proven ability to thrive in an exciting and often ambiguous environment. Strong understanding of game art with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Inspiring portfolio demonstrating focus and commitment to realistic environment and current gen 2D/3D asset creation; ideally demonstrating various objects alone and assembled into compelling environments. Extra Points Familiarity with photogrammetry process, procedural content creation, or PBR workflows. Passion for the Call of Duty franchise. Strong traditional art foundation. History of playing a variety of game genres both digital and physical. About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered. Job Title Lead Game Designer/Engineer Requisition ID R014112 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Multiplayer Level Designer to work on our new FPS. Previous experience leading a highly talented team of multi-player focused designers while also providing a portfolio heavy on MP: FPS game and level design work is paramount. If you live for kick-ass MP gaming, can motivate a team, and have shipped AAA titles with awesome design aesthetics, then we are looking for you! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities You are a master of creating compelling multiplayer environments with an eye toward game balance, exploration, and fun You are extremely passionate about driving your vision throughout the stages of development: concept, block out, detail and initial lighting pass You are extremely proficient with 3D modeling in proprietary tools (Radiant, UDK, Hammer, etc.) and/or commercial 3D packages Must have proven track record of building striking levels using proprietary tools such as Radiant, Unreal, Source, Max, Maya, or similar within the game industry. Led a team of MP level designers from design concept through planning, iterating, play testing, and polishing of MP levels. Worked with designers to envision, design and manage MP design and meta game features and overall vision of game. Must have experience in 3D modeling with the ability to show detailed and polished geometry. Ability to conceptualize design ideas and communicate those ideas to the team. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Minimum of 2 AAA shipped titles in a Lead or Director role. A strong passion for and experience with First Person Shooters. Ability to motivate a team with positive leadership. Ability to conceptualize original game mechanics and level settings, and push them through to completion. Excellent communication skills both written and oral. The ability to quickly learn new engines and game technologies. Ability to dissect level and game design in recent games (discuss what you like/don't like). Strong documentation skills (show your organizational skills through your design docs). Background or education in game design, architecture, or traditional art a big plus. MOD Community experience a plus. We need to see demonstrable examples that will blow our minds. We are very selective, but it's worth it if you make the cut. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. R014112

Job Title Lead Mobile Security Engineer Requisition ID R018130 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland and Japan. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers are action-oriented and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Lead Mobile Security Engineer, you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a rapidly changing threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and quick reaction to emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming, analysis, and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an agile team of security experts, you are expected to be a subject matter expert. You will be working directly on game integrity in addition of our overall mobile security capabilities. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of mobile game features, ensuring known exploits are mitigated and potential threats are addressed. Work closely within the security team to identify the best course of action to proactively protect game features and implement countermeasures. Identify emerging threats, build remedial plans, and implement countermeasures in a timely manner; monitoring and measuring effectiveness of those efforts. Be a priority resource, working side-by-side with game engineers. Perform R&D into both new mobile security techniques and technologies, building a toolbox of robust capabilities. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Familiarity with reverse engineering and advanced debugging. Ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Familiarity with malware detection methods. Familiarity with mobile app stores and mobile applications distribution processes. Extensive knowledge of iOS and/or Android operating systems. Strong Java and/or Objective C development skills on mobile titles. Understanding of assembly code and lower-level iOS and/or Android operating systems. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Understanding of source control best practices, particularly hands-on knowledge of Perforce. Knowledge of social engineering Knowledge of malware analysis Knowledge of industry best practices for protecting applications and writing secure code. Security-oriented role on previously published games or apps. Working as part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Knowledge of networking protocols at low (TCP/IP, UDP) and high level (HTTP). Knowledge of packet capture techniques and interception proxies. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment.
