jobTitle: Lead Product Manager,. Live-Ops - Sledgehammer Games
jobDescription: Job Title Lead Product Manager,. Live-Ops - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R017547 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We'd like to speak with you! We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games, and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a Lead Product Manager you will drive the design and live-service merchandising vision across multiple Call of Duty features and products produced and contributed by the Sledgehammer Games studio. Your team will provide data-driven insights and designs to maximize engagement, retention and conversion in a player-focused live environment. You will partner with various external and internal partners at Activision and Sledgehammer Games to ensure the product strategy, creative vision, and player experience are fully optimized, while looking for new opportunities to grow player engagement. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Drive Strategy and Innovation - Look for new critical initiatives to drive and lead to implementation in the game. Event Strategy and Management - Help support events and come up with new ideas for how to deliver future events in COD. Business Opportunity Analysis - Find opportunities and develop supporting materials with quantitative and qualitative-driven insights, advocating for creative and innovative solutions to complex problems. Competitive Intelligence - Understand how different games operate their live services to help inform some of our strategic decisions. Data Analytics Initiatives - Find new ideas to A/B test to further the growth of the COD live services ecosystem. Performance Tracking - Monitor performance of live services promotions and initiatives to understand run rates / trends to help continue to grow COD live services. Be The Product Expert - Understand the player journey and create best-in-class messaging that lives both in-game and out, ensuring key selling features and product info is represented accurately in market with a strategic lens towards improving comprehension, conversion, and player satisfaction. Player Champion - embody the "player" view internally, driving a fan first viewpoint across the org and post-launch product plans; ensure that the player's voice helps drive the direction of the franchise. Player Profile 5+ years of experience in a senior product management role, preferably in gaming (console, PC, or mobile); interactive entertainment; technology; or consumer products. Extensive experience in feature or systems design, virtual economy management, and live operations. Knowledge & Skills Demonstrated ability to develop and shape an existing product by continuously seeking out and pursuing new opportunities. Data-driven attitude that is able to understand our player base and market trends and translate them into business opportunities. Proven ability to generate innovative ideas and solve complex problems while staying true to studio core values. Familiarity with behavioral economic concepts, data analysis, UX/UI, game systems design, and A/B testing. Ability to balance a data-driven attitude with creative problem solving, while maintaining a player-focused perspective. Exceptional business judgment with a strategic and analytical attitude. Excellent written and verbal communication skills – ability to articulate complex ideas and influence others. Key Attributes Ability to be a self-starter, leader and individual contributor on the team Ability to communicate well, in both small and large groups, across leadership levels Comfortable with giving and receiving candid feedback A deep passion for gaming and entertainment, particularly ones in the FPS genre Solid understanding of the latest gaming systems and industry trends Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience is required Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task with demonstrated performance of managing multiple projects at once Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Job Title Lead Technical Artist Requisition ID R018732 Job Description Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of high-caliber technical artists in developing responsive art tools and user-friendly workflow solutions for the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. You will be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. You will provide your team with guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Our Lead Technical Artists are role-models that not only manage the team through challenge and change, but also build up individuals into highly engaged, efficient, and effective teammates. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated leader to help tell our story. You Will… Collaborate with Artists, Designers, and Engineers to improve and expand upon content creation pipelines and tool sets. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Oversee project-level tech art development and drive initiatives to standardize solutions across the organization. Be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. Define team goals, action plans, and schedules for the project. Provide your team with consistent guidance, goals, opportunities, and resources. Lead, task, mentor and conduct one-to-one meetings with your Technical Artists. Empower artists and engineers to thrive on and welcome constructive feedback. Champion best practices and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Collaborate with other teams to ensure art requirements and plans are understood. Contribute creative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 8+ total years in the games industry working in an art capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. 2+ years and at least 1 shipped title as a Lead Technical Artist. Ability to lead by example echoed through a professional and egoless personality. Strong scripting or programming knowledge (Python, JavaScript, C#, C++, MEL) Possesses in-depth understanding of game engines, pipelines, and processes. Proven experience in several of the following: lighting, shading, VFX, environments, characters, physically based rendering (PBR), and content management & optimization. Good understanding of creating art assets in multiple major 3D and 2D packages (Maya or Houdini, and Photoshop or Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, PS, PC). Impressive communication and strong problem-solving skills. Proven ability to thrive in an exciting and quickly developing environment. Solid understanding of game art with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Extra Points Passion for the Call of Duty franchise. Experience with Maya OpenAPI, MaxScript, wxPython, PyQt, and P4Python. Experience with integrated solutions such as RealityCapture, Simplygon, Substance, etc. Strong traditional art foundation. History of playing a variety of game genres both digital and physical. About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered. The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Your Mission As a Lead UX Designer at Infinity Ward, you will use your user experience approach and creative design skills to build compelling and accessible interfaces for our games. You will contribute to the vision for how players experience the game for both online as well as single player experiences. In addition to leading a small team of UX Designers, you will work directly with the UX/UI Director, and the wider UI team to ensure that the game’s interface is easily understood and support the goals of the game. Priorities Can Often Change In a Fast-paced Environment Like Ours, So This Role Includes, But Is Not Limited To, The Following Responsibilities Lead the UX Design team to translate game systems and gameplay user experience goals into intuitive interfaces that support and enhance the game experience. Create conceptual wireframes, user flows diagrams and low-fidelity prototypes to communicate design concepts for discussion and testing purposes. Produce finished design specifications with detailed requirements and use cases for final game user interface, including in-game UI (e.g. HUD). Help implement design specifications to shippable quality. Work closely with producers and other stakeholders on scope estimates and schedules. Player Profile Responsibilities 5+ years of experience as an interface or user experience designer for games, software, mobile or web applications. 2+ years of leading a small team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and a solid understanding of user-centered design principles to design a complete interface for all game features that is functional, usable, appealing, and accessible. Awareness of trends in hardware and operating systems, interface design, interactive design, and competitive software to help identify opportunities for innovation. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and specifications to a broad range of team members from different disciplines. Solid skills with Figma, Framer, Sketch, Adobe XD or similar program. Job Title Lead Zombies Gameplay Engineer Requisition ID R017837 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a Lead Zombies Engineer with a passion for Zombies Gameplay to join our team in either Los Angeles, CA or Vancouver, BC. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the technical vision and strategy for the Zombies content in our games. The ideal candidate will be able to communicate this vision effectively to the Zombies Engineering team as well as across other groups such as the Animation and Design teams to bring innovative Zombies characters & game features to life. You will lead our Zombies engineering team by example, helping to choose, design, and implement cutting edge systems to accomplish this vision. As a successful engineer in this position, you should be able to quickly get familiar with existing codebases and systems and be able to implement elegant, high performing updates and extensions that work well within a collaborative environment. The candidate should have an eye for Gameplay technologies and a knack for understanding how to deliver exciting experiences that millions of fans are going to love. What You’ll Do... Work with and manage a Zombies engineering team to craft development of innovative Zombies content systems & experiences Implement, debug and optimize Zombies content systems in C/C++ and other languages Contribute ideas for new Zombies content technologies, architectures, and technical designs Perform data and code analysis to find opportunities for improvement Provide mentorship to less experienced engineers To succeed you should have... 10+ years of experience as an AI, Animation, and/or Gameplay Engineer (or similar experience) Shipped 3+ game titles Strong understanding of core CS algorithms and data structures Strong C/C++ skills Strong math proficiency Ability to collaborate with other engineers, designers, and game developers Ability to work well in a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges evolve We’d love it if you also have... Network engineering experience Expertise in one or more of the following areas: Animation, General Gameplay, UI/UX Experience with scripting languages Familiarity and practical experience with core AI technologies - Behavior trees, animation state machines, pathfinding and steering A passion for AI technologies, and an understanding of the AI & design principles behind games We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R017837

Job Title Legal Production Coordinator - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R018456 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK– we’re the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We truly believe in supporting our hard-working employees to be the best they can be. We'd like to speak with you! Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a Legal Production Coordinator you will assist our content creation teams in achieving our legal pipeline goals for Call of Duty game content. The Production Coordinator will work closely with our content leads to support legal scheduling, dependency management, issue tracking & help communicate legal progress to the rest of the teams and/or broader studios. The Production Coordinator will gain insight into our AAA game production legal processes and play a key role in facilitating those processes to provide our teams with what they need to excel. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Help our internal legal processes via production support, raising awareness of critical issues and following up with team members for resolutions. Supporting the live ops team with legal processing of game content and communication of their requirements based on schedule constraints. Provide hands-on Production support to our local legal team such as taking notes, updating schedules, and sending out studio-wide communications to report team progress. Assist in task, bug tracking and workflow management through our internal tools. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Desire to pursue a career in game production. General understanding of project management fundamentals (e.g. scheduling, tracking, reporting, risk management). Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook. Extra Points Previous work experience as a software development project manager Experience with a variety of project management tools (JIRA, Confluence, Shotgun, Microsoft Project experience is a plus). Some technical understanding of build pipelines and build management tools Took on a role as Producer / Project Manager for a creative project (e.g. school project, indie game, film, commercial, etc.). Job Title Level Design Internship - Treyarch Requisition ID R018400 Job Description Job Title: Level Design Intern Reporting To: Intern Design Director Department: Level Design Location: Playa Vista, CA As a Level Design Intern at Treyarch, you will join our Level Design Department and work on content for Call of Duty across our three level design teams: Multiplayer, Warzone, and Zombies. You will begin by familiarizing yourself with our proprietary Engine and learn important design principles that are specific to each of our 3 teams. You will then use this knowledge to develop a map of your own creation, taking it from a 2D top down into a 3D level. Finally, you will collaborate with the Level Design teams on actual Call of Duty production maps. What You’ll Do… This role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Collaborate with art and design to develop unique gameplay experiences and environments that adhere to our gameplay standards Design, create, and iterate on level maps from paper prototype to map completion Work with other level designers to identify and resolve gameplay issues Participate in company-wide playtests and provide feedback Demonstrate your creativity and passion for level design! To succeed you should have… Experience with video game development in professional, indie, or academic settings The ability to work as part of a team with an appreciation for collaboration The ability to take constructive feedback on your work and articulate constructive feedback on the work of others Basic knowledge of Photoshop/ Illustrator Familiarity with Call of Duty Multiplayer, Warzone, and Zombies gameplay and levels Familiarity using any 3D level building tools including Unreal, Unity, Max/Maya, etc. A willingness to learn. This internship is an opportunity for you to learn and grow as a designer and you will need to be open to new ideas and feedback. This is essential to AAA game development. We’d love it if you also have… A passion for FPS games Experience with the Radiant level editor MOD community experience Expertise in architecture Bachelor’s Degree Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects and include a breakdown specifying what you were directly responsible for creating. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We expect to be back in office for our summer 2023 internship and successful candidates will be expected to relocate and be onsite in Los Angeles for the duration of it. Treyarch will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R018400

Job Title Level Designer (Multiplayer) - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R018942 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history – and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are building a culture of collaboration and seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile Level Designer to join our team in Carlsbad, California. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Do… Own and design multiplayer levels from the ground up. Block out and build 3d levels through various phases of development. Research and be intimately familiar with the game's subject matter, locations, and architecture. Collaborate with the Systems Design team to support gameplay mechanics. Collaborate with other multiplayer level designers and environment artists to iterate on level designs. Prioritize well, meet deadlines and communicate progress of the level design with Leads and Directors frequently. To succeed you should have… Passion for shooters on Console and/or PC. Proven experience making fun, visually impressive 3d multiplayer levels for a first person shooter. Multiplayer map design & building experience. 3+ years of professional level design experience. Strong interpersonal skills: with communication, taking and understanding direction well, meeting deadlines, and mentoring more junior members of the team. Strong game design skills: should be able to thoughtfully discuss the strengths and weaknesses of recent games and list techniques used to make fun multiplayer FPS levels and systems. We’d love it if you also have… Drawing/art/Photoshop skills. Experience with common scripting languages (C#, Lua, Python, Unreal Script). Background or education in game design, architecture, or traditional art. MOD community experience. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Licensing Director, Consumer Products Requisition ID R018891 Job Description DIRECTOR, LICENSING ACTIVISION | BLIZZARD | KING Location Santa Monica / Irvine Position Type Full-time DIVISION AND DEPARTMENT Activision | Blizzard | King Consumer Products (ABK CP) is the business segment of Activision Blizzard that extends the suite of brands to merchandise ranging from fashion apparel and accessories, collectibles, home decor, electronic peripherals, books, food and beverages, stationery, animation art, and other categories. The ABK CP team is responsible for licensing characters and story created by Activision | Blizzard | King Studios. In addition and liaising with the Activision | Blizzard | King divisions, our retailer and licensing partners, it is responsible for driving brand collaborations, fandom experiences, and driving commercial reach. Description The Licensing Director for Hardlines and Consumables is responsible for managing Toys and Food, Health and Beauty product categories and the associated product sub-categories and licensees with the goal of meeting or exceeding predetermined revenue targets and growth objectives. They provide business vision and leadership, set strategic direction and leads his category teams to meet or exceed revenue targets, growth objectives and other brands initiatives. They should have a global attitude to business decisions to ensure initiatives yield globally strong financial results. Responsibilities Develop revenue for existing licensees and build meaningful white space opportunities Deliver meaningful collaborations with meaningful partnerships that meet the needs of studio teams Finance And Business Planning Build quarterly category forecast and yearly budgets and present to Senior Management. Develops and presents annual business plan and determines key objectives and priorities to insure project focus. Monitors progress on achieving strategies and modifies as necessary. Build yearly 5 years strategic plan and present to senior management. Support Franchise team to create annual brand plans. Have a global attitude with development of business plans. Brand And Content Management In conjunction with / support of the Franchise team: Provide any licensee /product information in support of marketing and brand presentations and sales meetings, Help defining and integrating licensees within wider brand and marketing plans Ensure seasonal creative strategies are sufficient to meet budget and initiative goals and objectives. Category Management Acts as ambassador for the category and maintains current knowledge of industry trends, competitors, business opportunities, threats and dynamics. Communicates findings to team and senior management. Accountable for category and property strategy within its segment to include the development of meaning marketing integration. Strategize and develop new business opportunities to include marketing to enhance product campaigns. Analyze account business performance and develop growth objectives that are aligned with CPG initiatives. Collaborate with other category team leads to ensure franchises are represented appropriately. Develop and implement product strategies, merchandising and marketing plans to ensure that sales are maximized and marketing objectives met. Lead the selection, contract negotiation, and day to day relationships with the Top Ten licensees, and ensure appropriate team management of the remaining licensees. Organize line reviews, develop retail exclusives and approves line lists for the Top Ten licensees. Product Development Set-up line review with licensees and Product Development team (Top 10). With Sales team define and plan product development for retailer exclusive products (Top 10). Prepare product presentations included but not limited to internal line reviews (Top 10). Ensures licensee product lines reflect Disney quality and brand/property objectives. (Top 10). Lead category portion of creative roll-out for appropriate licensees. Responsible for cost assessment, recommendation and control of brainstorm and product or packaging expenditures. Retail, Sales And Marketing Liaise with Sales Trade Marketing team to define account promotional and marketing plans and ensure licensee participation (Top 10 licensees). Develop strong relationships with key retailers to improve commercial and brand opportunities. Maintain general knowledge of the retail landscape and monitor retails sales performance of key licensees and programs. Management Perform general supervisory functions such as hiring, onboarding, coaching, performance management, development and operating expense control. Ensure the development of team members. Collaborates with functional heads on team member's development, performance and position specific succession plans. Leadership Builds strong team-oriented relationships with other key business units and regional partners that result in new business and/or cross-promotional opportunities. Ensures coordination with other categories, lines of business and departments. Education/Experience Bachelor's degree +10 yrs. of directly related experience or Masters +7 yrs. experience. At least 6 yrs. experience at the category mgr. level within Disney or 8 yrs. combined mgmt. experience (internal/external). Requirements/Qualifications Proven team management skills Demonstrated ability to manage large budgets Relationship builder Excellent communication & presentation skills Breakthrough thinker Entrepreneurial Excellent sales/negotiation skills Multi-task oriented Comprehensive knowledge of licensees' production and creative capabilities/limitations Ability to drive a vision with commercial results Ability to lead change We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Licensing Manager, Consumer Products Requisition ID R017418 Job Description Are you a hard worker at managing multiple projects, different teams of co-workers and processes? Are you able to obsess over details while keeping the big picture in mind? Do you thrive in a high-stakes and fluid work environment that requires creative problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to ensure that projects are delivered on time and to the highest standards? Does the idea of building a consumer products program for some of the most iconic franchises in the video game industry and esports excite you?? Are you the person we're looking for? Role Description Reporting to the Director of Global Consumer Products, with a dotted line to the VP of Consumer Products – Esports, the Licensing Manager will be immersed in the company’s iconic video game franchises, such as Call of Duty, Overwatch, World of Warcraft, Crash Bandicoot, our best-in-class esports leagues, and other Activision Blizzard King franchises. The Licensing Manager will be responsible for leading assigned product categories by working with licensing partners and esports leagues/teams while simultaneously aligning with game team objectives, Consumer Marketing, Product Marketing, Retail (including ecommerce), Legal and other cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate for this role has Category Licensing experience across several categories, industry experience, go-to market and retail experience (including ecommerce), excellent organizational and time-management skills, a strong sense of commitment to, and personal ownership of, the responsibilities assigned to them, and ability to collaborate creatively and strategically. Duties And Responsibilities Direct and manage the development, proposing, overseeing and implementation of short and long-term strategies for assigned categories Participate and contribute to the planning process. Develop strategies and business plans across properties and retailers Independent creation of compelling presentation materials (e.g., PowerPoint, Excel) in support of brand and category management. Research & understand competitive landscape. Analyze and understand market trends, consumer and retailer and industry needs. Analyze account business performance and develop/drive growth objectives that are aligned with LRP and AOP initiatives Collaborate with our internal retail marketing teams to ensure product launches are improved with high level of retail support Fiscal responsibility for assigned categories to include annual budget planning and quarterly revenue forecasting (setting annual AOP targets, obtaining and reviewing quarterly forecasts) Manage day-to-day with licensees for the assigned categories, which includes contract negotiation, resolving issues, and promotional/advertising initiatives Manage all communications follow-up (day-to-day and periodic) with multiple levels of internal esports league internal partners and teams Oversee and ensure timely approvals of licensee’s submissions by collaborate with Licensees to build line plans (ensuring appropriate sku count, price point and brand initiatives are improved), provide DRM oversight, from conceptual to launch, to ensure Licensee product lines reflect Activision Blizzard King quality and brand/property objectives Collaborate across internal teams to align on priorities, ensure quality, brand consistency, and product execution for defined distribution windows Requirements Minimum of 4 years of licensing experience with contract negotiations and licensee management. Understands the brand’s consumer, product and print innovations, drives quality and champions innovation in product development to ensure lines are commercially viable for all territories while meeting retailer needs Solid understanding of brand and property positioning in the retail environment Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Proven expertise managing licensees on a day-to-day basis, particularly in apparel, accessories, and experience with hardlines / publishing is a plus. Strong understanding of culturally relevant brands and experience in developing fashion brand collaborations Mastery of MS Office Programs Ability to work and thrive in a globally-oriented environment Ability to collaborate and influence cross-functional highly matrixed teams (such as development, creative, marketing, legal, etc.) Able to function in a fast-paced Finance and Business Planning driven environment Comfortable with “hands-on” management of tasks, and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously with aggressive deadlines Ability to work and thrive in a team environment with various internal groups Solid relationships in the licensing industry Experience identifying and pitching best-in-class licensees Excellent verbal, written communication and formal presentation skills Bachelor’s degree Passion for video games a plus We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Lighting Internship Requisition ID R017317 Job Description Lighting Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Experience using lighting/rendering technologies (pre-rendered and/ or real-time). Strong traditional art skills. Basic understanding of photography. Experience in Autodesk Maya/Max, and Adobe Photoshop. jobDescription: Job Title Lighting Lead - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009777 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Infinity Ward, developer of numerous award winning games, is seeking a Senior Lighting Artist, with experience in game development and an interest in working with next-generation technologies. If you are a Senior Lighting Artist and have experience shipping AAA titles with visually stunning lighting aesthetics, then we are looking for you! Responsibilities Work with Level Designers, Environment Artists, Visual Effects Artists, and Team Leads to provide lighting for game environments and characters Creation of static and dynamic lighting using our proprietary game engine software Generate visually stunning creative solutions that are within memory and performance guidelines Ownership of level lighting process from initial look dev to final polish pass Solve technical issues that arise with tools, process or game performance Help to maintain standards for physically correct lighting across teams and studios Support the content and data acquisition process for skies and materials Provide mentorship to other team members in specific areas of expertise Requirements 4+ years of real-time lighting experience on pc or current console hardware Solid understanding and experience with runtime and pre-baked lighting techniques Ability to be self-motivated and self-directed Experience and understanding of current “industry standard” real-time PBR techniques Solid understanding of photography, camera terminology, exposure, and light Understanding of composition and the ability for lighting to enhance mood and gameplay Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to communicate effectively with both Artists and Engineers on large teams Knowledge of color theory, HDR techniques, and how to use light and shadow to create form Ability to follow design reference, mood pieces, concept art and implement Art Directors vision Experience with one or more scripting/programming languages Coding and shader writing experience a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title Manager – COD Marketing Finance Requisition ID R018699 Job Description Your Mission Responsibilities The role will be a key business partner to the Head of Call of Duty Marketing, and provide finance support to the entire Activision Publishing marketing organizations, supporting the iconic first-person shooter Call of Duty franchises (which includes the storied Modern Warfare & Black Ops franchises and now Warzone) focusing on the following responsibilities Activision is looking for a highly motivated, energetic and financially minded individual to join the Activision Publishing Finance team and manage the Call of Duty marketing budget. This will be a dynamic and highly visible position that will involve strategy and financial analysis. Own the global management and forecasting of the Call of Duty franchise marketing budget in partnership with the Call of Duty finance leadership Partner with growth marketing business performance unit and Call of Duty business unit to drive governance process around marketing spend and return on investment analysis Lead marketing budget process for the annual operating plan, quarterly forecast, and long range planning processes Become an inspiring leader/partner to drive the evolution of our marketing priorities and organization with Call of Duty leadership Work across our Emerging franchise (Crash, Spyro, Tony Hawk!) division to provide additional marketing support Work with marketing organization to evaluate return on investment of building internal capabilities vs external solution Develop and maintain strong relationships with a wide variety of business partners across the marketing and finance organizations P&L Management with an eye towards influencing long-term investments, driving cost savings and identifying efficiencies. Assist with the execution of launch & seasonal marketing plans Partner with HR to monitor hiring trends and ensure teams are adequately supported Drive process improvement across core finance and business processes Help with other ad-hoc projects that arise in this fast paced, ever-changing industry Player Profile The Key Qualifications For This Role Include 5+ years of proven experience in marketing finance, strategy, FP&A, brand finance, or related area Maximising analytical capabilities, the successful candidate will be a strong cross-functional collaborator and help drive key operational decisions and investments. Strong personal presence and communication to work across finance, marketing and executive leadership in pursuit of business goals History of cross functional work with strong relationship management Strong analytical and critical thinking; ability to communicate sophisticated concepts at a high level to executive leadership Comfort working at multiple altitudes, from high-level projects to detailed engagement analysis Knowledge of marketing KPIs, audience segmentation, and advertising value chain Strong financial modeling Understanding of user acquisition and target prioritization Strong user of Excel, PowerPoint and financial management tools Strong finance, eye for business and general analytical skills Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities simultaneously Experience within a gaming, entertainment or technology industry is preferred Bachelor’s Degree in a related field (advanced degree or certification a plus) High energy; passion for games is a plus We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Manager, Battle.net and PC Commercial Requisition ID R017658 Job Description Manager, Battle.net and PC Commercial Activision Blizzard is looking for an experienced and driven individual with the right mix of formal business leadership skills, passion for gaming, and experience in a high-tech and data-driven environment for our headquarters in Santa Monica, CA or in our Blizzard offices in Irvine, CA. In this role, you will work closely with Battle.net product teams, Activision and Blizzard business units, as well as regional offices and across the global Commercial Organization. Your primary objective is to grow monetization for Battle.net. Ideally, you will have experience working on direct-to-consumer digital content platforms and will have a deep understanding of consumer behavior in order to drive commercial success. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Battle.net and PC Commercial. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’re currently in a work-from-home model, and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position but will transition to at least a partial in-office position based out of Irvine, CA. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. Job Description Summary of Position Assist in leading all PC digital commerce related activity across Battle.net, Steam, Good old Games and Epic Games Primary objective is to grow total PC business across ABK with a focus on topline revenue Merchandising Planning and Strategy Help with handling communication with all game publishing teams that are on Battle.net through weekly meetings to ensure the platform is hitting key beats across all franchises, including gaining alignment on Battle.net merchandising support plans. Assist in commercial strategy and priorities meeting with editorial team and constantly discuss support plans to gain internal alignment on plans. Support all internal and external meetings with Battle.net and Steam; serve as one of the point contacts for all 3P distribution+ PC Go-to-Market Assist in leading Battle.net, Steam and other PC digital distribution GTM strategy for all PC releases which includes negotiating for merchandising placements on Steam and other PC digital distribution partners, and securing all placements on Battle.net for major releases and product beats Contribute to Battle.net Commercial Review meeting bi-monthly Build and support product launch recaps across Battle.net and Steam releases New product launch prices, Full game download and DLC Global Pricing & Currency Management Assist in maintaining master PC platforms pricing documents and ensure Battle.net pricing is consistent across all PC franchises and SKUs Help coordinate with regional finance leads and publishing leads to recommend and finalize all PC pricing across Battle.net and Steam Account for fluctuations and supervise global FX currency fluctuations and recommend pricing adjustments when vital PC Promotional Planning Assist in running all Battle.net platform level sales (BF, Holiday, Summer Sale, etc.) and work with franchise teams to design discounts and SKUs to be included. Maintain master share promo document for PC titles Plan and implement all catalog promotional pricing plan with Steam, Epic Games and Good old Games Create and submit discount lists across all PC titles and platforms Put together PC promo recaps highlighting sales performance / reporting Minimum Requirements Undergraduate degree level education in business or related field 3+ years of validated experience in a business role supporting AAA products Strong competence in analyzing data and drawing practical business insight Validated experience taking business initiatives from conception to launch Outstanding communications, project management, and relationship-building skills; able to communicate effectively with software developers and business leaders alike Confirmed ability to work well in a team environment and handle multiple sophisticated projects with diverse groups Consistent track record of exerting influence without authority Comfortable with uncertainty Passionate about Blizzard and Activision games (PC gaming is a bonus!) Pluses MBA Combination of game development and game publishing experience Experience working outside the United States We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. R017658

Job Title Manager, Live Ops Analytics Requisition ID R018428 Job Description Job Title: Manager, Live Ops Analytics Reporting To: Sr. Manager, Live Ops Analytics Department: Global Analytics Location: Santa Monica Your Mission Is The Live Ops Analytics team is adding a talented individual to manage a team of Data Analysts embedded within our partner game studios. As a manager on the Live Ops Analytics team, it is your mission to deliver game critical analytics and reporting to our studios. Responsibilities Include Work closely with various stakeholders to investigate topics related to player experience, game performance, systems tuning and overall business strategy Recruit, train, develop and lead a team of data analysts Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities Oversee the design and delivery of dashboards and reports that analyze key studio operation and performance metrics Ensure accuracy of data and deliverables completed by the team Utilize analysis and studies prepared by the team that improve long-term decision making Deliver presentations on analytic topics and results to both technical and non-technical audiences What You Will Bring To The Team The ideal candidate will be a motivated data expert who is able to effectively lead a team of analysts to help deliver insights and recommendations to the business. Your success will be reflected by: Demonstrated business impact, with a focus on player engagement, and player experience Clear, concise, and data-driven insights leading to the optimization of game systems Relationships & communication – as the team manager, you build trust between the studios, leadership, and other live services cross functional teams and are a conduit of knowledge to & from Global Analytics Player Skills BA/BS degree required with a technical focus (e.g., computer science, physics, engineering) Proven leadership skills with 2+ years of experience leading a team of Analysts or Data Scientists Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively work in cross-functional teams Strong SQL skills along with experience using R or Python for data analysis Understanding of AB testing and quasi-experiment methodologies Skilled at being able to derive the narrative from the data and tell convincing stories Gameplay analysis experiences a plus, with a solid understanding of user engagement and monetization strategies in gaming, entertainment, ecommerce service providers, or mobile apps We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all the qualifications? Let us decide! Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivalled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. Our World Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! Ask anyone who works at Activision, or with Activision, their favorite thing about it, and they’ll tell you, it’s the people. We have world class brands, infrastructure and resources, but our success doesn’t come from assembly lines producing widgets. Our success comes from people producing greatness together. We are nothing without our employee’s brilliance. So, if you’re interested in our biggest priority, it’s the people. Activision is more than just the leading developer and publisher of video games; we are the creators of some of the world’s biggest, most ground-breaking titles in the industry. Our portfolio includes Call of Duty® and Crash Bandicoot™. Activision is a division of Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ: ATVI), headquartered in Santa Monica, California with locations across the globe. Activision Blizzard is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment. Job Title Manager, Operations Requisition ID R018351 Job Description Job Title: Manager, Operations Reporting To: Director, Operations Department: Solid State Studios Location: Santa Monica preferred Your Mission Welcome to Solid State Studios. We’re a new in-house studio, dedicated to developing the best AAA mobile games in the world. Our first project is a new AAA mobile title, Call of Duty®: Warzone™ Mobile and we’re looking for great talent from mobile, console and PC backgrounds passionate about their work, who share our belief in what AAA experiences on mobile can and should be. We’re incredibly excited to build out our teams and get to work, and invite you to join us in making something special! Your Profile As the Operations Manager at Solid State Studios, you will lead multiple projects across our studio as well as support across governance, legal, planning, staffing, and other operations needs. You will be responsible for coordinating the contribution of operational plans from multiple studios to the delivery of key mobile initiatives. The operations role captures facilities, team health, central service coordination, and a wide around of process improvement, including but not limited to documentation efforts, P&L updates and product decisions that affect them, modifications to central team processes to enable mobile development pace and tracking, and general sharing and improvement of best practices across the mobile team, all of Activision, and all of ABK. You will work to ensure our standardized practices are well developed and distributed to our teams, and often be brought in on projects to address pain points that develop as we grow and scale. You will ensure consistent knowledge-sharing, learning, documentation, as well as improving tools and processes as necessary for all teams on the project to excel. Build, monitor and augment communication and operational processes between multiple studios co-developing critical titles Proactively and consistently evaluate operational and development process and efficiencies across the project, including augmenting and creating governance processes where necessary Manage overall headcount allocations and updates between multiple studios, to optimize hiring capabilities and team development (with Recruiting and Finance teams) With Finance and Solid State Operations, review and update project external contract spending, and reconcile with forecasts, providing overall project reforecasts quarterly With project and studio leads, evaluate plans and identify upcoming conflicts or resource constraints to meet project goals Coordinate operational planning with central Studio Ops team, including governance schedules, headcount planning and financial planning Improve existing (and develop new) processes for onboarding, purchasing, and contractual planning across studios engaged in co-developing critical titles Minimum Requirements A passion for process, excellence and achievement 2-3 yrs relevant experience managing complex projects and proven track record of success Leadership/Management role in game development process, on corporate or studio side Strong critical-thinking, organization, time management and analytical skills. Excellent communication, presentation and people alignment skills Experience with project planning and change management Breadth of experience with gaming functions - production, marketing, design Ability to multitask under severe deadlines Work in a fast-paced environment that requires frequent shift in focus Experience in console/PC and mobile game development and marketing We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. R018351

Job Title Team Name: Manager, People Technology (Workday HCM) Requisition ID R013815 Job Description Job Title: Manager, People Technology (Workday HCM) Reports To: Director, People Technology Division/Department: Human Resources Location: Santa Monica, CA; Irvine, CA; Remote Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts' agility, creativity and difficulty to improve the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission The Manager, People Technology provides leadership and champions partnership across the HR organization to craft, configure, test, implement, maintain, communicate, and train the organization to optimally improve our HR Technology Solutions, while also ensuring data integrity, security, and operational precision. Additionally, this role will partner with the HR specialist functions including HR Business Partners, Benefits, Payroll, Finance, and other key partners to ensure high-quality execution of HR programs and processes. HR Systems managed by People Technology include Workday, Workday Recruit, Eightfold (CRM), Phenom People (career sites), and others. The position will be based in Southern California (remote options available). You will be primarily focused on and require in-depth experience in Core HCM, Performance and Talent, Reporting, and Security. Knowledge of Time Tracking and Absence would be a plus. You will manage a team of People Technology Analysts and will assist in the appropriate handling of highly confidential matters and materials. Duties And Responsibilities You will lead and configure cyclical HR processes, deployment of new modules, improvements, and expanded offerings in our HR Systems You will collaborate with business partners to prioritize projects, develop business cases/proposals for new capabilities/improvements Balance multiple systems & projects at a time, across functional areas and global locations Build strong internal relationships with key HR, IT, and business leaders to define and understand strategic and tactical HR Technology requirements Identify and recommend technical solutions to address opportunities to improve existing processes Ensures local HR systems and processes are documented and aligned with HR strategies, policies, and governmental regulations Drives deepening and broadening of system knowledge for greater user adoption and experience You will be a hands-on, working manager performing impact analysis, configuration in the system, cross-training with team members Project planning and management as needed Player Profile Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required (degree in Business or Human Resources field preferred) Experience: 5 years of previous HR Tech/HRIS experience is required. Experience with Workday HCM, Security, and Position Management required. Experience with full life cycle HR Technology related projects Extra Points Ability to quickly learn concepts and understand process configuration in a system. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an eye for detail and accuracy; ability to do root cause analysis to guide decisions and action plans where limited foundational/framework exists. Build and maintain strong relationships with cross-functional HR leaders, business leaders and employees We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title MBA Intern - Analytics & Tech Strategy Requisition ID R016904 Job Description MBA Internship – Analytics & Tech Strategy   Your Platform  We are recruiting for the next class of Activision Blizzard’s summer MBA interns. These participants will work in critical roles across Activision Blizzard, Activision Publishing, and Blizzard Entertainment in Southern California. They will contribute to key business functions, while developing networks and experiences designed to accelerate their careers. The Global Insights & Analytics internships (Blizzard) are based in Irvine, CA. The Tech Strategy internships (Activision) are based in Santa Monica, CA.    2023 MBA summer interns in these roles will have the opportunity to return to their summer internship team for a fulltime opportunity and/or apply to the Rotation Program. Player Profile   Currently enrolled in MBA program and graduating by May/June of 2024.   3+ years full-time work experience.   Demonstrated experience in project management and the ability to work collaboratively across multiple teams.    Ability to steer others through influence and teamwork signifying advanced interpersonal and relationship management skills.   Skillfully use data to research complex information and produce summaries utilizing excellent numerical and statistical skills.   Can move nimbly between strategy and execution.   Superb presentation skills with the ability to adjust to various audiences ranging from senior leaders, external partners, and cross functional peers.    Self-motivated and driven.   Prior experience in consulting, business development, organizational effectiveness.  Candidates must be available for a 10-week internship starting mid-June    Your Mission/Internship Opportunities Global Insights & Analytics - MICI and Player Insights    The Global Insights team informs critical business decisions through in-depth analysis of gameplay, business, and operational data, for example, helping to create and define performance benchmarks, develop ROI models to measure financial impact of key initiatives, and monitor the competitive landscape to identify external factors affecting business trends. The ideal candidate is ready to make an immediate, meaningful impact with data. Intern will have a passion for gaming and strong interest to learn about Blizzard games, products, and services. They will be comfortable with the practical application of statistical models and have a thirst to drink form the fire hose of data to make sense of it.   To ramp up quickly over the 10 weeks, we suggest that students have previous experience analyzing data. We also suggest that they be deeply familiar with console games (mid – hard core) and the gaming industry for this specific role.   Make an immediate and meaningful impact with data Inform critical business decisions through in-depth analysis of gameplay, business, and operational data, for example, helping to create and define performance benchmarks, develop ROI models to measure financial impact of key initiatives, and monitor the competitive landscape to identify external factors affecting business trends In most cases, projects will be determined based on the strengths and areas of interest of the selected candidate Tech Strategy  The Central Technology team serves as the strategic partner for game development studios in the areas of online services, engine tools, graphics, systems engineering, security, and infrastructure. We support all aspects of the development process from build pipeline to launch, collaborating with studios on best practices in technology and architecture to help build franchises and the Activision IP portfolio. All the while, we also serve as the bridge to the publishing organization to align game technical development with 1st party management, analytics, product management, marketing, and public relations.   Engage in various strategic technology planning and analytics to develop key processes, procedures, and recommendations across Activision and its studios Craft strategies and execution plans related to strategic development initiatives ranging from, but not limited to, aligning our technology capabilities, and streamlining processes to diving into our live operations tools roadmap. This team requires extensive cross-group coordination and will be an opportunity to develop deep internal relationships across the organization Support strategy and planning for technology initiatives across Call of Duty development Think strategically at a global level and effectively develop key processes, procedures and communications that facilitate planning and execution of key technology priorities for COD  Execute on extensive cross-group coordination, excellent communication skills, operational excellence, strong understanding/aptitude for technology and the ability to build strong internal/external relationships   Our World  Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!    Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment.  We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!    The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.    Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Mobile Security Engineer Requisition ID R018681 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland and Japan. This role is expected to begin and continue as a remote position or an interim remote position if desired. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers are action-oriented and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Mobile Security Engineer, you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a rapidly changing threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and quick reaction to emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming, analysis, and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an agile team of security experts, you are expected to be a subject matter expert. You will be working directly on game integrity in addition of our overall mobile security capabilities. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of mobile game features, ensuring known exploits are mitigated and potential threats are addressed. Work closely within the security team to identify the best course of action to proactively protect game features and implement countermeasures. Identify emerging threats, build remedial plans, and implement countermeasures in a timely manner; monitoring and measuring effectiveness of those efforts. Be a priority resource, working side-by-side with game engineers. Perform R&D into both new mobile security techniques and technologies, building a toolbox of robust capabilities. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Familiarity with reverse engineering and advanced debugging. Ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Familiarity with malware detection methods. Familiarity with mobile app stores and mobile applications distribution processes. Extensive knowledge of iOS and/or Android operating systems. Strong Java and/or Objective C development skills on mobile titles. Understanding of assembly code and lower-level iOS and/or Android operating systems. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Understanding of source control best practices, particularly hands-on knowledge of Perforce. Knowledge of social engineering Knowledge of malware analysis Knowledge of industry best practices for protecting applications and writing secure code. Security-oriented role on previously published games or apps. Working as part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Knowledge of networking protocols at low (TCP/IP, UDP) and high level (HTTP). Knowledge of packet capture techniques and interception proxies. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title Mobile System Programmer - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R016262 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously disrupted the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. With a history of delivering iconic game changers -- like Pitfall®, Tony Hawk®, Guitar Hero®, Crash Bandicoot™, Skylanders™ and Call of Duty® -- our obsession is delighting our players around the globe. Focused and committed to innovation, we consistently deliver the most beloved, engaging and successful entertainment. And while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a passionate, talented and diverse team of people producing greatness together. So, if you’re interested in our biggest priority, it’s our people. We’re currently driving the next era for our company and community by creating amazing experiences for fans and continuing to make Activision an inclusive place where everyone can thrive. Join us, make history. To learn more, check us out at www.activision.com, www.activisiongamesblog.com or @Activision on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Your Mission Activision is currently looking for a Systems Engineer (Programmer) to join the Mobile Team to work on a new mobile title. We are looking for an individual who has a passion and proven track record for building and launching great games. As a System Programmer you will architect, implement, refactor, optimize and maintain a variety of game, tool- and low-level systems specifically for Mobile platforms including: pipelines, memory management, performance, integrations of SDKs and more. You will be a direct part of a core team but collaborate with a global team. Your goals and responsibilities include ensuring Engine Systems play well on Mobile platforms, some of which will be adapted from other platforms and some which will be architected and implemented from scratch by you with guidance from Technical leadership. Qualified candidates need to be self-starters, able to operate in a highly dynamic environment. You report in to a Technical Director, who you will work with to ensure implementation aligns with strategy and priorities. Responsibilities Design, implement, debug, optimize and refine game and engine systems, features, pipelines, tools and infrastructure as needed Perform research to acquire new knowledge necessary to perform assigned tasks and maintain a process of technological evolution with a Mobile platform focus Communicate with other departments within the team and Activision global community to improve existing tools and determine new solutions Player Profile 5+ years programming experience Contributed extensively to the development of one or more game projects, PC, Console or Mobile Demonstrated proficiency in and knowledge of C/C++, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques Demonstrated ability to write clean, readable, portable, reliable, and optimized code on multi-platform projects Experience working on multi-platform software projects Ability to research, analyze and optimize code to meet performance requirements Excellent communications skills Extra Points Some familiarity with current Mobile rendering APIs and architecture Knowledge of computer game technologies including: AI programming, physics, 3D programming, animation, collision detection, network programming Familiarity with multi-threading and optimization Experience of working in cross- or remote-studio environment Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™.
