Job Title Motion Capture Internship Requisition ID R017318 Job Description Motion Capture Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile  Must be a current student pursuing their bachelors, masters, or PhD and graduating May 2023 or later. Available for a 12-week internship starting on May 28th or June 24th. Excellent communication skills and an ability to work on a multi-disciplinary team. Ability to take direction well and address notes. Passionate about learning what it takes to be a successful engineer in the video game industry. Candidates must apply with a resume and a link to their code samples/portfolio to be considered. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Internship Opportunities Motion Capture Internship: You will work with Infinity Ward's Motion Capture team in Los Angeles or Raven Software’s Motion Capture team in Wisconsin to create animation assets to test in-development tools and pipeline. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and complete animation goals of the group while assisting on their motion capture acquisition shoots, and on production assets. Learn and follow industry standards and standard processes of a multi-disciplinary Research and Development team. Experience with Maya and/or Motion Builder, Blade, Faceware, other relevant software. Understanding of realistic human character animation. Very diligent and organized with a positive, pro-active and self-motivated attitude. Excellent communication skills and an ability to work on a multi-disciplinary team. Knowledge of Python or other scripting experience is a plus. Knowledge of FACS, human facial anatomy, facial animation and related topics will help you level up, quickly. Character Tech Art Internship (Egerton Internship): The Egerton Internship is an opportunity within Activision’s Central Tech group in Los Angeles, created in honor of a long-time Activision artist and animator, Jamie Egerton, whom we recently lost after an 18-month battle against brain cancer. His wry sense of humor was combined with an unsurpassed work ethic and critical eye. He drove us to work harder, create new ways of doing things, and shake our heads as much as laugh. He was an irreplaceable team member, and a good friend. Jamie worked in the MoCap studio on every Call of Duty title that Treyarch has made, as well as many other games. We’ll miss his presence in the office and his Transformers Jeep in the parking lot. It’s a big pair of boots to step into, but we’re looking for a promising and tough-minded student to carry on his work here with us. This internship is a unique opportunity to get hands-on experience with character art, animation, rigging, and some of our newest game asset creation pipelines as part of our MoCap R&D team.  Cover letter required. Solid understanding of a game engine (Unity/Unreal) or C++ and object-oriented programming practices. Experience with Maya and Photoshop. Experience with realistic human character art/animation. Experience with Motion Builder, Blade, Z-Brush, Agisoft, Faceware and other relevant software. Knowledge of Motion Capture, FACS, human facial anatomy, facial animation and related topics are a plus. Your Mission  Collaborate with our Capture Studio teams, assisting with day-to-day development issues, identifying problems and finding creative solutions. Working with software such as Maya, MotionBuilder, and Photoshop, as well as custom and proprietary software and tools. You’ll create rigs, character art, animation and other assets to test in-development tools and pipelines. You’ll be cleaning up, modifying, and QC-ing facial/body animation and performance capture data - working directly with the department Directors to identify and complete the art/animation goals of the group. Assist on our motion capture and actor likeness acquisition shoots, and on production assets. Participate in learning and development tech talks to understand how our employees come together to launch AAA games. Our World  Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Job Title Multimedia Specialist Requisition ID R017968 Job Description RAVEN SOFTWARE, developer of numerous award-winning games, including contributions to the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise is looking for a talented and passionate Multimedia Specialist to join our team. The Media Specialist will be responsible for capturing and editing game footage for demos and internal trailers, logging and editing footage into reference reels, and producing motion graphics for pre-visualization. This is the opportunity to join our highly creative team on a 12-month contract role, with opportunities to be extended or go full time. You will work closely with and utilize the talents of teams such as Audio, Animation, and Concept Art. Successful applicants should have a solid background in both motion graphics and media editing. Knowledge of working within game engines to create and capture media content is highly desired. Job Duties Work with the Creative Director and development teams on all creative concepts and projects Work within the game engine to capture and edit game footage for demos and internal trailers Collect, log, and edit footage info reference reels Animate layered concept art into 2.5D vignettes Collaborate with development & narrative teams on storyboarding and animatics Support the Animation and Design teams on gameplay scene pre-visualization Design and build multimedia presentations in PowerPoint for both development and company meetings Work with social media teams communicating within our social media platforms on development and studio updates Work with our tech teams to provide feedback and development of better media and capture tools Collaborate with the Activision media teams and external experts in both technical support and creative feedback to create exciting trailers that promote the game Qualifications Video experience and a degree in Film, Digital Media, or related field Has a strong desire to grow and learn new skills through training, mentoring, and experimenting on the job. Expert in video editing and motion graphics suites, such as Adobe Premiere, Final Cut Pro and Adobe After Effects. Expert knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. Experience with audio design and editing. Experience with PowerPoint and a willingness to dig deep into its creative capabilities. Good knowledge of game development and working within the game engine to capture and create game play media assets Knowledge and love of our games. Must be able to provide demo reel/portfolio demonstrating video, motion design and post-production skills. Located in Madison, Wisconsin, RAVEN SOFTWARE offers an upscale work environment with state-of-the-art workstations, competitive compensation, generous benefits, highly skilled teammates, affordable living, and an exceptional quality of life. R017968

Job Title Narrative Director - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R018600 Job Description Description: Sledgehammer Games, an award-winning studio behind such titles as Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty: WW2, and Call of Duty: Vanguard, is looking to find an exceptional individual to oversee the studio’s Narrative Department. We’re looking for a talented developer who can help lead the team and explore new ways to deliver unique and exciting stories within our titles. You’ll have a unique opportunity to help define the narrative vision within the studio and how we communicate our worlds and stories to players. The narrative director's role is to define the narrative vision, and drive the development of the overall story, characters, and setting in collaboration with the other creative leads. You will work with the creative director, the narrative designers, and the larger development team to make sure that the story is being told in the best way possible. This is a highly collaborative position and will require working with all disciplines within the studio to help define how story is integrated. We at Sledgehammer believe that our stories are made richer and more interesting when they’re created by people from all walks of life. We’d like to encourage everyone to apply for this exciting opportunity if you feel like your unique experiences and vision for game development can bring something new to the team. COVID-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model, and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. Responsibilities Set the Narrative Vision and strategy for the product Build and direct a writing and narrative design team Maintain, safeguard, and champion the narrative. Partner closely with creative leads and producers to integrate the story into all aspects of the game. Mentor and develop others on the narrative and wider design team in narrative design principles and methodologies Have a passion for interactive storytelling. Maintain narrative documentation to constantly reflect the latest iterations in the vision. Requirements Excellent written and verbal communications skills Excellent organizational skills and able to work well under deadlines Work and thrive in a collaborative team environment Knowledge of industry trends and successful intellectual properties Plays and has knowledge of modern video game storytelling techniques Demonstrated proficiency and experiences in the field of interactive direction. Willingness to explore, or experience in exploring, narrative designs that puts more of the story in the player’s hands. An excellent understanding of narrative systems and structures. Strong understanding of narrative-related pipelines. Familiarity with common scheduling, task, and issue tracking tools. Able to create, manage, and help track schedules for a team of Narrative Designers. Self-motivated and pro-active with a strong work ethic. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R018600

Job Title Physics Engineer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R015874 Job Description Your Mission Infinity Ward is looking for a talented Physics Engineer. This Engineer will maintain and improve upon our proprietary physics framework, pipeline and feature-set, all built around Microsoft's Havok. They should possess strong practical knowledge of C/C++ at both low and application levels and have a good understanding of 3D math. Direct experience with Havok is a plus Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Demonstrated ability to write efficient, performant, clean, readable, portable, and reliable code Passion for games About Infinity Ward Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. As a thought leader and hands on mentor within the Live Ops Team, your mission is to put the science into product decision making. with evolving our data science & experimentation roadmap for all science & analytics teams Develop novel science and experimentation to deduce and draw conclusions from player behavioral data that Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics etc.) 10+ years total experience in analytics with 2+ years as a Principal Data Scientist or Director Outstanding technical skills with SQL, R/ Python strategies in gaming, entertainment/ecommerce service providers, or mobile apps a plus Demonstrated programming skills either in data science or software development settings a plus Authority at deriving narrative from data and communicate the results effectively Experience with predictive and prescriptive modeling a plus but not a core responsibility of the role Extra Points Consistently demonstrates ability to identify and meet the needs of others across the company Guiding teams to be agile in response to change and to solve complex problems Being active in the industry, recognized for application of science to games & entertainment Delivering breakthrough analytical projects resulting in feature development, measurable engagement or revenue impact Exemplifies multifaceted abilities – data science, experimentation, analysis, engineering, econometrics etc. Being an elite champion for standard methodologies within the analytics, data and engineering teams Provides Job Title Principal Engineer, Machine Learning Requisition ID R015784 Job Description Job Description: Job Title: Principal Engineer, Machine Learning Reporting To: Distinguished Technology Fellow Department: Central Technology Location: Flexible Position Description We are looking for engineers and scientists with expertise in machine learning (ML) to join Activision Publishing’s (AP) Central Technology (CT) organization. Activision’s CT organization provides global leadership, engineering support, analysis, and recommendations across various specialized disciplines for AP’s studios and projects. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning and deep learning (DL) models in use cases such as recommender systems. This role will be instrumental in developing a new generation of tools enabling the Activision content creators to build the large worlds powering the next evolution of Call of Duty and Warzone. The focus will be on developing systems and workflows to suggest and assist with model placement, level layout, scene annotation and other creative and technical choices needed to bring large and complex environments to life. Specific Responsibilities Include Analyze the substantial amounts of existing data in previously built worlds and games. Suggest areas suited for machine learning applications and help implement the solutions. Expose solutions to the content creation teams in an accessible and user-friendly way Stay up to date with current developments in the field and help integrate academic solutions into a production environment. Build a small team of talent to grow and support the applications of machine learning to assist in content creation. Year One Success Significant transformation of day-to-day workflow for content creators by building systems that allow more flexible and efficient approaches to authoring content. A framework to allow for easier development and deployment of solutions to new problem areas. Position Requirements The Principal Engineer, Machine Learning should have an established record of working with ML and DL models. This includes research into practical applications of existing technologies as well as the design of novel solutions. Additionally, affinity and experience with 3D content and related technologies is a huge benefit. Requirements Include Computer science or adjacent technical background, preferably in the game space or academia. Experience with libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow or equivalent. Able to work in a large, constantly evolving code base. The ability to build trust in a large organization with many independent operating functional units. Education A university-level degree in computer science or related field is typical but not required if there is a demonstrated history of competence and success in machine learning and similar systems. Activision Recruiting Contacts Ennissa Martin ennissa.martin@activision.com R015784

Your Mission As a Principal Environment Artist at Infinity Ward, you are a proven expert in your craft with a portfolio depicting a range of examples on multiple released titles over the years. You will be responsible for creating the most exemplary artwork. Lifting the entire discipline’s creative ability through leading by example. As a Principal artist at Infinity Ward, you will establish standards, bring the team’s attention to best practices, and ensure quality of execution is consistently high. You will work closely with Production, Leads, and Directors with planning; establishing or improving pipelines, identifying potential roadblocks and highlighting any tech or support needed for success. You are an ambassador for your craft and are able to work closely with the Leads, Directors and departmental counterparts. Not only within the studio of Infinity Ward but fostering relationships across multiple Activison studios as well. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Demonstrate a mastery of the creative process: You have a passion for creative problem solving and have the technical know how to find answers to development challenges. Illustrate a mastery of industry standard 3D software; Max, Maya, Substance, Blender, photoshop, World Machine, etc. Experience with a range of software suites, and ability to assess what software will benefit a specific pipeline or project. Own and spear head pipeline initiatives across multiple facets of environment art. Modular construction, Terrain Biomes, asset pipelines. Ability to document best practices and a comfort level with mentoring, creating videos and general teaching of specific crafts, techniques, tools or processes as it relates to environment art. Ability to evaluate skillsets across the team, identify where additional training programs may be needed. Foster a positive productive culture of learning and honing one’s skill set to exceed at your craft. Works closely with the Tools, Engine, and Tech art counterparts to develop new workflows or improve upon existing tools and technologies to streamline team efficiency. Player Profile Experience 8+ years industry experience in AAA content creation 1 shipped AAA title in the Principal Role Knowledge & Skills Expert understanding of Physically Based Rendering (PBR) workflow Strong foundational Art skills. Understanding of composition, form, color theory and light in relation to Environment Art. Proficient in the asset pipeline. High poly Modeling, sculpting, texturing Familiar with and proficient in modern level editor workflows. Similar to UE4, Unity, etc. Experience with Terrain editors and proficient in Biome creation. Driving the vision of biomes. Establishing Biome rule sets and collaborating with multiple disciplines to see biomes come to fruition. Self-motivated, independent, and has proven ability to self-manage and meet deadlines Key Attributes Takes Direction Well, Comfortable giving clear concise direction Willingness to improve and learn new skills Able to work under pressure and meet production deadlines Extra Points Photogrammetry experience a + First Person Shooter experience a + We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. jobTitle: Principal Software Engineer, Netcode - Unannounced Survival Game
jobDescription: Team Name Unannounced Project Job Title Principal Software Engineer, Netcode - Unannounced Survival Game Requisition ID R018775 Job Description We Want You A new world and a new journey await you. It is a world different from any other Blizzard has created. If you’re a passionate game developer, and, well, a good human being, then we’d love to talk to you. We have a new AAA survival game in the works, set in a new IP for PC/Console. It’s going to be amazing, and we’d love to bring you along for the ride. Together, we’ll build something big, bold, and beautiful. We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer, Netcode who will define and develop the networking architecture responsible for synchronizing game objects and systems for our ambitious project. By directly managing a team of engineers and collaborating with project leadership, designers, and production, you will help schedule and prioritize clear and achievable goals for the Netcode team. We believe our team is good. Really good. Granted, we’re obviously biased. But we also believe there are lots of developers out there who can make us even better. You could be one of those people. If you’re looking for a team where inclusion, thoughtfulness, empathy, professionalism, and collaboration are all seen as critically important, we believe our team could be a phenomenal fit for you. Join us and help craft our future! COVID-19 Hiring Update We've transitioned to a work-from-home model, and we're continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person's circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. We need help with Managing, evaluating, and mentoring the engineers of the Netcode team. You'll be expected to conduct regular one-on-one meetings with your team, provide positive and constructive feedback, conduct yearly reviews, and evaluate potential new-hire candidates to join the Netcode team. Working with project leadership, design, production, and the engineers of the Netcode team to schedule and prioritize clear and achievable goals each month. Working closely with designers, gameplay engineers, and server engineers to architect a network replication system that meets the needs of the project. Building tools to help identify and troubleshoot difficult to diagnose network replication issues. What You Are Good At Building proven, scalable, efficient network replication systems that leverage fundamental techniques (e.g., client predictive behavior, server authority, rollback and reconciliation). A solid understanding of core networking fundamentals. Caring about the people who work for you, prioritizing their success, and finding ways to motivate and mentor them. Writing C++ code Collaborating with other engineers, designers, and producers. Context switching between attending meetings, writing code, answering questions, and troubleshooting problems. Extra awesome points for Experience working with multiple platforms. Previous experience leading a team of engineers. Knowledge of ECS programming. Systems-level programming experience on Linux. Passion for gaming. Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work/life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunities for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences ever. Join us! R018775

Job Title Producer- Call of Duty Requisition ID R018004 Job Description Job Title: Producer, Call of Duty Reporting To: Senior Manager, Production Department: Production Management Group Location: Santa Monica, CA Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously reinvented the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. also includes managing bug database Build strong relationship with development teams as part of providing support to them Manage build schedules, deliveries, and distribution Be a secondary point of contact for cross-functional groups including Brand Management, Marketing, PR, etc. Contribute creative feedback to production team leadership to help ensure product is meeting quality and feature goals Record meeting notes when needed and translate them into a coherent, organized recap and list of action items Player Profile Understands fundamentals of scoping, scheduling, staffing, budget, and project management Able to create scenarios for submission and release; knowledge of First Party timelines and processes Ability to prepare waterfall, roadmaps, short-to-medium term schedules and planning Identify bottlenecks in the project workflow/schedule Identify issues, provide options for resolution of owned areas Resourceful, steadfast and committed to delivering results Proactive & productive; responds quickly to challenges Allocates own tasks and responsibilities to ensure deadlines are met Understands how to tailor communication style to the audience (internal/external/developer) Earns trust & respect of peers; is viewed as a great teammate Good enough isn’t; a passionate advocate for excellence Builds strong relationships across the organization Can influence without authority Maintains high standards despite pressing deadlines Effectively balances competing priorities & spends time on what’s most important The Producer Should Also Demonstrate Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills Strong problem sleuthing skills Strong project management skills including organized and focused methods of working and task prioritization Ability to self-manage and self-pace Ability to adapt to changing situations and development team cultures Ability to work under pressure Good knowledge of game development methodologies Positive attitude and passion for making games; Job Title Production Coordinator (Contract) Requisition ID R013201 Job Description Production Coordinator Infinity Ward is seeking a Production Coordinator to assist our teams in achieving our quality and creative goals for our next game. The Production Coordinator will work closely with our Development Managers and Development Directors to maintain milestone schedules, track feature and content status, and communicate team progress to the rest of the studio. The Production Coordinator will gain insight into our AAA game production processes and play a key role in facilitating those processes to provide our teams with what they need to excel. The role of Production Coordinator requires candidates to be excellent and persuasive communicators, capable of dealing with a wide variety of internal and external partners. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and willing to take on any challenge that will help their team. Production Coordinator candidates must thrive in a challenging and ambiguous environment, take direction well, and be calm under pressure. Responsibilities Provide hands-on support to our development teams such as organizing playtests, taking notes, updating schedules, and sending out studio-wide communications to report team progress Assist in task and bug tracking and management through our internal tools Facilitate communication across our development teams and external partners Find opportunities to help your team focus on doing what they do best Help make our games better by participating in internal playtests and communicating feedback to the relevant stakeholders Requirements 0 – 2 years of experience in game, film, or technology development Desire to pursue a career in game production General understanding of project management fundamentals (e.g. scheduling, tracking, reporting) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook Pluses Experience with a variety of project management tools (JIRA, Confluence, Shotgun, Microsoft Project experience is a plus) Took on a role as Producer / Project Manager for a creative project (e.g. school project, indie game, film, commercial, etc.) Knowledge of specific project management methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, etc. Active video game player across a variety of genres, especially FPS games R013201

Job Title Production & Project Management Internship Requisition ID R017328 Job Description Production & Project Management Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile  Must be a current student pursuing their bachelors, masters, or PhD and graduating December 2023 or later. Available for a 12-week internship starting in late May or late June. Passionate about learning what it takes to be a successful engineer in the video game industry. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Internship Opportunities Production Intern: join one of our production teams as they support our games in real time. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone who enjoys problem solving and fast paced environments. In this role you’ll coordinate with Producers, Artists, Engineers, Designers, and members of QA. Additionally, you’ll assist in tracking of tasks, document decisions, and assist the production team with administrative requests. In depth experience with project management showcased through school projects on previous employment. Knowledge of Excel and Jira or other project management software. Experience leading a development project. You are familiar with Waterfall and Agile project management methodologies, specifically Scrum. You possess strong communication and interpersonal skills to work closely with many internal and external groups. You are passionate about video game development. Project Management Intern: We are looking for a project management intern to organize and coordinate team projects with one of our core teams. As a Project Manager, you will act as a champion for the features your team develops and help to keep them on track towards delivery.  Understanding of project planning concepts, including waterfall, agile / scrum. Basic knowledge of planning and tracking tools such Smartsheets, Project, JIRA, Confluence. Skills for breaking down complex problems into manageable tasks. Ability to work with multiple collaborators, understand and document requirements, and track and report progress across projects. Keep leadership and partners apprised of status. In partnership with your team, leverage creativity and problem-solving to iterate on development processes. Create transparency, predictability, and consistency within your team. Localization Producer Intern: As an Localization Producer Intern, you are the champion of your assigned Blizzard Localized products, acting as the hub of information and localization pipeline design in order to deliver on our stakeholder’s needs via collaboration with our global localization operations team. In this role you’ll cross collaborate with game developers, marketing, legal, and other requestors to provide consultation; plan and manage localization projects; design and implement efficient and scalable localization frameworks; and make independent decisions while assessing risks. If you’re passionate about localization, constantly striving for excellence and possess the spark to continue to challenge the status quo in our industry, we’re looking for you to join our team! You are a master communicator; you know how to adjust your communication according to your audience and have great negotiation skills You are strategic; you know how to step back and look at the bigger picture to ensure individual and team efforts are focused and impactful You’re curious; you’re eager to learn new skills and tools and seek to always ask the right questions You’re courageous; you are not afraid to challenge yourself and others to do the right thing and create accountability You’re responsible: you are methodical, results driven and will do what it takes to get things done and deliver You’re an excellent project juggler; you can handle multiple complex projects and support a variety of stakeholders without dropping the ball Your Mission  Organize and monitor projects from beginning to end. Help the lead product management define and document specific features to be built. Keep leadership and partners apprised of status. In partnership with your team, leverage creativity and problem-solving to iterate on development processes. Create transparency, predictability, and consistency within your team. Job Title Program Manager, Early Careers Development Requisition ID R018361 Job Description Job Title: Program Manager, Early Careers Development Reporting To: Sr. Director, Global Early Careers Location: Santa Monica, CA Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission Activision, Blizzard, and King’s Global Early Careers program was established to engage, educate, hire, and develop an accomplished and diverse pipeline of students to become the future of our company. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Partner with senior collaborators, HRBPs, and hiring managers to identify and assess emerging talent development needs within our global business teams. Develop orientation and training programs for the Early Career population that build a global cohort, emphasize what we value, and address training needs identified by our partners. Lead, develop, and evolve the existing MBA Rotation Manager program. Work with MBA Recruiting to develop, analyze, and revisit key MBA recruiting strategies to increase our success rate in attracting top talent from selected schools, organizations, and partnerships. Partner with senior collaborators, HRBPs, and hiring managers to identify and assess MBA opportunities within our global business teams. Develop an understanding of the businesses you support to become a trusted advisor for their early career development needs. Plan, coordinate, and carry out a variety of events including presentations, networking events, and training/educational sessions. Own the data collection and analysis to demonstrate program progress, needs, and wins. Work with our global early career teams to ensure consistent program content and delivery. Partner with the DE&I, Employee Network Groups, and current Rotation Managers on initiatives. Act as a leader and ambassador of our team’s vision and goals. Reports to the Sr. Director, Global Early Careers Player Profile 5+ years of previous experience in corporate university relations, campus recruiting, early careers, or learning & development programs teams. An understanding and passion for programming related to early career development, training, and education. Strong program management, presentation, and organizational skills Strong collaborator: this position will involve substantial coordination and collaboration with many different departments, teammates, and partners Consistent track record of establishing and maintaining networking relationships and partnerships Clear, concise verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate optimally with all levels of employees from entry level to C-suite Outstanding attention to detail skills Background of being results driven, with bias to action Experience using data to drive recommendations and decisions Strong event management skills with experience coordinating events from 30 to 500 attendees Experience using technology for efficiency Ethical, fair, exhibits sound thought-process and good judgment Passion around championing People, Culture, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion agendas Player Bonuses MBA recruiting or MBA programs experience Desire to create and innovate Affinity for the video game or entertainment industry Experience with using HRIS platforms Intermediate-level Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint skills We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Prop Artist - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R018437 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history – and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are building a culture of collaboration and seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile Prop Artist with current gen console and PBR material experience to create organic and hard surface props. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Be Doing… Produce photo-realistic 3D models with physically based materials Work closely and take direction from the Art Directors in creating assets within the established vision for the game Research and gather imagery related to current tasks Participate and give status updates in regular team meetings To succeed you must have… 3+ years of demonstrated experience Experience working within game development, and ideally with current generation consoles Strong experience with Maya or 3DS Max Experience with Photoshop, Zbrush, Substance Painter and/or Designer PBR material experience Solid 2-D and 3-D concept skills working in a variety of styles Strong interpersonal skills, being a good communicator, comfortable with both taking and providing direction and feedback, and capable of self-managing in meeting deadlines and goals. A passion for continuing to learn and grow, being able to learn new tools quickly We’d love it if you also have… A passion for and experience with First Person Shooters Photogrammetry experience A background in traditional art skills Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects. Please include a shot breakdown specifying what you were directly responsible for creating. Job Title QA Analyst I Requisition ID R018623 Job Description Job Title: QA Analyst Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering, and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting upcoming projects. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a QA Analyst, you will employ “grey” and “black box” testing methodology as a subject matter authority, leader and mentor in an Agile development QA environment. In this role, you will be responsible for exhibiting technical and knowledge expertise; creating, maintaining, and implementing Test Cases/Plans; identifying, thoroughly investigating, and documenting bugs/issues with the game; authoring documentation on tools and techniques, and subsequently educating your teammates. You will be interacting closely in both a studio and globally distributed development environment with QA team members and development partners. You will therefore need to have strong critical thinking, adaptive troubleshooting competency, and inter-personal communication skills. Due to this exposure to all facets of game development and allowance for professional development, there is also great opportunity for career development and growth in the game industry. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Demonstrate technical expertise, confidence, initiative and ownership of development tools and subject areas. Actively assess and communicate the needs or progress of development partners, and how they impact QA’s priorities and tasks. Identify, investigate, isolate, regress, and communicate issues/defects effectively and efficiently. Create, maintain, and implement Test Cases and Tasks using in-house and 3rd-party testing tools. Work in a collaborative QA environment, owning key features and content development, independently handling your tasks, leading small QA project teams, and mentoring teammates as necessary. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 3+ years testing experience in gaming/software QA. Understanding of Game/Software Testing Processes and Best Practices. Understanding of Game/ Software Development Lifecycles and project management methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Waterfall). QA experience with console platforms (e.g. PlayStation, XBOX, etc.) and PC. Familiarity with software development tools such as JIRA, Testrail, or Perforce, and Microsoft Office productivity software. Must be able to work autonomously and self-educate with supportive leadership, but limited direction and supervision. Passion for games and demonstrable understanding of game industry and gaming trends. Extra Points Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Game/Software Development or related degree, or corresponding experience in game/software development. At least 3 released game titles. Intimate knowledge of Call of Duty or other First-Person Shooter titles. Experience leading small team projects. Experience with programming languages such as C++, C#, or Python. Experience with Game Development Subject area software such as Maya, Houdini, Unreal, Radiant, or other development or mod tools. Experience with First Party Submission standards (Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo, Apple, etc). Experience with network or server testing, test automation and tools, Live Services or Content Submission process. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by teams with varied strengths working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. Job Title QA Project Lead Requisition ID R018613 Job Description Job Title: QA Project Lead Reporting To: Senior QA Project Lead & QA Manager Department: Quality Assurance Location: Austin, TX (This role is anticipated to be assigned to work fully on-site at an Activision Blizzard office) Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously disrupted the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. With a history of delivering iconic game changers -- like Pitfall®, Tony Hawk®, Guitar Hero®, Crash Bandicoot™, Skylanders™ and Call of Duty® -- our obsession is delighting our players around the globe. Focused and committed to innovation, we consistently deliver the most beloved, engaging and successful entertainment. And while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a passionate, talented and diverse team of people producing greatness together. So, if you’re interested in our biggest priority, it’s our people. We’re currently driving the next era for our company and community by creating amazing experiences for fans and continuing to make Activision an inclusive place where everyone can thrive. Join us, make history. To learn more, check us out at www.activision.com, www.activisiongamesblog.com or @Activision on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Your Mission The QA Project Lead is directly responsible for guiding a team of Associate QA Project Leads (“APLs”) who oversee QA Testers through the functionality testing and/or 1st party compliance testing of an Activision product. The QA Project Lead will be the main point of contact between Production staff, Development teams, and other Activision QA teams. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Project Management Communicates with Development and Production teams to provide recommendations on compliant game functionality and/or technical requirements. Creates and maintains all project related checklists. Completes milestone assessment reports at Alpha & Beta in accordance with QA policies. Identifies and documents requirements in a clear and concise manner using the assigned bug tracking databases. Creates informative and accurate daily reports and ensures distribution and delegation of work to designated production and management staff such as APLs. Develops effective test plans and perform standards testing on console games to verify proper function, data content, performance, usability/playability, and hardware/software compatibility. Administers the defect report database and other platform associated databases. Manages proper closure of all assigned projects and ensures all final code and documentation are properly archived. Assists in special projects, such as demonstrations, training, surveys, focus groups, etc. Assists in forming and improving QA systems and procedures. Managing and Mentoring Supervises the test team including APLs, Senior Testers and Testers on a daily basis to ensure rapid and accurate completion of delegated tasks. Actively evaluates APL performance and works closely with APLs to address any issues that arise in their work through coaching and counseling testers. Collaborates with APLs, and testers directly, in order to prepare testers for additional responsibilities, such as becoming Senior QA Testers. Participates in and makes recommendations in decisions to hire and promote APLs. Collaborates with APLs on Senior QA Tester and QA Tester interviews and contributes to hiring decisions in collaboration with APLs. Database Administration Reviews all issues entered by the test teams to ensure bug reports include required information and conform to Activision QA standards. Reviews all disputed issues (e.g., ‘Not a Bug,’ ‘Will Not Fix,’ & ‘Duplicate’) with Senior QA Project Lead. Updates the database after each bug sweep. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Technical Proficient with Devtrack & Jira or similar bug tracking database. Able to identify defects in software titles and report defects in a clear and concise manner. Capacity to create and implement innovative testing procedures and materials. Strong working knowledge of most popular console platforms and related peripherals, PC Software/hardware, and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel). Has been in a leadership role (Senior QA Tester and/or Associate QA Project Lead). Non-Technical 2+ year of experience working in the Activision QA Department or in a comparable Quality Assurance department. Excellent written/spoken communication with others. Strong leadership ability. Proficient in exercising independent judgment in managing others and/or making meaningful recommendations to senior managers with respect to decisions concerning personnel and team management. Ability to handle high pressure situations and prioritize multiple tasks. Possesses excellent spoken and written communication skills and be able to work with varied staff members and personalities. Must be honest, punctual, and have a strong work ethic. Able to work in a team environment. Actively communicates a positive, outgoing approach to Quality Assurance. Able to give and accept positive as well as negative feedback. Must be an avid gamer, with interests in many different genres of games and a passion for developing high quality games. A strong desire to learn and understand the technologies involved in game creation. Demonstrable ability to work with and help mentor and manage new testers. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title QA Requirements Tester I Requisition ID R017738 Job Description Job Title: QA Requirements Tester I Reporting To: QA Project Lead Department: Quality Assurance Location: El Segundo, CA Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously disrupted the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. With a history of delivering iconic game changers -- like Pitfall®, Tony Hawk®, Guitar Hero®, Crash Bandicoot™, Skylanders™ and Call of Duty® -- our obsession is delighting our players around the globe. Your Mission QA Testers are a support function within the Quality Assurance team. Identifies and documents defects in a clear and concise manner using the assigned bug tracking database. Assists the Production/Development team in tracking down issues and working out the steps to reproduce so that they are easier to locate and fix. Completes regression/verification testing as needed. Follows instructions and accomplishes tasks as directed by the QA Project Lead or QA Management. Experience with Quality Assurance testing of software projects (desired). Understanding of the software test cycle process (desired). High school diploma or equivalent. Strong interest in video games. Must possess excellent communication skills. Sharp attention to detail. Team player. Honesty and a strong work ethic. Job Title QA Tester Requisition ID R017740 Job Description Job Title: QA Functional Tester I Department: Quality Assurance Location: Eden Prairie, MN Hours: 40-60 Hours/week (Over-time pay rate 1.5x based on state and local regulations) This position does often require as many as 10-20 hours of overtime on a weekly basis. Also, you will be asked to work weekends and may have some weekdays off. In especially busy times a sixth work day may be required. Benefits: You will have access to a variety of benefits including Medical Coverage, Health Savings Account, free and discounted games and more! Your Mission Your mission is to test pre-release AAA video games under the Activision umbrella. As a Game Tester you’ll verifying functionality, data content, performance, 1st Party (Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo) compliance, usability/playability, and hardware/software compatibility. Not to mention, play some awesome games! In the spirit of inclusion, we encourage all to apply! Player Profile You are 18 years of age or older Possess a high school diploma or equivalent You possess a real passion for gaming You understand the importance of confidentiality and discretion, and act with excellent judgment You have a great sense of humor and the ability to have fun while still managing responsibilities You are available to work overtime (nights and weekends often required) You are detail oriented with a strong work ethic You can learn and execute quickly and effectively. You excel in a team-oriented environment You have basic PC knowledge, familiarity with multiple gaming platforms and genres Experience troubleshooting PC and Console games a plus Quality Assurance testing experience a plus Understanding of the software test cycle process a plus We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Your Platform With nearly two decades on the books, the Quality Assurance studio in Minneapolis continues to be the cornerstone of end-to-end QA testing at Activision. The fast paced, dynamic testing environment provides a tremendous opportunity to learn and grow in the gaming industry. You will have unparalleled access to the greatest games on the planet. QA Minneapolis works on some of the most successful game franchises, including: Call of Duty, Crash Bandicoot, Spyro, Skylanders, with Call of Duty: Black Ops 4, Spyro Reignited Trilogy and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice are among the recent product launches that we’ve assisted with. We help ensure our games meet the highest quality standards to stay at the top of our industry. Our success is driven by teamwork, respect and inclusion. These principles are at our core; our innovation propels us into the future. We’re proud to be part of a company recognized as one of FORTUNE’s "100 Best Companies to Work For®” for four consecutive years. We have earned a spot-on FORTUNE’s “Most Admired Companies,” and “Future 50” lists. The 10,000+ global employees are some of the best and brightest talents across entertainment, media, and technology. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest. R017740

Job Title Recruitment Engagement and Vendor Manager (Contract) Requisition ID R010318 Job Description Job Title: Recruitment Engagement and Vendor Manager Reporting To: Talent Sourcing Leader Department: Human Resources Location: Santa Monica, CA Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission Assess current state and recommend a future state program enabled by technology and designed to meet all business objectives Lead vendor selection initiative to ensure we have the right recruitment partners embedded in the operating model Gather business requirements and develop end to end processes and procedures that are designed for efficiency, visibility, compliance and a great experience for our workforce Maintain relationships with vendors to ensure strong performance and adherence to company policies Design reports to audit data and increase visibility into company-wide recruiting activity Act as central contact and point of escalation for internal stakeholders in the process Maintain relationships with vendors to ensure strong performance and adherence to company policies Create, deliver and maintain training and resources related to program and policies Document and maintain Standard Operating Procedures Player Profile Experience leading Recruitment Vendor Management at a global company Experience building or significantly transforming an end to end Recruitment Vendor Management program Primary business contact and point of escalation for recruitment agencies and internal teams including HR, IT, Finance and Legal Implemented new policy and process changes with strong change management best practices Demonstrated ability to handle a high number of priorities and drive multiple projects simultaneously Able to thrive and operate independently in an ever-changing environment Strong problem-solving, analytics skills and a business mindset Data guru with expert Excel skills and experience with building/running reports and analyzing and manipulating data Strong communications skills with the ability to succinctly convey messages to varying audiences Comfort with ambiguity; strong judgment and ability to make well-informed decisions BA or BS required Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. Craft Job Description: Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprised of seven main teams, we have many specialties including data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming and online services including matchmaking and networking. We are distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland and Japan. Most of our teams are comprised of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our dedicated engineers help with title development and provide valuable collaboration between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. This is a hybrid role that will require a weekly onsite presence at our Sherman Oaks, CA location Your Mission The Central Tech team is looking for a Release Engineer to help deliver the world’s premiere FPS franchise to millions of fans. We’re looking for someone who can bridge technical, business, and production subject areas to deliver the best user experience possible! Requirements Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Validated experience architecting, configuring, and administrating games on a major platform (PC experience preferred) (3 +years). PC platform experience. Experience packaging and shipping titles on Steam. Proficiency in Python, or a similar scripting language. Experience working with or in mature build pipelines and build infrastructure at scale. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent problem solving and analytic skills. Comfortable collaborating with technical and non-technical teams alike. Love of games! Bonus Points Experience handling content delivery networks. Experience writing PC installers. Background in C++ programming. Experience with mobile packaging and submissions. Experience in other areas of video game technology. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R016335

Job Title Rendering Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R006978 Job Description As a Rendering Engineer you will be optimizing, enhancing, and developing new rendering systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA engine technology. You will be developing the graphics systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in graphics engine development and related subsystems. This includes a fluency with modern graphics techniques, GPUs, graphics APIs, shaders, multi-threading, memory management, performance, and optimizations. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Develop, modify, optimize, and debug rendering engine systems Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teams Participate in the performance and code review process Collaboration and co-development with other engineering and art teams Player Profile We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Experience developing and optimizing graphics systems Understanding of computer architecture, GPUs, and memory systems Strong programming background in C/C++ Experience writing shaders (HLSL or equivalent) Development experience with a current generation platform (console, PC, and/or mobile) Solid debugging skills, including ability to debug at an assembly-level when necessary 3+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Creative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-oriented Demonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Strong background in 3D math Passion for games and graphics technology Extra Points Shipped at least one game title Demonstrated work with modern consoles, profilers and toolchains Experience with PS4 GNM, Direct3D 12 and/or Vulkan APIs Familiarity with physically based rendering/lighting Background in collaborating and iterating with artists on graphics features About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Security Analyst Requisition ID R018083 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission As a Security Analyst you will be responsible for working with the game security team on building intelligence to track our adversaries. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Find, monitor, and investigate emerging threats targeting our games and our players. Leverage a variety of internal and external tools to identify threats, assess risks, and produce reports. Maintain intelligence records related to cheating, malicious actors, and threats to the company. Analyze high volumes of information from various areas the internet and chat platforms. Support the day-to-day operations of the game security team and game development teams. Assist in responding to emergency security incidents. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Master’s degree or equivalent work experience in Security Studies, Intelligence Studies, Cyber Security, or similar 3+ years of experience in threat intelligence, open-source intelligence, online research, fraud or anti-cheat investigations, or similar Experience producing well-researched concise reports and presentations tailored to a variety of audiences. Knowledge of advanced OSINT (open-source intelligence) tools and techniques and adapting research methods for new threats. Familiarity manipulating threat intelligence platforms for a video game threat landscape and / or creating and maintaining alerting systems. Familiarity with online gaming and the different types of game cheats Strong written and verbal communications skills Basic understanding of game security, game development, and anti-cheat software Able to adapt to a quickly changing environment. Passionate about player experience and have an intense thirst for knowledge. Extra Points Fluency in Chinese (Mandarin). Fluency in multiple languages. Experience developing research accounts and setting up virtual machines with considerations to operational security. Hands-on working knowledge of programming or scripting languages Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. Job Title Security Engineer Requisition ID R013787 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission As a Senior Security Engineer, you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help identify and combat threats to game security and integrity. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a fast changing landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and also being able to react to newly emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an overall engineering team effort, you would be expected to both lead individual projects through to completion, in addition to playing a role in a longer term technology and capability build-out. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Create machine learning models to help investigations into game cheating, driven by technical and heuristic indicators and other criteria. Integrate analysis models into data pipeline, allowing continual and batch processing of telemetry data. Perform R&D into both new techniques and technologies. Drive hypothesis, perform trial analysis, provide insights and recommendations to security team. Reverse engineering to identify malware, code hijacking, and other malicious behavior. Provide security analysis to internal security team. Identify emerging threats, propose countermeasures, implement countermeasures in timely manner. Be proactive part of team to monitor and measure effectiveness in anti-cheat efforts. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Working knowledge of Machine Learning techniques and best practices. Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. C/C++ development, including some understanding of assembly code. Reverse engineering, advanced debugging, ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Must have worked in security-oriented role on previously published games. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Knowledge of social engineering, malware, industry best practices for game and code security. Working as part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Security Engineer Requisition ID R018610 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming, and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland, and Japan. This role is expected to begin and continue as a remote position. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Security Integration Engineer you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats to both gameplay feature and anti-cheating integrity. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a constantly evolving threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and being able to react to newly emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an overall engineering team effort, you would be expected to be both hands-on working directly on protecting game features and integrity, in addition to playing a role in a longer-term technology and capability build-out. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of game title features, ensuring known exploits are corrected and potential threats are addressed. Be a priority resource to work side-by-side game engineers, as the engineering support representative of the Central Technology Game Security team. Perform R&D into both new techniques and technologies. Work closely with experts within the security team to identify the best course of action to protect game features and implement countermeasures to known cheats. Identify emerging threats, propose countermeasures, and implement these in a timely manner. Be the game title eyes-and-ears to report back potential issues and make recommendations for areas to improve. Be a proactive part of team to monitor and measure effectiveness in anti-cheat efforts. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. Strong C/C++ development on game titles, including some understanding of assembly code, and solid understanding of source control standard methodologies and hands-on knowledge of P4. Reverse engineering, sophisticated debugging, ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Knowledge of social engineering, malware, industry standard methodologies for game and code security. Security-focused role on previously published games. Be part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Job Title Senior AI Animator - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R008394 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior AI Animator, you will create high fidelity 3rd person non player character animations that align to our pursuit of ultimate player immersion. This Immersion is achieved with animations that display realistic human motion and emotion in combat scenarios that bring our NPCs to life! The ability to analyze and de-construct the human range of motion, and executing the “feel” the project dictates, is the prime directive. You will be joining our passionate and talented team of Animators who continue pushing our standards of quality and drive, that echoes throughout our studio. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Use motion capture and hand-keyed techniques to create high-fidelity NPC Animations that are genre-defining. Implement and maintain animations using proprietary tools, always evolving the animation engine. Communicate and collaborate with the most passionate team of engineers and designers to bring to life our most comprehensive NPC animation to date. Player Profile Experience 2+ years of game development experience. Knowledge & Skills A strong ability in hand-keyed animation. Strong Maya animation experience. Key Attributes A strong passion for animation, video games, and the entertainment it inspires and draws from. Possess the ability to take tasks to completion with high fidelity. Collaborative ability to work with multiple people and disciplines to complete tasks. Possess the ability to receive and address feedback.
