jobTitle: Senior Analyst, Studio Operations and Planning
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Analyst, Studio Operations and Planning Requisition ID R016036 Job Description COVID-19 Hiring Update Language Hybrid: “This role is anticipated to be assigned as a hybrid work model position, with some work on-site at an Activision Blizzard office and some work remote.” Job Description We are versatile, flexible and strategic hustlers passionate about content and creative talents. We take pride in proactively finding opportunities to help our creative talents to do their best work and championing studio initiatives in the dynamic world of gaming. The Studio Operations and Planning team is a part of the broader Call of Duty Development (incl. studios, production management, publishing ops, studio operations and planning) and works closely with Activision COO, Head of Development and Head of COD Operations. The Studio Operations and Planning team is responsible for supervising the operational and strategic aspects (studio dev resourcing management, investment, studio expansion, planning, etc) for all Activision studios (Infinity Ward, Treyarch, Sledge Hammer, High Moon Studios, Raven, Beenox, Toys for Bob, Shanghai Studio, Demonware). Among other things, the Studio Operations Team also handles the organizational events such as game Green Light process, operational governance reviews, and Special Projects etc. The team collaborates with a wide range of functions across Activision Publishing functions and studios to develop operational processes/strategies and streamline information exchange, drive efficiency and creative access to support our world-class games and drive studio business goals. Senior Analyst, Studio Operations and Strategic Initiative The Senior Analyst, Studio Operations and Strategic Initiatives will play a pivotal role in working with Activision’s 9 world-class game studios and will report to the Senior Manager, Studio Operations and Strategic Planning. The role will focus on studios’ resource planning, operational excellence, rhythm of business coordination, business reviews, and other key projects. The role will also support Head of Call of Duty Operations in developing business strategies, competitive analysis, and project managing strategic initiatives for studios. You will partner with our studios as well as our central studios organization to develop studio strategies around operational and resourcing issues, build the analytical support and documentation to align key partners across the organization on the recommended path forward, and drive the execution of those strategies across multiple collaborator groups within the organization. We are looking for self-starters who can work in a constantly evolving gaming industry, tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Own Lead the operationalization of a monthly process (incl. the use of power BI tool, dashboard building using Tableau and Smartsheet) to report/track long-range (3 year) studio resource planning and build ad-hoc analysis, this would include heavy data collecting, input, tracking and analysis Own cross studio HC movement in the system, escalation process and HC approval process Own analysis to support strategic recommendation on resourcing (e.g., hire vs. no hire, best dev practice in the system, efficient teaming, outsourcing, standard methodology alignment, studio expansion) Partner with Finance to proactively supervise budgets and input actuals as well as do a variance analysis Support Support Mgr. to run resource planning for all nine Activision studios and work with various levels of management across studios Support and start to lead cross-functional projects to develop strategic recommendations for Activision Executive Leadership Team on key investment decisions (international studio expansion, external dev resourcing, ground breaking motion capture technology) the studios organization needs to make Develop an analytical culture using historical and current operational data to drive predictive analytics for the studios Strategic Initiatives Taking on individual projects as required by the business. Job Title Senior Animation Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R018674 Job Description As a Senior Animation Systems Engineer you will optimizing, enhancing, and developing new engine animation systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA technology. This is a great opportunity to be part of a hardworking team that defines and shapes the technology which will push our upcoming Call of Duty titles further in animation. You will be developing the engine animation systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in both engine development and the animation technology that will support a game. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design, modify, optimize, and debug engine animation and tools systems Research and document ways of improving our animation systems and tools Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development Participate in the performance and code review process Contribute to the design and roadmap of industry-leading AAA engine technology Collaboration and co-development with other teams Minimum Requirements We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Experience developing and optimizing engine animation systems Effective 3D math and algebra skills Strong programming skills in C/C++and a background with multi-threaded systems Debugging skills, including ability to debug at an assembly-level when necessary Shipped at least one game title 5+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented programming Creative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-oriented Ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Passion for character animation Nice To Have Understanding of state machines, blend trees, low-level playback as related to animation Familiarity with animation techniques like pose-space deformations and blend shapes Background with physics-based ragdolls, cloth, and IK systems Experience with digital content creation tools (Max, Maya, Houdini, etc.) About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games, most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Raven Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Senior Animation Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R015195 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a talented engineer with a passion for gameplay to join our team and be a key contributor in developing our technology to bring our future titles to life. As a Senior Animation Engineer you will be working on developing the Call of Duty animation system used in our future titles. You will be working with engineers across multiple time zones and on technology that will be used by multiple games. You will be expected to drive the long term vision and detail the roadmap of the animation system for the years to come. What You’ll Do… Own and drive the animation capabilities and tooling for the Call of Duty game engine Support game teams and their content creators to build new games Collaborate with content creators and gameplay teams to learn and understand their needs Build positive relationships with animation teams across the Call of Duty franchise Actively and enthusiastically seek out help, code reviews, and advice Mentor other engineers in coding and animation system development To succeed you should have… The ability to understand and write effective C++ code A strong understanding of the fundamentals of 3D animation Communication skills for sharing ideas clearly, learning from others, and giving meaningful feedback Strong mathematics skills, including proficiency with trigonometry, and linear algebra Experience collaborating with content creators and technical artists Experience shipping AAA titles You’re a great fit if your philosophy is to… Commit to doing things the right way, even when it's difficult Value diversity and differences in others Ensure discussions include every voice that has something to say Enable technology that makes games accessible to every person who wants to play them Strive to learn from the knowledge and experiences of those around you We’d love it if you also have… Experience with building tools for content creators Familiarity with animation concerns in a multiplayer game environment Experience working with or contributing to in-house engine development We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. A successful Senior Animator will bridge animation, engineering, and design to identify potential issues and deploy correct solutions. You must be highly organized and have outstanding communication skills. While working with a Lead Animator, you will champion the animation vision and become an essential pillar of the animation team. Additionally, a Senior Animator will provide relevant input that will influence animation technology development, resources, and tool development. What you’ll do… Produce high-quality animations using the tools at your disposal, with a focus on character performances and gameplay. Collaborate with animators, designers, artists, and software engineers to identify and address areas of need or concern. Contribute to the development of new techniques and processes involved in the implementation and creation of animations. Participate in the planning and directing process of motion capture shoots. Identify potential areas of risk, create/implement mitigation plans before issues happen, and keep yourself operating at a high level of productivity. To succeed you should have… A great understanding of realistic body mechanics as well as animation principles. Mentorship skills. Facial animation experience. Expert knowledge of Maya. Expert knowledge of animation implementation and debugging techniques. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills, and be a self-starter and problem solver. 5+ years of proven experience in the game industry, with at least one AAA title shipped as a Senior Animator. We’d love it if you also have… Creature animation experience. Storyboard skills. Camera animation skills. Experience working with outsourcing.

Job Title Senior Architect Requisition ID R012073 Job Description Your Mission As an Sr Architect at Activision, you will be part of a team within the Experience Optimization group and build innovative and impactful solutions with a focus on loyalty and engagement across Activision game titles. Candidates should have development experience with large-scale consumer facing applications while supporting a team of talented engineers. Key Responsibilities Include Collaborate with stakeholders to identify technology solutions to business problems. Support a diverse team of software engineers. Build and maintain effective relationships with our customers and partners. Remove ambiguity from projects and provide clear direction for the team. Effectively communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Work in a collaborative environment with some pretty cool people. Year 1 Success Delivery of monetization and engagement use cases including delivery of partnership promotions and login/registration improvements. Support A/B testing for the various digital executions. Refine security best practices for software development processes. Player Profile Demonstrated leadership experience in a software engineering/development environment. Ability to formulate, review and recommend software solutions in support of business goals based on prior experience and hands-on understanding of how products and services interrelate. Leader in all aspects of the software development lifecycle including planning, technical design, development, documentation, testing and deployment. Strong development skills in a full stack environment with an emphasis on front-end applications. Ability to balance business needs and product priorities to maximize impact. Display personal initiative and strong ownership of the work. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master's Degree desirable). Your Platform We’re headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many disciplines of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivalled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. Our World Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! Activision has been changing the way people play for the past 40 years—as the leading developer and publisher of video games, our teams have created some of the world's biggest, most ground-breaking, and beloved entertainment franchises in the industry. Ask anyone who works at Activision what their favorite thing about it is, and they’ll tell you it’s the people. We have world class brands, infrastructure, and resources, but our success comes from people producing greatness together. We are nothing without our employee’s brilliance. Activision is more than just the leading developer and publisher of video games; we are the creators of some of the world’s biggest, most ground-breaking titles in the industry. Our current portfolio includes Call of Duty®, Skylanders®, and Crash Bandicoot™. Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ: ATVI), headquartered in Santa Monica, California with locations across the globe, is one of the largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies in the world. Sitting at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment, our employees are some of the best and brightest across engineering, entertainment, media, and technology. A member of the S&P 500 Activision Blizzard is proud to be included as one of FORTUNE's "100 Best Companies To Work For®," "World's Best Employers," as well as "Most Admired Companies." In 2019 we were honored to receive a perfect score on our entry to the Corporate Equality Index as a Best Workplace for LGBTQ professionals and once again made Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies in Gaming. The video game industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. jobDescription: Job Title Senior Associate Integration Engineer - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R016601 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. jobDescription: Job Title Senior Audio Software Engineer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009776 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create state of the art technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to unleash your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Infinity Ward - Austin is looking for a talented Senior Audio Software Engineer, someone with a strong interest in audio processing and a passion for creating an awesome audio experience. You should be comfortable working with both programmers and audio content creators, as you will be working closely with both teams. Our games have won best sound awards from The Game Awards, MPSE Golden Reel and been nominated for DICE and many others. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Own the audio technology pipeline and custom audio tool set for our proprietary game engine. Work with audio designers and programmers to design, prototype, and implement new audio features. Develop implementation plans and time estimates for tasks. Work with the content team to meet project requirements within performance and memory budgets. Support and proactively interface with the audio designers. Adhere to team coding standards and best practices. Player Profile Requirements Audio programming education or experience. 6+ years of professional programming experience. Proficiency in C/C++. Familiarity with C#. Strong communication and teamwork skills. Self-motivated, ability to work independently and efficiently under deadlines. Strong math skills. Bonus Points DSP and 3D audio programming experience. Experience with middleware solutions such as Wwise and FMOD. Good understanding of multi-threaded programming. Experience programming on multiple game consoles. Experience with first person shooters and multiplayer action games. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Job Title Senior Build Engineer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R007324 Job Description Your Mission Infinity Ward is looking for a talented Senior Build Engineer to join our development team working on Call of Duty Modern Warfare! The Build Pipeline team at Infinity Ward knows just how critical they are to delivering a world class gaming experience. Responsible for the end-to-end workflows across multiple development branches, the pipeline team owns the orchestration and provisioning services needed to create, package, and test a massive amount of build artifacts, including support for multiple gaming platforms (Playstation/XBox/Windows/iOS). The associated explosion of data requires creative engineering solutions that continuously optimize performance, intelligently throttle throughput, and properly scale the capacity needed to facilitate our massive CI/CD pipeline. Constant interaction with your customers (engineering, design, and art departments) allows exploration into the diverse tool sets used in professional game development, and encouraged in order to develop an understanding of our toolchains and overall dependencies that are essential to the tuning of your system. This is an exciting opportunity to join an award-winning video game developer, and work with the best gaming talent in the world. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in designing, implementing, and optimizing within an end-to-end build pipeline responsible for the production of top-tier games or services. We are looking for someone who is passionate about making an impact across the organization, comfortable with frequent context switching, and confident in making informed decisions. Responsibilities include a wide range of systems engineering tasks across multiple domains: Gather and prioritize requirements from engineers, content creators, and designers, whose success depends on your ability to increase their workflow efficiency. Design and develop various services, tools, and workflows across the end-to-end build pipeline, while maintaining laser focus on the availability, predictability, and performance of your services. Take initiative to find and solve challenging problems across an ecosystem of cross-studio services and process. Promote collaboration within and across team boundaries, while looking for opportunities to mentor, educate and/or support those around you. Drive continuous innovation by advocating best practices that impact code health, testing, and maintainability. Define new metrics and systems for observing, evaluating, and further optimizing business processes. Maintain and evolve infrastructure needed to scale studio services such as: Continuous Integration, Automated Testing, Distribution and Caching systems. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 5+ years of experience within CI/CD pipelines operating at enterprise scale Proficiency in Python, or comparable scripting language Experience with distributed build and version control systems In-depth understanding of modern design patterns (REST interaction with backend services) Strong communication skills (verbal and written) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field Extra Points Passion for test automation frameworks Background in C/C++ or C# Experience managing/scaling datacenter capacity (VMs, games consoles, etc) Experience with containerization technology (Docker) Experience leveraging cloud hosting platforms (Azure, GCP) Experience with game or media development About Infinity Ward Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, CA, just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. #textio R007324

jobTitle: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Open to Remote)
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Business Systems Analyst (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R018470 Job Description As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be working with the Sr. Manager of IT and Business Users for providing day-to-day support and improvements initiative to our finance business systems, Zuora Revenue and Oracle Financials. You will collaborate closely with the finance revenue department to drive efficiency initiatives within the platforms. The ideal candidate should have prior experience with Zuora Revenue, Oracle financials and have the ability to drive multiple initiatives. Sr. Business Analyst is a versatile and highly motivated individual who works with the other IT team members and Business Users on the Technical and Functional requirements definition, design, implementation and maintenance of systems. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work with the finance revenue business teams to understand overall Revenue Management requirements, plan roadmap and execution with other IT teams and offshore Ability to apply critical thinking and flexibility in advising key stakeholders within the framework of ASC 606 and ensure appropriate accounting treatment in accordance with US GAAP Provide day-to-day end user support of Zuora functions to the Finance Revenue team Understand revenue business processes to assist in supporting new system functionalities and regression testing. Support month-end close process, including maintaining the general ledger and sub-ledgers, reviews journal entries and balance sheet reconciliations as well as analyze account variances Design and support integrations between Zuora Revenue and Oracle EBS systems and other third-party applications. Communicate and follow up with business partners to ensure that open/outstanding issues are resolved in a timely manner The ability to interview various non-technical managers to understand complex, dynamic business rules/processes and then build detailed, specific, and comprehensive documentation. Engage Business Users spanning multiple departments and ensure cohesive articulation of business goals and processes to ensure effective solutions. Ability to create and present key requirements artifacts, Scope Documents, Use Cases, Detailed Specification of Key Business Rules, Test plans and Test scenarios, Activity Diagrams, Business Process Mapping Diagrams and Documentation, Application Gap analysis Prepare and analyze monthly and quarterly reports, review policies and procedures to ensure SOX compliance Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in a related technical/finance/business discipline with typically a minimum of 8+ years professional experience, with demonstrated ability and 2+ lifecycle implementations for the Zuora Revenue system. Strong knowledge of the Oracle EBS “Quote to Cash” and “Record to Report” processes. Good knowledge of the following Oracle E-Business Suite R12 modules: General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Costing, Consolidation and underlying database objects. Experience serving as the primary IT resource with responsibility for configuration, customization, and management of the technical implementation. Strong knowledge of US GAAP, ASC 605, ASC 606 and experience with SOX compliance Experience and solid understanding of integrations between Zuora Revenue and ERP systems and other third-party applications. Experience with supporting Zuora Revenue system, upgrades, patching. Experience with Microsoft Office, Visio, and Project. Extra Points Zoura certification is big plus. Write simple to complex queries to support audit requests or business partners’ reporting requests We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all the qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. R018470

Job Title Senior Character Artist – Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R018998 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a Senior Character Artist you will work as a key member of the character art team to create high quality and detailed character designs. These assets are based on game requirements, technical capabilities of the gaming platform and product scope. Individual must have a basic understanding of anatomy and proportions as it translates to 3D modeling, and mesh deformation. Takes initiative to learn and adapt to new team practices based on evolving technologies. Can work in a multidiscipline work atmosphere, alongside other Character Artists and with the Lead Character Artist while under time constraints. This role is anticipated to be assigned as a hybrid work model position, with some work on-site at an Activision Blizzard office and some work remote. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Collaborate with the Art Director and Concept Artists to develop look and feel of assets. Create exciting characters that are efficient, built to scale and satisfy budgetary requirements. Project management for a number of assets and prioritize tasks. Maintain and share extensive knowledge pertaining to military gear, uniforms and equipment. Work with Technical Art Director to understand budgetary requirements and ensure that the characters created fulfills these requirements. Receive feedback and modify work based on direction. Provide feedback to improve the tools. Follow schedules and meet deadlines. Understand mesh topology and edge loops as it translates to efficient modeling practices for in-game characters, and is experienced building highly detailed characters. Understanding of 3d scan as a foundation for organic or hard surface model workflows. Good understanding of UV coordinate space, texturing, and memory budgets. Thorough working knowledge of Maya, Zbrush, and Substance Painter. Understands the principles and practices of physically based workflows and texturing. Promote a positive work environment through high personal and performance standards. Player Profile Prior Experience/Previous Positions related to current position: 4-6+ Years of directly related experience in gaming. Performed similar role on at least 1 published game title. High level of proficiency using Maya to create detailed characters to scale and accuracy. Demonstrated Ability to create detailed Zbrush or Mudbox models. Candidate must have experience using Substance Painter, and Photoshop to create hyper realistic textures for next gen materials. Experienced in 3D character concepts and development process. Experience is working from Scan data. Candidate must be proactive and work well in a large team environment and have excellent communication skills. Experience creating efficient and clean models with proper UV layout inside Autodesk Maya Radiant experience a plus. Properly estimate time to complete work, sort and evaluate various priorities and builds in buffers. Verify art asset performance and appearance in the game engine. Bonus XP An understanding of weighting and animation principles Able to rapid prototype and help conceptualize character designs Experience with scan data. Experience with Marvelous Designer We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. is the world’s largest interactive entertainment company, with operations across North America, Europe, and Asia. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, Skylanders®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™, and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! We’re proud to be recognized as one of FORTUNE’s "100 Best Companies To Work For®” for four consecutive years and have earned a spot on FORTUNE’s “Most Admired Companies,” and “Future 50” lists. Our 10,000+ global employees are some of the most creative talents across entertainment, media, and technology. The video game industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics. R018998

Our passion for developing award-winning games with diverse genres includes the Crash Bandicoot®, Call of Duty®, Overwatch®, Spyro®, Skylanders®, and Tony Hawk® franchises. Job Title Senior Cloud Application Engineer Requisition ID R018988 Job Description The Activision Infrastructure team is looking for a Senior Cloud Application Engineer to join the team either 100% remotely, or in our offices in Vancouver, Canada or in Sherman Oaks, California. This team supports a variety of cloud workloads and you will be instrumental in setting standards and supporting key technologies. You will help drive efficiencies for both cost and performance within Amazon Web Services and the Google Cloud Platform. We work on building a set of easy to use Cloud tools and applications, as well as large, distributed systems such as Kafka and Cassandra, and keep them running in the Cloud. Responsibilities Build and manage our cloud application stacks, including Grafana, JFrog, and Hashicorp products Implement monitoring of systems and services, optimization of performance and resource utilization that identifies service disruptions Develop and manage consistent and coherent SRE processes and practices to support software development, testing, builds and deployment Assist in building infrastructure & tools architecture design to enable high uptime, minimize failures, ensure applications & data security, and expedite diagnostics Identify, diagnose, and resolve technical issues efficiently in a live production environment, and drive to quick resolutions, help with root cause diagnosis, and suggest improvements to prevent similar issues Participate in an on-call support rotation Consider security, sustainability, and supportability concerns with all work Role Requirements Knowledge of HashiCorp products like Vault, Consul, Terraform or similar products Monitoring, trending & diagnostics tools such as Grafana or Prometheus, including experience monitoring systems and/or applications Logging tools such as ELK, Loki, GCP Cloud Logging, etc. Alerting tools such as PagerDuty Experience Designing and Engineering large-scale distributed systems Experience managing reproducible infrastructure, e.g., Infrastructure as Code Good working knowledge of source code control systems such as GitHub Experience with at least one scripting language (e.g., Bash/Python/golang) Solid knowledge of public cloud architecture concepts and practice (GCP, AWS, Azure) Communication skills, and use of these to support customers or developers Problem solving skills and ability to search for and implement appropriate solutions Nice To Have Experience with Container Orchestration systems such as Kubernetes or OpenShift Experience with CI platforms like Jenkins, ArgoCD, GitHub Actions Ansible or Ansible AWX experience Clear understanding of Networking concepts (e.g., Firewalls, VPC, VPN, DNS, etc.) Working knowledge of databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) Web servers/reverse proxies such as nginx, apache httpd, and haproxy Work/defect tracking & Wiki systems such as Jira/Confluence Knowledge of the use and maintenance of continuous integration and continuous deployment CI/CD systems R018988

Job Title Senior Core Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R015192 Job Description Treyarch, the studio behind the best-selling Call of Duty: Black Ops franchise, is looking for a talent Senior Core Engineer to join our team to be a key contributor in developing our technology for future titles. In this role you will be focused on improving upon the performance of our games and working to enhance our content creators' workflow, ensuring we're able to deliver the quality expected from a Treyarch game. A successful Senior Core Engineer will also be a great teammate, and be flexible with the day-to-day needs of the project. What You’ll Do… Be part of the Core Engine Team in developing innovative new technology for our future games Work on the whole content pipeline, from level editing to the game Analyse, improve, optimize, and debug existing engine technology and tools Write and maintain efficient, readable, and reliable code Work with other disciplines to achieve the game’s feature and performance goals To succeed you should have… 5 years or more experience working in the video game or a related industry as an Engineer Experience with Console and PC APIs and tools Fluent in modern C++ and multi-threaded programming Communicate effectively with non-technical team members Work well in a diverse team environment We’d love it if you also have… Shipped at least 2 commercial titles – a 60Hz FPS is a plus Strong understanding of modern computer architecture Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field Python or other scripting languages Solid public speaking skills We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R015192

Job Title Senior Data Scientist Requisition ID R017290 Job Description Job Title: Sr Data Scientist Reporting To: Sr Manager, Data Science, Live Ops Analytics Department: Global Analytics Location: Santa Monica Your Mission Is The Live Ops Analytics Team is adding a talented Sr Data Scientist. As part of the team, your mission is to put science into decision making. Year one responsibilities include: Proactively perform data exploration to understand player behavior and identify opportunities for improving in-game features Partner with the Product Management Team, Studio, Central Design and Engineering to prioritize areas of opportunity to drive engagement and monetization, and enable easier experimentation Develop novel analytics to qualitatively deduce and draw conclusions from player behavioral data that directly influences game design, play balance, retention of our live titles Partner with studio and engineering teams to ensure smooth and timely instrumentation of gameplay and mtx measures Develop and monitor operational metrics to track the health of a live multimillion-dollar service business Measure the impact of features, promotions, store offerings, and events through experimentation and causal inference to fuel recommendations Democratize and socialize learnings by contributing to a centralized repository that informs future game design, and is carried across titles and franchises What You Will Bring To The Team We are seeking a leader who will contribute to team success by embodying all the characteristics of our culture Competently defines execution plans, and suggest projects for prioritization Executes analytical projects from ideation to action, finding the best questions to drive the best results Effectively manages own time and stakeholder expectations Fosters relationship with our stakeholders and partner teams to increase our sphere of influence Contributes to company learnings and proactively documents res Job Title:Senior Financial Analyst Requisition ID R017466 Job Description Blizzard Entertainment games don’t just begin with game ideas, or end once those games are released. A lot more goes into the creation of a Blizzard product than the work of developers—and we support our games for years after they’re in the hands of gamers worldwide. Blizzard Entertainment has an immediate opening for a Senior Financial Analyst. You will assist our eSports division with their forecast and annual budgeting processes. In addition, this person will provide financial strategic support to management including preparing financial presentations, financial analysis, and other projects requested by management. Responsibilities Prepare and analyze monthly financial and operating reports including, but not limited to, monthly operating statements, forecasts, monthly variance analysis, and budget data. Perform month/quarter/annual close activities which include analyzing accounts, making journal entries, performing account reconciliations, preparing reports and financial statements, and resolving issues as needed You will participate in the preparation of monthly forecasts, annual budgets, cost trackers, and long-range plans. Assist in the development and production of monthly dashboard reports, providing regular updates on YTD, QTD, and MTD performance to management. Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, expenses, and capital expenditures. You will help streamline procedures and improve system efficiencies. Monitor performance indicators, highlight trends, and analyze causes of unexpected variance. You will support the management team and department heads with ad hoc analysis, reporting, and special projects as needed. Assist in preparing presentations and supporting materials for management. Additional departmental duties as needed and assigned, of which the above are representative. Requirements Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related areas 3+ years accounting & finance experience, preferably at a publicly traded company The highest standards of accuracy and attention to detail in a dynamic, multitasking environment Excellent interpersonal skills at coordinating and consolidating inputs across multiple functions Validated ability to roll up sleeves and work in a hands-on capacity Teammate capable of communicating and collaborating across global and cross-functional partners Knowledge of general accounting and financial planning Able to vary work hours as needed to collaborate with global teammates Able to work independently, with limited direction Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint Pluses Experience with Hyperion and Essbase Experience in eSports, video game, software, or entertainment industries Blizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences R017466

Job Title Senior Data Scientist Requisition ID R016167 Job Description Your Mission The Senior Data Scientist will develop and operationalize machine learning models in order to personalize players experience in Call Of Duty franchises. This role also will focus on engineering and pipelines as well as analytics to advise business partners of our progress. Our team has a wide range of responsibilities across Game Operations, Marketing, CRM, and Business Planning. Some examples of other projects you may encounter: Recommender that personalizes messages of the day; mobile app display and flow; Customer Lifetime Value; Marketing models (emails and push notifications) and more. The Successful Candidate Will Demonstrate The Following Skills Prototype-to-production engineering skills in Python or Java, including standard methodologies such as source control, accurate documentation, library packaging, versioning, testing, containerization, CI/CD, and task scheduling Sophisticated analytics and SQL skills Machine learning expertise, i.e. regression, classification, and clustering algorithms. Time-series analysis, Bayesian methods, and survival analysis. Deep Learning experience a plus. Ability to understand and implement parameterized models from publications (i.e. Conference Proceedings in ML and Journals in Econometrics). Professional habits around model validation, testing, and tracking Solid knowledge of statistics, e.g. statistical power analysis, significance testing, t-tests, ANOVA Engineering experience in at least one cloud platform such as AWS, GCP, or Azure Exposure to stream processing infrastructure such as Kafka a plus Data engineering skills to facilitate data movement, ETL, and analysis Player Profile Minimum Requirements Masters in a quantitative science with heavy focus on data-driven modeling, e.g. Physics, Mathematics, Operations Research, etc.; or Bachelors + 2 years proven experience. Intermediate level depends on additional experience. Must be a tenacious and self-catalyzing problem solver. You don’t settle for good enough. Must be able to synthesize disparate data, detect and work around broken data, and investigate every possibility until you are confident you have and understand a detailed solution Process-oriented driving toward visibility, accountability, and communication Team-oriented, ability to build long-lasting and collaborative relationships optimally. You work selflessly and enthusiastically, serving as a positive catalyst for collaborative solutioning You contribute to the expertise in every data and analytic conversation as well as you listen with openness to other’s expertise A passion for analytics and diving into as well as experiencing the products on which you work (video game enthusiasm with a solid understanding of the connection of gameplay to spending behavior is a plus) Ability to adapt quickly, high tolerance for ambiguity, and ability to coordinate on a team Your Platform We’re headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many fields of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with outstanding rigor to build the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. Our World Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! Activision has been changing the way people play for the past 40 years—as the leading developer and publisher of video games, our teams have built some of the world's biggest, most ground-breaking, and beloved entertainment franchises in the industry. Ask anyone who works at Activision what their favorite thing about it is, and they’ll tell you it’s the people. We have world class brands, infrastructure, and resources, but our success comes from people producing greatness together. We are nothing without our employee’s brilliance. Activision is more than just the leading developer and publisher of video games; we are the creators of some of the world’s biggest, most ground-breaking titles in the industry. Our current portfolio includes Call of Duty®, Skylanders®, and Crash Bandicoot™. Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ: ATVI), headquartered in Santa Monica, California with locations across the globe, is one of the largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies in the world. Sitting at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment, our employees are some of the best and brightest across engineering, entertainment, media, and technology. A member of the S&P 500 Activision Blizzard is proud to be included as one of FORTUNE's "100 Best Companies To Work For®," "World's Best Employers," as well as "Most Admired Companies." In 2019 we were honored to receive a perfect score on our entry to the Corporate Equality Index as a Best Workplace for LGBTQ professionals and once again made Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies in Gaming. The video game industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as advised by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. jobTitle: Senior Development Director, PMO - Sledgehammer Games
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Development Director, PMO - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R018061 Job Description Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our hardworking employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our outstanding audio, design, engineering, and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting upcoming projects. Your Mission As a Development Director - PMO , you will help the studio to drive quality targets and own production schedules. This is achieved by working closely with various departments to identify needs, applying resources efficiently and appropriately. The role of a Senior Development Director requires candidates to be excellent and persuasive communicators, capable of coordinating with a wide variety of internal and external partners. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with all degrees of ownership, from personally leading to pro-active planning. Senior Production leaders must thrive in a complex and sometimes ambiguous environment, and be adept at driving quality in line with team, schedule, and budget. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Sr. DD (PMO) Responsibilities: Development process for how SHG, ATVI and external studios collaborate Headcount reconciliation and tracking process and regular management, ensuring alignment between Studios, Project, Operations, and Recruiting Long term (and aggregate) headcount allocation to upcoming and parallel projects Maintain production framework – milestone process, planning best practices, etc. Track delivery KPI’s to improve and maintain quality and predictability Rationalise org structure and ensure it meets the needs of the studios and the project Partner with HR to Implement Personnel Mobility Processes In Partnership with Other Leaders: Developing Sustainable Content Pipelines Collecting and Analyzing Development Historicals Creating Studio-wide Development Processes/Framework Director, Producer and Team Allocation Player Profile Minimum Requirements 8+ years of experience as a producer in games. Multiple shipped titles in leadership positions. Experience with direct people management. Strong project management fundamentals including capacity planning, scope assessment and management, and project milestone planning. Solid grasp of project management software (e.g. JIRA, Microsoft Project, Confluence, Hansoft, etc.). Extra Points Education, certification in project management, business, general management. Active video game player across a variety of genres, especially FPS games. Demonstrated knowledge of live games ecosystem and its major competitors. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Sledgehammer Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. #textio R018061

Team Name Overwatch Job Title Senior Enemy Designer - Overwatch Requisition ID R010590 Job Description The Overwatch team is looking for an accomplished Senior Enemy Designer to help us build exciting gameplay through combat. You will be instrumental in defining and implementing incredible PvE experiences in varying modes of PvE content. You are passionate about creating encounters that are challenging, fun, and empower players to feel heroic. You have the ability to drive design through all phases of development, from brainstorming, to implementation, to balance and bug fixing. You can adapt and align with different goals that each of our modes and pieces of content require. Most importantly, you thrive working collaboratively alongside artists, engineers, and other team members to work as a team to create amazing experiences for players of all skill levels and play styles. Reach out to us if you enjoy working with a team that strives for greatness, and supports one another to create something our fans will love for years to come. We want you to bring your passion and knowledge of games to a team that thrives on making each other better. Requirements 5+ years of experience as gameplay or enemy designer. Experience developing enemy AI behaviors and/or abilities. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Self-motivated and driven to grow and learn, as well as help those around you do the same. Strong problem-solving skills and game design philosophies with a focus on simplicity and impactful gameplay. Passion for video games, especially the shooter genre. Pluses CS experience, specifically with scripting languages. Design experience on any of the following genres: FPS, Multiplayer Coop, or MMO. Prior work experience or education in other (non-design) disciplines: art, programming, production, or audio. Passion for Overwatch. Required Application Materials Resume Cover Letter Job Status: Full-Time Primary Location: United States-CA-Irvine, Remote option available Blizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Job Title Senior Environment Artist (Foliage) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018478 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a Senior Environment Artist who is passionate about Foliage to join our maps team and drive the quality bar for vegetation in our games across current gen and next gen platforms. Qualified candidates will work alongside a team of extraordinary artists who have worked on one of the most successful video game franchises of all time. Our ideal candidate is excited about creating believable plants, bushes and trees that bring our environments to life. If you're passionate about video games, working collaboratively, and have an amazing foliage portfolio, come join our team! What You'll Be Doing… Maintaining, growing, and improving our foliage library for multiplayer maps, ensuring visual and technical quality standards are met. Working closely with the Tech Art team and Art Direction to define our vegetation needs, vetting existing content, and identifying action items for improving asset quality. Creating realistic models and textures for a variety of foliage needs. Working with scanned vegetation source content and travelling locally to scan content as needed using photogrammetry and photometric stereo rigs. Rigging foliage assets for believable movement. Working closely with Tech Art and Photogrammetry team to support and define new tools, shaders, features and workflows and related research and development. Identifying and troubleshooting foliage to stay within frame rate, memory, and design specifications. Working with external vendors as needed to extend foliage construction capacity, providing feedback that ensures quality and technical execution standards are met. Frequently communicating and collaborating with other Activision studios on foliage initiatives. To succeed you should have… A portfolio demonstrating a diversity of photorealistic foliage and biomes in one or more game engines, preferably leveraging real world scan data. Significant experience and techniques in the creation of trees, plants, shrubs, and vines using cards/flats. Strong technical capability ensuring assets fit memory, design and frame rate limitations. Strong polygon modelling skills, creating clean and efficient geometry quickly. A minimum of 5 years of experience working in the game industry modeling and texturing foliage using Maya (preferred) or related experience/software. A minimum of 3 years of experience working with SpeedTree. 3D modeling and texturing experience using Photoshop, Zbrush, Substance or related software. The ability to capture and process photogrammetry content into in-game assets using Reality Capture or equivalent. Strong opinions and knowledge about what it takes to achieve photorealistic foliage, from grass blades to bushes to trees that will be seen by players up close and at a distance. Self-motivated, independent and ability to self-manage to meet deadlines with minimal direction. Strong communication skills, being able to proactively update stakeholders with information and assets, and knows when to ask for help. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! jobTitle: Senior Environment Artist - High Moon Studios
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Environment Artist - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R013714 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history – and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are building a culture of collaboration and seeking an imaginative, skillful, and versatile Senior Environment Artist to join our team in Carlsbad, California. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Be Doing… Work with our Art Director and team to establish an iconic look for our world within the ambitious parameters set forth by our game designers. Work with our technical artists to establish an efficient environment content pipeline and identify possible needs and tools necessary to keep environment asset creation as streamlined as possible. Work hand in hand with a team of level designers, artists and lighters to develop levels from prototype to completion. Troubleshoot technical and artistic issues and maintain an awareness of level performance during development. Communicate and collaborate effectively with team members, production and management to ensure that project goals are defined and met on time. Craft visually stunning, atmospheric, effective and efficient 3D models of natural and architectural environments with strong drawing, texturing, and lighting skills and an excellent sense of spatial relations and structural logic. To succeed you must have… 5+ years of experience crafting high-quality 3D architecture, environments, and levels for AAA games. The ability to demonstrate and execute multiple art styles. A basic understanding of shaders, with preference given to those who are adept in material. creation, lighting solutions, and environmental effects. The ability to receive, give, and apply feedback effectively. High proficiency in Maya or 3ds Max, Photoshop and Zbrush. Experience with the real-time engines and have spent a considerable amount of time "in-editor". A passion for gaming, a contagious, positive demeanor, and be someone who takes pride in everything they do. We’d love it if you also have… A foundation in traditional art with ability to concept ideas. Additional experience in lighting, VFX, design, etc. Outstanding visual and technical understanding of 3D modeling and texturing. Architecture or cinematography experience. Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects. Please include a shot breakdown specifying what you were directly responsible for creating. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We employ more than 170 people in Carlsbad, CA, a seaside city in San Diego County. Our pride is our people and the experiences we have successfully created for our fans. High Moon's talent is comprised of gifted entertainment and technology professionals responsible for some of the most successful games ever made. We have award-winning developers, published artists and specialists recognized as among the best in their fields. Our studio has a history of using innovative techniques designed to boost productivity and product quality, which in turn enhances our studio's quality of life. High Moon Studios is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.highmoonstudios.com. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Craft believable photo real environment art that incorporates the needs of both high-level Art and Design direction as needed for a given space Collaborate closely with departmental counterparts to ensure your level both plays well and looks great Lead by example through industry high level content Work revisions are due to direction rather than quality Pre-Production – Plan and prioritize tasks to ensure best possible results Ownership - High level of creativity and independence; requires little oversight Proactively helps to troubleshoot and fix problemed content Expected to evaluate and help solve performance concerns Can mentor others as needed within the environment team Create documentation of processes for others to follow as needed Player Profile Minimum Requirements 6+ years of world building experience with an industry leading level editor. Job Title Senior Environment Artist (Materials) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018477 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a Senior Environment Artist who is passionate about Materials to join our maps team and play a key role in crafting, integrating, and regulating environmental materials for our games. Qualified candidates will work alongside a team of extraordinary artists who have worked on one of the most successful video game franchises of all time. Our ideal candidate is excited about creating realistic materials using photogrammetry source content that brings our environments to life. If you're passionate about video games, working collaboratively, and have an amazing materials portfolio, come join our team! What You'll Be Doing… Collaborating closely with Art Directors, Lead Artists, and Tech Artists to deliver physically-based Materials/Textures in accordance with our projects’ artistic direction, deadlines, and technical requirements. Using photogrammetry source content, procedural techniques, Substance, and 3D sculpting to create photorealistic tiling materials. Working with scanned photogrammetry source content and travelling locally to scan content as needed using photogrammetry and photometric stereo rigs. Working closely with the Tech Art team to support and define new tools, shaders, features, workflows and related research and development. Frequently communicating and collaborating with other Activision studios on material best practices and initiatives. Sharing your deep passion of crafting realistic materials for current gen and next gen game experiences. Acting as a trusted gatekeeper for material performance, efficiency, and quality. Inspiring and mentoring fellow artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and a positive attitude that is welcoming of constructive feedback. To succeed you should have… Proven ability to create high-quality materials using multiple major 2D and 3D packages (3DS Max, Maya, ZBrush, Photoshop and Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, PS, PC). A portfolio demonstrating a diversity of photorealistic environmental materials in one or more game engines that demonstrate use of real world scan data, procedurally generated content, and 3D sculpted techniques. The ability to capture and process photogrammetry content into in-game assets using Reality Capture or equivalent. A solid understanding of PBR standards and surface/light interactions. A strong understanding of how 3D environments are assembled in game engines such as Unreal, Radiant, etc. Strong opinions and knowledge about what it takes to achieve photorealistic materials. Self-motivated, independent and ability to self-manage to meet deadlines with minimal direction. Strong communication skills, being able to proactively update stakeholders with information and assets, and knows when to ask for help. A minimum of 5 years of experience working in the game industry developing materials/textures for next gen AAA games with at least 3 shipped titles in the console / PC space. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide!
