Job Title Senior Environment Artist (Photogrammetry) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018779 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a Senior Environment Artist who is passionate about creating 3D Architectural kits and Biome Assets to join our Photogrammetry team and support our maps by playing a key role in crafting, integrating, and regulating environmental 3D content for our games. In this role you'll be working alongside a team of outstanding artists who have worked on one of the most successful video game franchises of all time. We're looking for someone passionate about creating realistic art kits using photogrammetry source data that brings our environments to life. If this sounds like you, come our team! What You'll Be Doing… Collaborating closely with Art Directors, Lead Artists, and Tech Artists to create high quality art kits using photogrammetry as source data in accordance with our projects’ artistic direction, deadlines, and technical requirements. Implement feedback from the World Building Team on the content generated by the photogrammetry team. Collaborate actively with the Design team on supporting gameplay functionality while achieving believability in content. Be directly involved in the development of beautiful corners at early stages of the map cycle to solidify the visual benchmark for our map. Ability to multitask across different maps and Game Modes, attending to particular gameplay needs without compromising quality. Assist with providing feedback to external vendors on photogrammetry art kit best practices based on the team’s needs. Working closely with the Tech Art team to support and define new tools, shaders, features, workflows and related research and development. Frequently communicating and collaborating with other Activision studios on content creation best practices and initiatives. Act as a trusted gatekeeper for visual quality, performance and efficiency. Inspire and mentor fellow artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and a positive attitude that is welcoming of constructive feedback. To succeed you should have… Proven ability to create high-quality 3D art kits using multiple major 2D and 3D packages (3DS Max, Maya, Reality Capture, ZBrush, Photoshop and Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, Playstation, PC). Understanding of multilayered asset creation workflows. The ability to capture and process photogrammetry content into in-game assets using Reality Capture or equivalent. A solid understanding of PBR standards and surface/light interactions. A strong understanding of how 3D environments are assembled in game engines such as Unreal, Unity, Radiant, etc. A self-motivated, independent personality and the ability to self-manage to meet deadlines with minimal direction. Strong communication skills, being able to proactively update partners with information and assets and feel comfortable in asking for help. 5+ years of proven experience working in the game industry, developing 3D content & Materials for next gen games with at least one shipped title. A portfolio demonstrating a diversity of photorealistic environmental content in one or more game engines that demonstrate use of real-world scan data and procedurally generated content. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobTitle: Senior Expert Engineer, Systems - Raven Software
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Expert Engineer, Systems - Raven Software Requisition ID R007902 Job Description As a Senior Expert Systems Engineer you will optimizing, enhancing, and developing new engine systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA technology. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a passionate team that defines and shapes the technology of our upcoming Call of Duty titles. You will be developing the engine systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in engine development and the subsystems that support games. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design, modify, optimize, and debug engine systems Research and document ways of improving our engine systems Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teams Participate in the performance and code review process Contribute to the design and roadmap of industry-leading AAA engine technology Collaboration and co-development with other engineering teams Minimum Requirements We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Experience developing and optimizing engine systems Effective 3D math and algebra skills Strong programming skills in C/C++ Background with multi-threaded systems Understanding of computer architecture and memory management Debugging skills Shipped at least one game title 5+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented programming Demonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Nice to have Development experience with networked multiplayer games Experience with bandwidth and latency in a client-server architecture Development background targeting multiple platforms (Linux, Windows, and consoles) Understanding of compression, encryption, and/or security Background with physics systems and experience with file streaming and I/O technologies About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty, World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Raven Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Team Name: Senior Financial Analyst Requisition ID R017466 Job Description Blizzard Entertainment games don’t just begin with game ideas, or end once those games are released. A lot more goes into the creation of a Blizzard product than the work of developers—and we support our games for years after they’re in the hands of gamers worldwide. Blizzard Entertainment has an immediate opening for a Senior Financial Analyst. You will assist our eSports division with their forecast and annual budgeting processes. In addition, this person will provide financial strategic support to management including preparing financial presentations, financial analysis, and other projects requested by management. Responsibilities Prepare and analyze monthly financial and operating reports including, but not limited to, monthly operating statements, forecasts, monthly variance analysis, and budget data. Perform month/quarter/annual close activities which include analyzing accounts, making journal entries, performing account reconciliations, preparing reports and financial statements, and resolving issues as needed You will participate in the preparation of monthly forecasts, annual budgets, cost trackers, and long-range plans. Assist in the development and production of monthly dashboard reports, providing regular updates on YTD, QTD, and MTD performance to management. Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, expenses, and capital expenditures. You will help streamline procedures and improve system efficiencies. Monitor performance indicators, highlight trends, and analyze causes of unexpected variance. You will support the management team and department heads with ad hoc analysis, reporting, and special projects as needed. Assist in preparing presentations and supporting materials for management. Additional departmental duties as needed and assigned, of which the above are representative. Requirements Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related areas 3+ years accounting & finance experience, preferably at a publicly traded company The highest standards of accuracy and attention to detail in a dynamic, multitasking environment Excellent interpersonal skills at coordinating and consolidating inputs across multiple functions Validated ability to roll up sleeves and work in a hands-on capacity Teammate capable of communicating and collaborating across global and cross-functional partners Knowledge of general accounting and financial planning Able to vary work hours as needed to collaborate with global teammates Able to work independently, with limited direction Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint Pluses Experience with Hyperion and Essbase Experience in eSports, video game, software, or entertainment industries Blizzard Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences R017466

Job Title Senior Full Stack Engineer Requisition ID R016130 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprised of seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland and Japan. Most of our teams are comprised of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our dedicated engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission The Central Tech team is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to join us in managing the infrastructure that supports backend game servers for some of the largest multiplayer games in the world. This is a very small team with a very large responsibility! Responsibilities Be hands-on in crafting and scaling the services that directly enable game features driving revenue and player engagement. You’ll see your contributions influencing our players’ experiences in major ways. Level up innovative and scalable services. Strong understanding of team system architecture and design. Awareness of adjacent team’s systems Improving the Node.js stack/shards, MongoDB and web tools Owns feature development end-to-end Proactively maintain and develop backend systems infrastructure Participate in the improvements of the stability, efficiency, and scalability of our environments Be responsible for routine maintenance procedures and perform detailed testing. Help craft the culture, tooling, delivery methods and standard methodologies. Partner with multi-functional teams to design and implement solutions consistent with industry best practices Strengthen the culture of service ownership at Activision. Engage in mentoring more junior team members to level up this mentality in other engineers. Requirements 5+ years of front and back end work experience Experience with Cloud platform and technologies Advanced understanding of Python and Javascript Sophisticated understanding of C Advanced understanding of Linux Expertise in MongoDB Experience with Deployment tools (Ansible/Puppet/Chef) Expertise in Node.js and Django Self-motivated individual that possesses excellent time management and organizational skills Pluses Experience with additional programming languages (Java, Go, etc.) Experience with React Experience with Docker Containerization Cloud experience (AWS/GCP/Azure) Expertise in crafting, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems Ownership of initiatives from inception through deployment and sustainment Passion for Activision Blizzard games We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Game Designer (Zombies) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018563 Job Description Heed the call of the never-ending hordes of the undead! Channel your passion to create the next Call of Duty Zombies experiences. As a Treyarch Senior Game Designer working on our Zombies mode, together we will turn nightmarish, adrenaline-fueled dreams into reality! What You’ll Do… Act as a Point Designer, the Game Design point of contact who represents your small team of Game Designers for your assigned map and who provides oversight to the team itself. Work with Design Leadership to create designs and bring them to fruition using scripting and our level editor. Participate in regular playtests, give feedback and provide recommendations for next iterative direction. Work with production and leadership to reach product goals. Learn and grow by collaborating with industry veterans across a wide spectrum of professions. Mentor other designers as opportunities arise. Contribute to the success of the team by sharing your unique knowledge and experiences with others, look for opportunities to improve our processes and practices and be an example of treating people with respect. To succeed you should have… The ability to contribute directly to the game while also providing oversight on content and team members. Proficiency with one or more scripting or programming languages (C-like languages a plus). The ability to clearly articulate and communicate design ideas using any text and visuals to a diverse audience ranging from the visually inclined to the technically minded. The ability to weigh pluses and minuses to design choices to find the one that best fits the situation, even if that means finding a new solution that no one has thought of. We’d love it if you also have… Experience working in a position with Job Responsibilities similar to the above listing with a team of at least 3 game designers in a professional setting. Proficiency with debugging and problem solving. Experience with first or third person shooter game design. Experience with quest design, especially involving multiple cooperative players. Experience with Live Support (patching a live product). Experience with AI design and/or tuning. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. jobTitle: Senior Gameplay Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Gameplay Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009891 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and dedicated development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior Gameplay Animator, you will be expected to create high fidelity 3rd person Player Character animations that align to our pursuit of ultimate player immersion. This Immersion is achieved with Animations that support a strong understanding of human locomotion and its underlying principles. The ability to analyze and de-construct the human range of motion, implementing the “feel” the project dictates, is the prime directive. You will be joining our Passionate and Dedicated team of Animators who, continue pushing our standards of quality and drive, that echoes throughout our studio. If you’re looking for the right environment to display and master your talents, then Infinity Ward is the place for you! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Use Motion Capture and Hand-Keyed Techniques to create high-fidelity 3rd person player Animations that are genre-defining Implement and maintain Animations using Proprietary Tools and always evolving Animation engine Communicate and collaborate with the most passionate team of engineers and designers to blur the line between NPC behavior and Player Movement Player Profile Minimum Requirements +4 years of Game Development experience A strong passion for Animation, video games, and the entertainment it inspires and draws from A strong ability for Hand-Keyed Animation Excellent Maya Animation experience Possess the ability to take tasks from concept to completion with minimal supervision Collaborative ability to work with multiple people and fields to complete tasks Possess the ability to provide and receive feedback from Animators We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. jobTitle: Senior Gameplay Engineer - High Moon Studios
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Gameplay Engineer - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R017648 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history - and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are seeking a talented Senior Gameplay Engineer who will work closely with content teams to push our gameplay systems to new heights of fun and visual fidelity, crafting new systems and leveraging existing ones to realize immersive and exciting gameplay. This is a great opportunity to work with a passionate engineering team on the world’s most popular game franchises! What You’ll Be Doing… Collaborate with designers and animators to create new gameplay systems and expand existing ones Support the design department by working on a variety of generalist tasks, to facilitate their efforts Spearhead the development of innovative gameplay experiences Implement, debug and optimize major systems in C/C++ and other languages in the context of a large cross platform codebase Provide mentorship to less experienced engineers To succeed you must have… Excellent C++ programming skills, with knowledge of algorithms and data structures Proficiency in 3D math, related to game programming Strong design sensibilities and outstanding communication skills A passion for making video games Advanced debugging skills Experience extending an established code base 5+ years of experience in games Multiple shipped games Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math related field We’d love it if you also have… Open world game development experience Expertise in one or more of the following areas: Player mechanics, particularly in an FPS Weapon mechanics Animation – blend trees, IK, motion matching Networked game logic Physics simulation Vehicle simulation AI Experience with scripting languages Experience with console development High Moon Studios Founded in 2002, High Moon Studios is an award-winning studio developing for the Call of Duty® franchise, with past development on over 15 titles including Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone, Bungie’s Destiny 2: Forsaken, and Transformers: Fall of Cybertron. We employ more than 170 people in Carlsbad, CA, a seaside city in San Diego County. Our pride is our people and the experiences we have successfully created for our fans. High Moon's talent is comprised of gifted entertainment and technology professionals responsible for some of the most successful games ever made. We have award-winning developers, published artists and specialists recognized as among the best in their fields. Our studio has a history of using innovative techniques designed to boost productivity and product quality, which in turn enhances our studio's quality of life. High Moon Studios is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.highmoonstudios.com. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Senior Gameplay Engineer - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R010912 Job Description Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We'd like to speak with you! As we head into decade II of development, we’re focused on constantly evolving, innovating and trying new things – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With world-class audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love what we do and work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for passionate game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. This is an excellent opportunity to work with a passionate engineering team and help shape innovative industry technology. Collaborate with designers to create new gameplay system. Support the design department by working on a variety of generalist tasks, to facilitate their efforts. Optimization work, related to performance and bandwidth improvements. Bug fixing and polish tasks. Player Profile Fluency in 3D math, related to game programming. Fluency in C++. Strong design sensibilities and outstanding communication skills. Staunch work ethic and high personal standards of quality. demonstrated ability in games. 3+ shipped titles. Experience with 3 C's: Camera, Character, Controls Bonus XP AAA play-control logic, especially on an FPS title. Modern animation techniques and blend trees. Networked game logic. Job Title Senior Gameplay Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R018344 Job Description We are looking for a talented engineer with a passion for gameplay and a critical eye for game design to join our team in either Los Angeles or Vancouver. As a Senior Gameplay Engineer, you will be working closely with our Design team to bring innovative game features to life. A Gameplay Engineer should be excellent at rapidly prototyping ideas and be capable of quickly turning a design specification from paper into a usable game system for further iteration. A successful Senior Gameplay Engineer will have an “eye” for gameplay and a knack for understanding how to deliver exciting features that millions of fans are going to love. You should be able to get quickly familiarized with existing codebases and be able to write elegant, high performing extensible code that works well within a collaborative environment. What You’ll Do… Implement, debug and optimize major systems in C/C++ and other languages in the context of a large cross platform codebase Spearhead development of innovative gameplay experiences Contribute to game architecture and technical designs and postmortems Perform data and code analysis to identify improvement opportunities Provide mentorship to less experienced engineers To succeed you should have… 5+ years of proven experience in a Gameplay Engineering role or similar position with multiple shipped titles Proficiency in C/C++ Proficiency in scripting language such as Python or Lua Advanced knowledge of algorithms and data structures Advanced optimization and debugging skills Strong math skills – especially linear algebra and 3D vector math Game knowledge and an understanding of the design principles behind games Able to collaborate with other engineers and non-technical team members, and be able to adapt to a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges constantly evolve B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience And most importantly, a passion for making games We’d love it if you also have… Advanced programming specialty, such as low level network programming, High Level Shader Language (HLSL), SSE assembly, etc Expertise and passion in one or more of the following areas: AI, User Interfaces, Animation, or General Gameplay We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobTitle: Senior Lead Weapons Artist - Sledgehammer Games
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Lead Weapons Artist - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R017652 Job Description Your Platform Sledgehammer Games, award winning developer of multiple titles in the Call of Duty franchise, is looking for dedicated developers to join our studio as founding members of our new UK team, based just south of London in Guildford. This group will partner equally with our teams in Foster City, Melbourne, and Toronto in the creation of epic content for some of the biggest games in the world. This is an opportunity to help grow and shape a AAA team from the ground up, adding new skills to your armory while gaining the unique satisfaction that only comes from building something brand new. Join us on our quest to maintain and improve a healthy and inspiring studio culture! At Sledgehammer Games, we recently entered our second decade of game development, focused on constant evolution, innovation and qualified risk-taking. With world-class content production and engineering teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love what we do and work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for passionate game developers for our exciting new projects. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission As a Lead Weapons Artist, you will be responsible for helping to build and maintain a worldwide creative team to work on Call of Duty content. You will train and mentor new artists joining the team and complete creative direction to produce shippable content, meeting the standards expected from the franchise. You will also keep your skills sharp, modeling and texturing industry-bench mark weapons, setting a strong example for your team. If you have a desire to work on the most successful FPS franchise in the history of video games, please apply online. Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects. Please include a shot breakdown specifying what you were personally responsible for creating. Sledgehammer Games has innovative facilities, an industry leading development team, and a studio culture built to promote and support world class game developers. We are actively recruiting top talent for our Call of Duty development team. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work closely with the Art Director and a team of artists, animators, and designers to create world class weapons lineup Maintain and share extensive knowledge pertaining to weapons, vehicles, gear and equipment. The creation of game ready AAA vehicles, weapons and gear derived from concept drawings, and reference photos.  Properly estimate time to complete work, manages competing priorities and builds in buffers. Work within budgets while hitting key timelines Troubleshoot technical and artistic issues Communicate effectively with team members, production, and management to ensure that project goals and deadlines are met Deliver environments that adhere to strict performance targets Evaluate software, tech, and tools to help see opportunities for pipeline improvement Create and collaborate with Live ops to support an offering worthy of the CoD franchise Understanding of BPR materials and ensuring alignment from the team on standards and practices related to PBR Contribute to high quality look development with the goal of setting the bar Able to prioritize and delegate tasks to junior members of the art team Help train and mentor artists on your new team Player Profile Minimum Requirements 8+ years of experience creating high-quality 3D weapons, vehicles, and other hard surface assets for AAA games Ability to implement highly detailed, photo realistic environments, helping to set the bar for other artists at the studio Receive, give, and apply feedback effectively while maintaining a positive attitude Highly proficient in Maya or 3ds Max, Photoshop and Substance Painter Strong understanding of lighting, color and scene composition Advanced understanding of physically based material creation, with preference given to those who are adept in material creation Proficient in next-gen asset creation Determined, dedicated to advancing your craft, and eager to learn new techniques and software. Strong communication and organizational skills Proven leadership qualities, either through previous roles in a lead position or multiple examples where you took on extra responsibilities You are passionate about games; take pride in everything you do and have a positive attitude Extra Points 2+ AAA games shipped Foundation in traditional art with ability of concepting ideas. Additional experience in lighting, VFX, design, etc. Exceptional visual and technical understanding of 3D modeling and texturing. Proficient in Zbrush, substance, CAD like software Understanding of photogrammetry processes and workflows. A love and understanding of weapons, vehicles keeping up with trends and tech. Experience working in a multi-site studio or building games with multiple internal or external partner teams We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Level Designer Requisition ID R016149 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create state of the art technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to unleash your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission We are looking for a passionate and talented Senior Level Designer to join Infinity Ward. In this hands-on role, you’ll collaborate with experienced designers on envisioning, designing, and ultimately implementing new multiplayer maps and points of interest on large scale open world maps. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for adding and maintaining core logic features which allow these levels to function such as – AI spawning systems, loot nodes, pregame in-fill sequences, etc. Senior designers at Infinity Ward are force multipliers for the team, in addition to your day-to-day personal responsibilities, you’ll often be needed to onboard new hires and mentor junior designers. You should be an example to the rest of the design team, showing what best looks like and how to efficiently go about your work. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Envision, pitch, design/document, and then build awesome core multiplayer levels Apply core map level building principals to Points of Interest inside an open world map Demonstrate “what good looks like” to junior members of the level design team while mentoring and in some cases onboarding and training new hires Maintain the quality and stability of your work from creation to ship via bug fixing and peer review-based feedback iteration Actively engage in peer reviews of other levels and game modes Player Profile Experience 3+ years of industry experience in a designer or senior designer role Shipped at least one project, ideally action RPG or FPS genre in a level design role Familiarity with game editor tools such as Radiant, Unreal, Unity or Crytek Editors A strong demonstrable portfolio of personal and/or professional work Knowledge & Skills Self-motivated, proactive team player with excellent problem-solving skills Good oral and written communication skills A deep interest, and passion for First Person Shooter (FPS) games Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. Job Title Senior Level Designer (Zombies) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018943 Job Description Your group of survivors huddles in a small-town gas station garage steeling yourselves for what may be your last stand. As undead breach makeshift barriers guns bark, adrenaline pumps, and corpses fall. As you fight your way out onto the street you see a strange structure in the distance. The ground at its base seems to be moving as a Horde appears on the horizon. This, you realize, is just the beginning. If this has your imagination churning, and you want to help us craft these kinds of experiences for our players, come join the Zombies Level Design Team! As a Senior Level Designer, you’ll help drive Zombies map production and mentor other Level Designers as opportunities arise. What You’ll Do… Own full map geo and work autonomously on your day-to-day tasking. Collaborate with developers across multiple subject areas to design spaces that balance realism and the fantastic nature of Zombies while supporting the tone and vision of our maps. Work with Design Leadership to take maps from paper design to 3D blockouts. Work closely with Game Design, Systems Design, and Engineering to create spaces that leverage new and existing Zombies features. Iterate and refine designs based on feedback from team and studio wide feedback. Contribute to ideation on everything from Wonder Weapons to New Perks. To succeed you should have... Prior experience on one or more published AAA titles as a Level Designer. Clear and proactive communication skills. Ability to manage your time effectively, delegate tasks, and multitask. Ability to execute design concepts such as level flow, engagement design, and pacing Ability to identify and communicate risks in deadlines and assignment scope. We’d love it if you also have… Experience with the Radiant level editor. Familiarity with the Zombies mode. Experience sculpting realistic terrain in level/world creation packages. Familiarity with recent shooters and the trends of the genre. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Senior Lighting Artist - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R010108 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Infinity Ward, developer of numerous award-winning games, is seeking a Senior Lighting Artist, with experience in game development and an interest in working with next-generation technologies. If you are a Senior Lighting Artist and have experience shipping AAA titles with visually stunning lighting aesthetics, then we are looking for you! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work with Level Designers, Environment Artists, Visual Effects Artists, and Team Leads to provide lighting for game environments and characters. Creation of static and dynamic lighting using our proprietary game engine software. Generate visually stunning creative solutions that are within memory and performance guidelines. Ownership of level lighting process from initial look dev to final polish pass. Solve technical issues that arise with tools, process or game performance. Help to maintain standards for physically correct lighting across teams and studios. Support the content and data acquisition process for skies and materials. Provide mentorship to other team members in specific areas of expertise. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 4+ years of real-time lighting experience on pc or current console hardware. Solid understanding and experience with runtime and pre-baked lighting techniques. Ability to be self-motivated and self-directed. Experience and understanding of current “industry standard” real-time PBR techniques. Solid understanding of photography, camera terminology, exposure, and light. Understanding of composition and the ability for lighting to enhance mood and gameplay. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with both Artists and Engineers on large teams. Knowledge of color theory, HDR techniques, and how to use light and shadow to create form. Ability to follow design reference, mood pieces, concept art and implement Art Directors vision. Experience with one or more scripting/programming languages. Coding and shader writing experience a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Our passion for developing award-winning games with diverse genres includes the Crash Bandicoot®, Call of Duty®, Overwatch®, Spyro®, Skylanders®, and Tony Hawk® franchises. Job Title Senior Manager, Accounting Requisition ID R018454 Job Description Your Mission The Senior Accounting Manager will be responsible for the general accounting and financial reporting management of the company’s North America and Corporate ledgers. This critical position has oversight responsibility for all aspects of GL accounting and related sub-processes. The ideal candidate will develop, document and enforce accurate accounting methods, procedures, and policies. In addition, the ideal candidate will carry out consistent and efficient month-end and quarter-end close processes that ensures the timely processing of accurate monthly results. The position requires having the ability to independently foresee and prepare for any upstream and downstream impacts associated with new transactions and initiatives. It also requires being able to identify and resolve accounting issues and process inefficiencies. The ideal candidate will be helping with various projects and must have the competence to work cross-functionally with other areas of the business to coordinate and manage the timely completion of the assigned project-related tasks. Responsibilities Include (but Are Not Limited To) The Following Responsible for day-to-day general ledger accounting and reporting Participate in our global month-end close and consolidation process, including review of journal entries, account reconciliations and preparation and/or review of financial reporting results and flux analyses. Ensure execution of appropriate accounting treatment on accounting issues in accordance with US GAAP. Possess a deep understanding of ERP systems and related sub-modules, including the development, implementation and/or maintenance of accounting systems and associated enhancements. Understand business activities and objectives and make recommendations and changes to improve and support scalability in the team organization, business systems and processes. Work effectively in a high growth environment - comfortable in both individual contributor roles and cross-functional team management roles, depending on what is required by the business at the time. Promote a culture of continuous improvement and operational innovation and regularly interact with business owners and senior level management on accounting matters. Develop and mentor accounting analysts to build their professional career and maximize potential Partner with internal and external auditors to maintain a strong internal control environment and regularly supervise and assess risks associated with our current and new processes. Participate in ad hoc projects and initiatives Other duties may be assigned Player Profile B.A./B.S. in Accounting Minimum of 10 years’ proven experience in professional accounting Experience with cash, prepaid, fixed assets, accruals and GL accounting, etc. Proven experience in optimizing accounting processes Must possess strong analytical skills with ability to problem solve. Ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to both technical and non-technical partners Ability to work in a dynamic accounting department, successfully juggling daily responsibilities, projects and results Must possess strong work ethic and willing to work extra hours and weekends during quarter-end and year-end closes in order to meet targets Extensive knowledge and use of Microsoft Excel Experience with Oracle eBusiness Suite, OBIEE Answers and/or Hyperion Essbase is a plus We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivalled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. Craft Data, Analytics & Strategy Job Description Activision Blizzard Media (ABM) is looking for a Business Strategy, Senior Manager/Associate Director to join the Strategy & Operations team. In this role, you will report to the Head of Business Strategy and Demand Operations, Director, and work closely with ABM leaders to design major strategies/actions plans, seek alignment and ensure execution. You will also work closely with other operational leaders at ABM, as well as stakeholders (including senior leaders) within the ABK organization. You will be a critical leader in setting, maintaining and implementing a vision leading to exponential revenue growth, setting a path which considers opportunities and challenges. What You'll Do Maintain a vision for ABM’s long-term strategy, consistent with ABK’s vision, and align it across ABM Leadership and broader team Transform our vision into execution plans. Leverage frameworks such as OKRs to ensure clear ownership and measurement, and efficient execution Partner with ABM Leadership to refresh yearly and quarterly plan to ensure the best course of action is pursued Ensure that our business strategies are well communicated, aligned, and incorporated into functional strategies (Product Strategy/Roadmap, Go-To-Market Strategy, etc.) Set a cadence for business reviews and lead meetings through deliverables, outcomes, and actions to drive goals and priorities Act as a subject matter expert in the world of advertising within ABK. Develop and maintain expertise of the fast paced gaming and ad tech market. Anticipate and evaluate impact of major industry changes (e.g. Apple’s ATT) and be ready to evolve ABM’s long-term and short-term paths Support decision making by bringing subject matter expertise and insightful data Lead execution of cross-functional strategic projects to create new avenues of growth and/or remove roadblocks Identify and pursue growth projects. Rally leaders and teams behind prioritization and pursuit Help build the ABM POV of external growth opportunities via acquisitions and partnerships, based on our long-term strategy and goals, as well as market dynamics Lead regular and adhoc presentations/updates to King and AB Leadership. Set agendas and desired outcomes, create and coordinate content, facilitate high quality content and conversations Lead or support adhoc projects in support of the General Manager of ABM, or other ABM Leadership members Who You Are 5-7 years of experience in relevant position: Credible Management Consulting firms or Corporate/Business Strategy team in relevant industry Good understanding of gaming and ad tech strongly preferred A thought leader / partner who excels at collaborating with team members and influencing senior leadership Strong program and stakeholder management skills bringing structure, visibility and efficiency to multiple on-going initiatives with different cross-functional touchpoints Ability to process complex information, bringing in framework to navigate and design solutions for complex issues Has good business intuition backed by a data-driven approach to decision making Excellent written and verbal communication skills, experience in storytelling / insight presenting in PowerPoint format Strong work ethic and an appetite to learn more about the ever-changing gaming and ads industries About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R015766

Job Title Team Name: Senior Manager, Benefits Requisition ID R018603 Job Description Job Title: Senior Manager, Benefits Division: Human Resources Cost Center: HR, Corporate Strategy Immediate Supervisor: Sr. Director, Benefits Our highly progressive Benefits team is looking for a Senior Manager, Benefits to maximum employee engagement with health and wellbeing programs. Basic Functions A strong focus is placed on sourcing, managing, and developing enterprise-wide strategies aimed at improving employee engagement with the programs that are offered that support the health and wellbeing of employees and family members This includes managing wellbeing program partners, the wellbeing incentive program and measuring the meaningful engagement and outcomes from these programs. Responsible for developing and leading the issues resolution inflow from employees, including benefit critical issues for exception, as well as self-service avenues including intranet, Open Enrollment preparation, external website, as well as plan document management. Duties And Responsibilities Evolve an enterprise global wellbeing strategy to support the physical, emotional, and financial health of our covered population based on industry leading principals for determining priorities and methods for deployment. Develop and deploy employee engagement strategies including targeted communication and promotion of programs that encourage covered members’ appropriate use of our health and wellbeing programs Partner with Communications team on strategies to highlight our unique and innovative Benefits programs that represent an important component of the value proposition that makes Activision Blizzard King an employer of choice Manage and source outstanding wellbeing program partners to ensure our programs are operating according to our contract and that the vendors are receiving the data vital to provide the services agreed upon. Manage, measure, and conduct onsite events, such as educational sessions, Blizzard’s Moonwell Wellness Studio, onsite Physicals, annual Health Fairs, etc. Manage the New Hire Benefit Orientations and the Benefits Communication Specialists through our third-party vendor. Manage, benchmark, and propose meaningful updates to Benefit programs in response to a dynamic landscape. Manage issue resolution inflow, by establishing effective proactive communications as well as self-service approaches. Measure efficiency of our education and promotional strategies Consistently update plan documentation to ensure administrative practices are in compliance with ERISA, HIPAA, FMLA, ADA and other regulations. Position Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business, Human Resources, or a related subject area required. Outstanding communication skills with a demonstrated background of success in presentations, promotion and/or marketing Outstanding demonstrated project management skills with ability to manage multiple projects concurrently In-depth knowledge of daily benefit administration Knowledge of laws pertaining to employee benefits (e.g. ERISA, HIPAA, IRS Section 125, FMLA/ADA, etc.) Strong digital literacy such as MS Office products (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and HRIS (Workday a plus) Must demonstrate the ability to handle confidential information with discretion and maturity Proven organization skills, ability to prioritize effectively and manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands Ability to work independently with minimal direction Flexibility and adaptability in a fluid and rapidly changing environment Willingness to do more than basic job requirements as needed Minimum of 8 years of experience in Benefit Administration We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Team Name: Senior Manager, Vulnerability Management Requisition ID R018702 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Job Title Senior Mission Designer Requisition ID R018729 Job Description Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to develop, implement and tune player-first experiences that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You are a self-sufficient, fire and forget teammate who takes ownership of tasks, proactively and independently solve challenges, and delivers high quality work in a timely manner. You must thrive in a challenging and often ambiguous environment. An agile and flexible mindset is also necessary since this position actively partners with a variety of internal and external partners. Excellent and persuasive communication skills are a must. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated teammate to help tell our story. You will… Collaborate with Creative Directors, Designers, Engineers, Artists, Producers, and Animators to deliver a world-class player experience. Research subject matter relating to the design objective to ensure an authentic experience. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently execute high-level direction. Clearly and effectively pitch designs and features using multimedia tools. Work in Radiant to create play-spaces that are engaging and immersive. Mentor fellow Designers. Play builds of games in-progress and provide concise and prioritized feedback to both internal teams and external partners. Interface with other teams to ensure level requirements and plans are understood. Possess a comprehensive understanding of the design process spanning all facets of the game. Work closely with our user-testing teams during play-balancing to provide expert feedback. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 5+ years in the games industry working in a level design capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. Passionate and egoless attitude that welcomes feedback and criticism, and enjoys working in a collaborative, iterative, and agile process. Strong understanding of geometry building, flow, and layout. Ability to lead by example. Impressive communication skills. Solid understanding of level design with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Strong problem-solving skills. Hunger for gaming (especially online) with a broad range of game experience. Extra Points Profound understanding of the Call of Duty franchise and Warzone. Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the F2P games space. Prior experience working on a games-as-a-service product. Experience with visual software (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.).
