Job Title Senior MuleSoft Developer - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R017612 Job Description Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! We are actively seeking a Senior MuleSoft Developer, who will be responsible for MuleSoft administration, design, development, customization of MuleSoft APIs and Integrations. This is a hands-on role. Join the ABK IT Team, and work closely with other team members across IT and business users to identify and deliver the best solutions for the business. You’ll be responsible for the admin, design, development, testing, support, and maintenance of Enterprise Applications Integration solutions. Activision Blizzard is the umbrella organization over Activision Publishing, Blizzard Entertainment, King Digital, Activision Media Networks and Activision Blizzard Studios and provides corporate shared services such as Legal, HR, Finance, IT, Accounting, Facilities, Sales for all companies. Responsibilities Design, build, customize and support MuleSoft APIs and Integration Solutions for Enterprise Applications spanning across Finance, Player Support, HR, IT and Sales & Supply Chain, and other business areas, troubleshooting, identifying issues, performing root cause analysis, documenting, and providing the best solution to the problem. Follow Activision’s Development Standards and Processes. Review requirements document; propose and design solutions; estimate efforts, create technical design, deployment and other required documents per Activision Standards and Processes. Production support, documentation and deliver onto ad-hoc requests. Provide regular status updates. Develop appropriate test scenarios and scripts as needed. Write automated unit test cases in MUnit providing acceptable code coverage. Setups and configurations as needed for development and support activities. Ability to plan, organize and manage time across multiple priorities. Ability to work independently is must to have. Ability to architect, deliver and support complex hybrid Integration solutions involving Oracle EBS and various other peripheral systems including but not limited to On-premises, SaaS, Cloud based applications. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex production issues. Ability to keep current with latest trends in related technology. Be a strong team player and collaboration with cross functional groups. Skills & Qualifications Master’s in computer science or Bachelor’s degree with related technical field (or equivalent experience) preferred. 5+ years of strong Hands-On Integration development and support experience with excellent problem-solving skills in MuleSoft with 1+ Year in Mule 4.2+ and API Management areas including but not limited to Any point Platform, Flow Design, API Design. Data weave, Cloud Hub, Runtime Fabric, API Management. Strong knowledge in Web services and API technologies (REST, XML/JSON, SOAP, XSLT). Prior Knowledge and experience in integrating with Oracle R12 EBS will be a big plus and will be given preference. Prior Knowledge and experience in integrating with systems like Salesforce, Workday, Concur, Oracle CPM, Oracle OCI, ServiceNow is a plus. Strong experience in configuring APIs, proxy endpoints, API portals and API analytics based on technical specifications with MuleSoft API manager. Hands-On Experience implementing guaranteed message delivery framework using one of queuing platform A-MQ, Anypoint MQ, AWS SQS. Strong experience in REST, HTTP, MQ, JSON, XML, and SOA Design. Strong experience in developing enterprise services using RAML in Mule, REST based APIs, SOAP Web Services and use of different mule connectors. Strong experience in delivering solutions confirming to the required Security standards (e.g., SSL/mutual SSL, SAML, oAuth) is a must. Experience in designing and building API-led Connectivity in Hybrid environment (On-premises to Cloud and vice-a-versa, Cloud to Cloud, On-premise to On-premise) Experience in Jenkins/CICD, Gitlab, DevOps tools and technologies will be a plus. Excellent knowledge of Anypoint Studio and Anypoint Designer Integration Platform Deploying and maintaining MuleSoft application; Maven and Gitlab a plus. Experience in Testing Automation and STAT analysis will be a plus. Production support, Root cause analysis, documentation and deliver onto ad-hoc requests. Working knowledge of SQL, Java, Python (any or all) is a plus. Ability to effectively work in a team environment with varying skill set levels. Ability to effectively work within a geographically diverse team. Independent, proactive, self-driven individual. Excellent analytical ability and critical thinking skills. Zeal to quickly learn and adapt to other technologies; self-driven, self-learner. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. R017612

jobTitle: Senior Narrative Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Narrative Animator - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009899 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior Narrative Animator, you will be expected to create high fidelity animations that align to our pursuit of ultimate player immersion. This Immersion is achieved with Animations that support the Design Narrative of our games, including Real-Time Action, Cinematics and Dialogue Sequences. The ability to identify and execute the “feel” of the Sequences the project dictates, is the prime directive. You will be joining our Passionate and Talented team of Animators who, continue pushing our standards of quality and drive, that echoes throughout our studio. If you’re looking for the right environment to display and master your talents, then Infinity Ward is the place for you! Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Use Motion Capture and Hand-Keyed Techniques to create high-fidelity Action, Cinematics, Dialogue and Misc. Animations, in real-time, that are used to convey the Design Narrative of the game Implement and maintain Animations using Proprietary Tools within our Game Engine Communicate and collaborate with internal and external depts to complete tasks Player Profile Minimum Requirements +4 years of Game Development experience A strong passion for Animation, video games, and the entertainment it inspires and draws from A strong ability for Hand-Keyed Animation Excellent Maya Animation experience Possess the ability to take tasks from concept to completion with minimal supervision Collaborative ability to work with multiple people and disciplines to complete tasks Possess the ability to provide and receive feedback from Animators Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R009899

Job Title Team Name: Senior Network Engineer Requisition ID R017582 Job Description Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc., a member of the S&P 500, is the world’s most successful standalone interactive entertainment company. We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world through franchises including Activisionʹs Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzardʹs World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and Kingʹs Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™. The company is one of the Fortune ʺ100 Best Companies to Work For®ʺ. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, Activision Blizzard has operations throughout the world, and its games are played in 196 countries. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the company’s website, www.activisionblizzard.com Your Mission Activision’s global information systems team is looking for an experienced and dedicated Senior Network Engineer to help in supporting Activision Blizzards’ global network. The ideal candidate is adept to providing world class operational support to enterprise network environments. Engineer will perform day to day operational duties and be an escalation point for other support teams when needed. This individual will also serve as a key resource on projects, working directly with project managers to implement network related technology solutions. Engineer will be part of the Activision Blizzard King team that will be responsible in leading and supporting the Blizzard and King infra. Good communication and interpersonal skills are required, as well as a desire for delivering great customer service. Responsibilities Ensure all global production network environments and related systems and services are available 24x7. First responder and escalation to incident and request tickets from Activision Blizzard’s users and teams. Planning, implementation, supporting and maintaining switches, firewalls, routers, proxies, wan accelerators, data center and networking infrastructure to prevent productivity and data loss. Perform daily system monitoring and environmental health checks Solve and remediate issues impacting WAN, LAN and internet connectivity. Fix and remediate issues impacting the operation of the network infrastructure. Assist in design, documentation, configuration, integration, and installation of sophisticated network infrastructure. Able to implement sophisticated projects and time-sensitive tasks under minimal direction. Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies, systems engineering and architecture standards and strategies to increase reliability and manageability and deliver training. Provide 24X7 on call support as part of an on-call rotation Performs other related duties as assigned. Player Profile Advanced knowledge of networking systems, protocols, software and technologies including but not limited to routers, switches, load balancers, WAN technologies. Advanced Understanding of WAN/LAN/DMZ/etc., VPN’s, TCP/IP, DNS, VLANs, etc. in a distributed environment. Experience in LAN/WAN technologies – fiber, Ethernet, WiFi, PTP, MPLS and or DWDM Experience in design, configuration and troubleshooting of routing protocols OSPF, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, IS-IS, MPLS, and VRF's. Experience with enterprise network switching and routers Experience with cabling technologies - Category 5, Category 6, Single & Multi-Mode Fiber Proficient in packet analysis (Wireshark) Good interpersonal and communication skills Knowledge of computer security systems, applications, procedures and techniques. Ability to generate reports in short notice using tools like Visio, Spreadsheets (or similar) and explain solutions and explain data. Highly motivated and dedicated, capable of working with little instruction to resolve demanding tasks, as well as work with internal teams Experience working in an enterprise datacenter environment Pluses A degree in computer science or a related field Network Certifications (CCNA/CCNP/JNCIS/JNCIP) or higher. Experience with Cisco ASA, Juniper SRX and or Palo Alto Network firewalls. Experience with Juniper QFX and EX switches, FBF/VRF’s and Juniper MX routers Experience with Cisco Catalyst/ Nexus Switches, and or ISR/ASR Routers Experience with Aruba or similar wireless technologies Experience with Cisco ISE/Aruba Clearpass Experience with monitoring tools (Solarwinds, LibreMNS, etc) Experience with WAN compression and acceleration Experience with Load Balancing technologies (F5, A10) Experience with SAN storage technologies including ISCSI, FCOE Experience with virtualization: VMware, Cisco UCS Understanding of ITIL framework and processes A passion for video games Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification in the job posting. At Activision Blizzard we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment so we strongly encourage you to apply even if you don’t believe you meet every single qualification outlined. We also do our best to ensure all applications received are responded to. Activision Blizzard is headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many disciplines of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivaled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. The video game industry and therefore our business are fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as advised by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. R017582

Job Title Senior Offensive Security Engineer Requisition ID R017982 Job Description Your Platform Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility and creativity to improve the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB Your Role Within Our Kingdom The Offensive Security team is looking for an experienced penetration tester to join the team. This person will be working together with the rest of the global team, ensuring that all the software developed at Activision Blizzard is tested for vulnerabilities. You’ll be part of the team in charge of performing penetration testing, red team exercises and finding all kinds of vulnerabilities inside the Kingdom. Skills To Create Thrills You have a self-starter attitude so you’re able to take direction and execute tasks on your own while working in a team. Other skills include: BS in computer science or related field or equivalent experience Strong knowledge of all sorts of vulnerabilities and the technical insights behind them Deep knowledge of common web application technology stacks and the vulnerabilities that can be exploited in all the different layers of the application Willingness to learn and work on other disciplines apart from web application security Extensive technical experience, performing web application penetration testing and mobile application security Ability for reviewing source code, being able to understand pieces of code in any major language so you can leverage that knowledge to exploit a vulnerability Experience writing vulnerability reports for different audiences (security engineers, developers, managers,…) Familiarity with Google Cloud services (GCP) services and understanding the vulnerabilities that such environments may suffer from Must be willing to travel occasionally Excellent written and verbal communication skills (fluent in English) Tasty Bonus Skills Experience in planning and executing red team exercises Experience reviewing Java applications Hands on experience on network penetration testing Familiarity with cloud services (AWS and Azure) Experience with devops culture and the systems development life cycle (SDLC) We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Job Title Senior Online Engineer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R014848 Job Description Your Mission Come work with the game industry’s brightest to design and implement high level network code for an exciting unannounced title. This role is for experienced programmers that have a passion for games and experience with online infrastructure design and development. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Maintain and implement integration of first party online services Build and expand Activision cross-title service infrastructure Optimize and debug game network traffic and improve on existing network architecture Player Profile Minimum Requirements Proficiency in C and C++ Strong background and knowledge in server architecture and TCP/IP networking Knowledge of networking protocols (UDP) and patterns used for online games Understanding of the implementation requirements of client-server and peer-to-peer networking models Current generation console programming experience with a reputation for creating clean, efficient, and well tested code B.S. in Computer Science and/or Mathematics or equivalent work experience Self-motivated with excellent problem solving skills Good oral and written skills Interest in games, preferably first person shooters “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Online Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R018575 Job Description Raven Software is looking for a dedicated Senior Online Engineer to help bring our online experience to the next level. As an Online Engineer, you will help develop an exciting networked game experience for our players, being responsible for client features, multiplayer systems, online community features, tools, and more. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design, Implement, debug and optimize systems in C/C++ and scripting languages. Work closely with other Engineering and Design teams (Gameplay, UI) as well as the Backend developers to prototype, develop, and refine features. Author or contribute to technical designs and documentation. Optimize and maintain existing code. Instrument, analyze, and optimize network game traffic and participate in the performance and code review process. Take ownership of a larger Online system or tools. Minimum Requirements We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. 4+ years of programming experience with at least 1-year focus on networking and online systems. Shipped 1+ game title(s). Proficiency in C/C++ and experience with a scripting language(s). Excellent knowledge of algorithms, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques. Proven track record to write clean, portable, reliable, and optimized code that complies with existing coding standards. Proficiency in client-server networking architecture. Good understanding of network protocols, RESTful APIs and JSON. Ability to quickly understand and work with internal and externally developed code. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other engineers, systems designers and producers. Nice To Have University-level degree in Computer Science or related field (preferably with an emphasis on Networking or Games). Experience with LUA, Python, and other script languages. Experience with matchmaking and party management systems. Experience in data science (SQL, visualization, analysis, pipelines). Experience working with first party online services such as Xbox Live, PlayStation Network, or Steam. About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Job Title Senior Online Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R017223 Job Description Treyarch is looking for a passionate Senior Online Engineer to help bring our online experience to the next level. As an Online Engineer, you will be responsible for client features, multiplayer systems, online community features, tools and more (did we mention eSports?). You should be able to get quickly familiarized with an established codebase and be able to write elegant, high performing extensible code that works well within a collaborative environment. We have offices in Los Angeles and Vancouver and you will be welcome in either of these locales. We will consider candidates at all levels of seniority, depending on experience. What You’ll Do… Design, Implement, debug and optimize systems in C/C++ and scripting languages. Work closely with other Engineering and Design teams (Gameplay, UI) as well as the Backend developers to prototype, develop and refine features. Author or contribute to technical designs and documentation. Optimize and maintain existing code. Instrument, analyze, and optimize network game traffic. Participate in the performance and code review process. Take ownership of a larger Online system or tools. To succeed you should have… 5+ years of programming experience with at least 1 year focus on networking and online systems. Shipped 1+ game title(s). Demonstrated proficiency in C/C++ and experience with a scripting language(s). Excellent knowledge of algorithms, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques. Demonstrated ability to write clean, portable, reliable, and optimized code that complies with existing coding standards. Proficiency in client-server networking architecture. Good understanding of network protocols, RESTful APIs and JSON. Ability to quickly understand and work with internally and externally developed code. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other engineers, systems designers and producers. Ability to work well in a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges evolve. We’d love it if you also have… University-level degree in Computer Science or related field (preferably with an emphasis on Networking or Games). Experience with Lua, Python and other scripting languages. Experience with matchmaking and party management systems. Experience in data science (SQL, visualization, analysis, pipelines). Experience working with first party online services such as Xbox Live, PlayStation Network, or Steam. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R017223

Craft Advertising & Sales Job Description We are seeking a skilled Advertising Partner Manager that has a passion for digital advertising, data driven platforms and the gaming industry to help us scale a player-first advertising business. You will work collaboratively with an array of top tier developers and support services to create exceptional ad experiences that make a meaningful contribution to our games. You will play a pivotal role in defining what we build and why we build it. Apply for this role if you are a hungry and talented individual that has insight into the key drivers that make for a successful mobile game and have a deep understanding of mobile ad monetisation. Responsibilities Business development Establish new partnerships by successfully aligning with key stakeholders across our internal game studio teams on advertising monetization and Activision Blizzard Media’s (ABM) product solutions Relationship Management Work with key stakeholders including game teams to partner in growing player life-time value and revenue of our games through the adoption and utility of our advertising product, services and solutions Partner with a team of product marketeers, researchers and designers to develop and iterate on best practice and insight materials Manage communication on technology stability issues, business critical incidents together with business impact across teams Define opportunities beyond King’s other teams like marketing team, platform partnerships team to deliver incremental values for company Partner & Product Enablement Take ownership of product adoption, and realisation of product value and overall success by understanding a games production lifecycle and how adoption enables delivery of game objectives Shape the direction and mobilise resources need to deliver actionable recommendations supported by data and analysis Become an expert in ABM’s advertising technology, product and services; educate, share experience and train game teams on how to best leverage our set of world class products Assemble product requests from multiple sources to clearly articulate current and future customer needs Build business cases and analytical insight for new business initiatives: this requires identifying key issues, quantitative analysis and clear communication Skills To Create Thrills You have a proven track record in building strategic business-to-business partnerships based on strong understanding of both parties strengths and needs Excellent business judgment and the innate ability to link business objectives to customer experiences You are able to translate and document long term needs/objectives and set out clear milestones and deliverables to achieve these The ideal candidate will be service oriented and willing to go the extra mile to ensure stakeholders and game studio partners are successful in scaling game performance across a range of disciplines. Ability to interpret, internalise, and decision off of data Experience working with mobile F2P games is an advantage Education: Graduate Degree preferred. Bonus Points Experience/a proven track record managing or directly contributing to a live business during a period of rapid growth Prior experience in mobile game development, mobile advertising or both! Prior experience in startups, studios, and consulting firms Candidates from customer success, consulting, game studios, mobile app development, and ad technology should apply. You have an ability to demonstrate an understanding and experience in developing player- first game experiences. About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R015896

Job Title Senior Physics Engineer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R015882 Job Description Your Mission Infinity Ward is looking for a talented Senior Physics Engineer. This Engineer will maintain and improve upon our proprietary physics framework, pipeline and feature-set, all built around Microsoft's Havok. They should possess strong practical knowledge of C/C++ at both low and application levels and have a good understanding of 3D math. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Drive our collision data pipeline to create the highest fidelity scalable environments and assets Architect and support simulation and query behaviors to maintain our position at the cutting edge of FPS physics related gameplay and visuals Collaborate with other internal departments to schedule and execute on the game’s design requirements Deploy, evaluate performance, optimize, and test software on PC and console platforms Collaborate with other Activision studios across the world Player Profile Minimum Requirements 5+ years of experience working as an engineer in the game industry or a similar industry Significant experience with physics pipeline requirements and runtime behaviors. Direct experience with Havok is a plus Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Demonstrated ability to write efficient, performant, clean, readable, portable, and reliable code Passion for games “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.” About Infinity Ward Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, CA, just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. #textio R015882

Job Title Senior Producer, Live Ops (Environment Art) Requisition ID R018582 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We'd like to speak with you! We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our extraordinary audio, design, engineering and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games, and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting next project. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission Being responsible for the game development process to produce high quality content. Working with development team(s) to define and meet project breakthroughs. Accountable for crafting and maintaining project plans and schedules. Leading project resources and needs to meet production schedules and budgets. Recommending and implementing new processes where efficiencies are needed to improve timely or on-budget delivery. Ensuring all necessary project documentation is complete and up-to-date. Establishing and maintaining a productive and communicative working environment. Identifying and resolving conflicts between schedule, budget, and design goals. Player Profile Minimum Requirements At least 3+ experience in the entertainment software industry in a leadership/coordination role. Experience collaborating with internal and external development teams. Producer experience of the entire life-cycle of video-game software development (concept to ship) of at least one published title on Xbox 360, PS3, Wii, Wii U, XboxOne, PS4, PC and/or Mobile platforms. Ability to diagnose reasons for inefficiency and suggest solutions for removing such inefficiencies. Ability to foresee and communicate risks and obstacles to all collaborators. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Extra Points Experience working with engineering and the execution of online features. Confirmed experience with project management software, including project life-cycle models, risk assessment, and team management/motivation. Solid ability to work under rapid development cycles. Experience with development planning tools (i.e. Scrum, Jira, Confluence, etc.) Bachelors’ degree in computer science, engineering, or related technical field or relevant work experience. Confirmed leadership experience including: employee selection, employee development, performance management, conflict resolution, team facilitation, budgeting, and project planning. Project Management training and certification. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. Job Title Senior Producer, Release Operations & Automation Requisition ID R019031 Job Description Job Description Senior Producer, Release Operations & Automation Your Mission Activision Publishing seeks a Senior Producer to join the Call of Duty franchise production team responsible for release operations and automation. The best person for this role has passion and a consistent record of leading and collaborating with multidisciplinary teams in quality pursuit. They have experience producing, leading testing and release management of a large franchise. In this role, they will lead all aspects of various pipelines for their teams, drive execution, own schedules, and work closely with various release operations and automation team members to identify needs, prioritize efforts, use resources efficiently, and continuously align multi-team efforts against top-level organizational goals. They will partner closely with the VP of Release Operations and Automation on defining and driving the execution of testing & automation strategy, building the best-in-class testing practices, and be the change agent pragmatically focused on continuously contributing to all partners. The role of Senior Producer requires the candidate to be a data-driven and persuasive communicator, capable of dealing with a wide variety of internal and external partners across company leadership levels. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with all degrees of ownership, from personally managing projects to top level tasking & assessing through other Producers. They have strong understanding of all facets of game development and are effective in partnering with wide spectrum of business partners – Engineering, Production, QA, Localization, Marketing, CS, etc. Your Responsibilities Will Include Drive the success of the various strategic efforts in close collaboration with all key partners and teams throughout the release management process and workflow Proactively identify improvement areas and implement new processes where efficiencies are needed to improve operational predictability and excellence Champion data-driven planning, decision making, and continuous improvement of quality and release practice Help develop QA and Build Automation tools and tech product specific roadmaps and drive their execution, adoption, and measure their impact across franchise year on year. Advocate and champion innovation & transformation in release management and automation. Establish model behavior that supports Activision’s standards of professionalism, integrity, and ethics. We Are Looking For Demonstrated ability in the interactive entertainment industry in a Production leadership role with a focus on Quality, Automation, and Release operations Production experience of the entire life cycle of video-game software development (concept to post launch) of at least one published title on console/pc/mobile with an extreme focus on developing & driving teams against a regularly cadenced production plan Ability to diagnose existing quality practice inefficiencies and drive solutioning across key collaborators to improve said inefficiencies through process, tooling or organizational realignment Ability to foresee risks, drive the development of their mitigation strategies, and communicate the top-level assessment to all required partner groups Excellent written and oral communication skills Experience working with QA, engineering, studio production teams, release management teams Demonstrated experience with program management of cross-functional efforts, including project life-cycle models (including reporting), risk assessments, and team management Proven ability to thrive while working in the unpredictable and rapid development nature ever changing game development environment Expertise with development planning tools (ie: Jira, Confluence, Microsoft Suite, etc.) Mastery of fundamental Production principles (ie: SCRUM, Waterfall, Agile), including their strengths, weaknesses, and ideal application scenarios Bonus Points Bachelors’ degree in computer science, engineering, game design/production or related technical field Interest in the FPS genre of games Deep understanding of current industry trends, standard methodologies, and key innovations We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone will thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Our industry and business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Job Title Senior Product Manager - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R017305 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward has opened a brand new studio in Austin, TX. The studio will work on creating new and innovative experiences for Call of Duty® and create innovative technology to power them. Our studio provides a safe, trusting, and empowering environment to unleash your creativity and help make the extraordinary. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Sr. Product Manager you will support the design and live-service vision across multiple Call of Duty features and products produced and contributed by the new Infinity Ward Austin studio. You will give data-driven insights and designs to maximize engagement and retention in a player-focused live environment. Reporting to the Game Director, you will partner with various external and internal partners at Activision and Infinity Ward Austin to ensure the product strategy, creative vision, and player experience are fully optimized, while looking for new opportunities to grow player engagement. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Drive Strategy and Innovation - Look for new critical initiatives to drive and lead to implementation in the game. Event Strategy and Management - Help support events and come up with new ideas for how to deliver future events in COD. Business Opportunity Analysis - Find opportunities and develop supporting materials with quantitative and qualitative-driven insights, advocating for creative and innovative solutions to complex problems. Competitive Intelligence - Understand how different games operate their live services to help inform some of our strategic decisions. Data Analytics Initiatives - Find new ideas to A/B test to further the growth of the COD live services ecosystem. Performance Tracking - Monitor performance of live services promotions and initiatives to understand run rates / trends to help continue to grow COD live services. Be The Product Expert - Understand the player journey and create best-in-class messaging that lives both in-game and out, ensuring key selling features and product info is represented accurately in market with a strategic lens towards improving comprehension, conversion, and player satisfaction. Player Champion - embody the "player" view internally, driving a fan first viewpoint across the org and post-launch product plans; ensure that the player's voice helps drive the direction of the franchise. Player Profile Experience 5+ years of experience in product management, preferably from gaming (console, PC, or mobile); entertainment; technology; or consumer products. Experience in feature or system design, virtual economy management, and live operations. Knowledge & Skills Demonstrated ability to develop and shape an existing product by continuously seeking out and pursuing new opportunities. Data-driven attitude that is able to understand our player base and market trends and translate them into business opportunities. Proven ability to generate innovative ideas and solve complex problems while staying true to Infinity Ward’s core values. Familiarity with behavioral economic concepts, data analysis, UX/UI, game systems design, and A/B testing. Ability to balance a data-driven attitude with creative problem solving, while maintaining a player-focused perspective. Exceptional business judgment with a strategic and analytical attitude. Excellent written and verbal communication skills – ability to articulate complex ideas and influence others. Key Attributes Ability to be a self-starter and individual contributor on the team Ability to communicate well, in both small and large groups Comfortable with giving and receiving candid feedback A deep passion for gaming and entertainment. Solid understanding of the latest gaming systems and industry trends. Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience is required. Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task with demonstrated performance of managing multiple projects at once. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Product Manager: Monetization Requisition ID R018726 Job Description Job Title: Senior Product Manager: Monetization Reporting To: Director of Product Department: Call of Duty: Mobile Product Team Location: Santa Monica, California Your Mission Welcome to Solid State Studios! We’re a new in-house studio within Activision, dedicated to developing the best AAA mobile games in the world. Our first project is the AAA mobile hit Call of Duty: Mobile, which generated over $1 billion in consumer spending in 2021. We are looking for great talent who are passionate about their work and share our belief in what AAA experiences on mobile can and should be. We’re incredibly excited to build our teams and get to work, and invite you to join us in making something special. Your Profile As Senior Product Manager: Monetization, you are responsible for the design and execution of our overall monetization strategy for Call of Duty: Mobile. You will work with analysts and researchers to improve our understanding of the main factors that drive appeal of our in-game content (e.g. skins, weapons, operators). You’ll use these insights to help build a roadmap with improvements to monetization systems, and iterate on frameworks for how we decide the monetization content to create. You’ll also lead our IP licensing strategy, working with others at Activision to identify and sign potential partnerships. You will report to the Director of Product, who leads the Call of Duty: Mobile product team, and will manage an Associate Product Manager. Main Mission Improve our understanding of the drivers behind the appeal of our in-game content by partnering with analysts and researchers, and by digging into dashboards and data Use learnings to define and improve our overall monetization strategy Build and iterate on frameworks to help decide which content to release each season Identify improvements to existing monetization systems and propose new systems Partner with other Product Managers, Live Operations Specialists, and our development team at Tencent to define our roadmap and execute our strategy Lead IP licensing strategy, partnering with others at Activision to secure deals Minimum Requirements 5+ years experience in product management or similar roles Experience creating new or improved product features that drive business outcomes Able to clearly synthesize insights from analysis and research to diagnose root causes of problems Strong structured and critical thinking skills, able to craft a clear and well prioritized strategy and roadmap Strong analytical skills and ability to dig into data to uncover insights, experience with analytical tools like SQL and Tableau preferred Experience designing and running A/B tests Excellent communication skills and ability to influence others We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Your Platform Solid State Studios is an emerging team within Activision Publishing focusing on both publishing and live- operations for Call of Duty Mobile along with our new in-house studio dedicated to the development of AAA mobile titles. Designed around the singular focus of creating the best games in our space, ours is a mobile studio like no other. Developing in collaboration with Activision studios around the world, work on a new AAA mobile game in the Call of Duty franchise has begun. It takes the industry’s best talent to make entertainment history, and while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a driven and diverse team of people producing greatness together. We’re looking for developers from mobile and PC backgrounds passionate about their work and who believe in realizing the potential of mobile gaming as much as we do. Our World We’re highly collaborative, relaxed, and deadly serious about creating incredible entertainment for passionate players around the world. We approach mobile development as a craft, and our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got you covered! About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. Job Title Senior QA Functional Tester Requisition ID R017472 Job Description Job Title: Sr. QA Functional Tester Reporting To: QA Project Lead Department: Quality Assurance Location: Austin, TX Your Platform Founded in 1979, Activision has continuously disrupted the world of entertainment as a leader in the videogame industry. With a history of delivering iconic game changers -- like Pitfall®, Tony Hawk®, Guitar Hero®, Crash Bandicoot™, Skylanders™ and Call of Duty® -- our obsession is delighting our players around the globe. Focused and committed to innovation, we consistently deliver the most beloved, engaging and successful entertainment. And while we have world-class franchises, infrastructure and resources, our success comes from a passionate, talented and diverse team of people producing greatness together. So, if you’re interested in our biggest priority, it’s our people. We’re currently driving the next era for our company and community by creating amazing experiences for fans and continuing to make Activision an inclusive place where everyone can thrive. Join us, make history. To learn more, check us out at www.activision.com, www.activisiongamesblog.com or @Activision on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Your Mission Senior QA Testers are a support function within the Quality Assurance team. They will take on some leadership responsibilities, often overseeing and guiding a group of testers to accomplish tasks or test cases set out by the Project or Associate Lead. They are mentors to newer testers and will assist in the development and training of their testers to be better contributors to the project. They may assist in some lead duties such as writing status reports or creating other documentation that may be needed by the development or Production team. In rare cases, the Senior QA Tester may also be called upon to perform in an acting QA Project Lead role, which involves organizing and leading the testing effort on assigned pre-release video games. Depending on the project a Senior tester may also be responsible for testing and generating bug reports for pre-release video games as well as verifying functionality, data content, performance, 1st Party Compliance, usability/playability, and hardware/software compatibility. Duties And Responsibilities Is primarily responsible for a small group of testers on the project, being their first contact point to answer questions, advise in their testing methods, and help direct them on their tasks and test cases. May be called upon to direct larger groups for playtests, high player count game mode checks, or other tasks requiring a large group. Assists in the development of new testers through coaching and goal setting to improve their performance. Assists assigned QA Project Lead as a floor lead or platform lead. Assigns tasks to the test team, and follows up on the completion of assigned tasks to ensure that they're completed in a timely and accurate manner. Assists the Associate and Project Lead in the maintaining of DevTest cases. Undertakes additional responsibilities, such as database management, or in researching and gathering data for metrics, as assigned by the QA Project Lead. Assists in training and mentoring new testers in the basics of testing the game and QA testing policies and procedures. May assist the QA Project Lead during meetings with Production or technical support groups. May be called upon to present testing results in higher level meetings with senior management. Looks for ways to improve testing effectiveness. Coaches other testers in innovative testing techniques and encourages testers in ways to break the game beyond the obvious approaches. Encourages testing "outside the box". Reviews tester performance and gives recommendations to their lead about their viability as a team member. May be called upon to help manage the test team in the QA Project Lead's absence. Follows instructions and accomplishes tasks as directed by the QA Project Lead or QA Management. Assists the Production/Development team in tracking down issues and working out the steps to reproduce so that they are easier to locate and fix. Minimum Requirements Player Profile: Technical Familiarity with Devtrack and JIRA. Good knowledge of most popular console platforms and related peripherals, PC Software/hardware, and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel). Understanding of the software test cycle process. PC and console game troubleshooting. Experience and familiarity with multiple gaming platforms and genres. Non-Technical Experience with organizing and leading a group of individuals to complete complicated tasks. High school diploma or equivalent. Must possess excellent spoken and written communication skills. Proactive, driven individual with a strong work ethic. Ability to work in a team environment. Demonstrates leadership potential. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R017472

Job Title Senior Rendering Engineer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R015875 Job Description Your Mission Infinity Ward is currently seeking a talented Senior Rendering Engineer to join our development team. The ideal candidate will be someone with a passion for graphics, enjoys working closely with content creators, and has experience with real-time simulations/games. You should feel comfortable working in most areas of the rendering pipeline, but also have an area of interest where you’ve spent some time focusing your energy. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work with the engine team to develop cutting edge rendering technology for our next AAA title. Work closely with the content team to understand the desired visual results. Write and maintain robust, high-quality code which meets performance goals given the challenging technical constraints of the target platforms. Analyze, optimize, and improve existing rendering pathways and content creator workflows. Contribute ideas for features and improvements as the engine evolves. Communicate and educate fellow developers about implemented features and rendering technologies in general. Adhere to team coding standards and best practices. Understand and embrace the constraints of a game development cycle. (you know when bug fixing, and optimization become more important than new features) Player Profile Minimum Requirements B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or equivalent. 5+ years of graphics programming experience, including Xbox One, PS4 or equivalent platform development. Knowledge of performance and memory constraints as they relate to game development. Strong 3D math skills and low-level engine experience are essential. Good understanding of multi-threaded programming. Strong understanding in modern 3D graphics APIs. (Direct3D11+, OpenGL4.0+) Excellent debugging and performance analysis skills. Working knowledge of modern-day GPU hardware and typical performance bottlenecks: Xbox One, PS4, GCN/Kepler + etc. Working knowledge of writing gpu shaders. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, CA, just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. Job Title Senior Rendering Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R018572 Job Description As a Senior Rendering Engineer you will be optimizing, enhancing, and developing new rendering systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA engine technology. You will be developing the graphics systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in graphics engine development and related subsystems. This includes a fluency with modern graphics techniques, GPUs, graphics APIs, shaders, multi-threading, memory management, performance, and optimizations. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Develop, modify, optimize, and debug rendering engine systems Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teams Participate in the performance and code review process Collaboration and co-development with other engineering and art teams Player Profile Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Experience developing and optimizing graphics systems Understanding of computer architecture, GPUs, and memory systems Strong programming background in C/C++ Experience writing shaders (HLSL or equivalent) Development experience with a current generation platform (console, PC, and/or mobile) Solid debugging skills, including ability to debug at an assembly-level when necessary 5+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Proven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team members Creative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-oriented Demonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Strong background in 3D math Passion for games and graphics technology Extra Points Shipped at least one game title Demonstrated work with modern consoles, profilers and toolchains Experience with PS4 GNM, Direct3D 12 and/or Vulkan APIs Familiarity with physically based rendering/lighting Background in collaborating and iterating with artists on graphics features About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Raven Software is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.ravensoftware.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ravensoftware, and @RavenSoftware on Twitter. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. Job Title Senior Security Engineer Requisition ID R018611 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming, and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland, and Japan. This role is expected to begin and continue as a remote position. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Security Integration Engineer you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats to both gameplay feature and anti-cheating integrity. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a constantly evolving threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and being able to react to newly emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an overall engineering team effort, you would be expected to be both hands-on working directly on protecting game features and integrity, in addition to playing a role in a longer-term technology and capability build-out. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of game title features, ensuring known exploits are corrected and potential threats are addressed. Be a priority resource to work side-by-side game engineers, as the engineering support representative of the Central Technology Game Security team. Perform R&D into both new techniques and technologies. Work closely with experts within the security team to identify the best course of action to protect game features and implement countermeasures to known cheats. Identify emerging threats, propose countermeasures, and implement these in a timely manner. Be the game title eyes-and-ears to report back potential issues and make recommendations for areas to improve. Be a proactive part of team to monitor and measure effectiveness in anti-cheat efforts. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. Strong C/C++ development on game titles, including some understanding of assembly code, and solid understanding of source control standard methodologies and hands-on knowledge of P4. Reverse engineering, sophisticated debugging, ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Knowledge of social engineering, malware, industry standard methodologies for game and code security. Security-focused role on previously published games. Be part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. If you are an avid gamer with a security and systems engineering background, come be a part of our team. The Senior Security Engineer will support ABK Security Eng and other business partner teams to build out, maintain, and troubleshoot our rapidly expanding information security systems, infrastructure, and tools. This role reports into the Senior Manager, Engineering and maintains strong relationships with all line-of-business technology groups. You will work closely with several key individuals and teams and will be part of a talented team of security engineers and architects who demonstrate superb technical competency, delivering mission critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance and security across our enterprise. Qualified candidates will have a background in IT, computer, security systems analysis or engineering. security infrastructure and policies; and risk mitigation Serve as the technical SME on project work Mentor other team members through technical challenges Experience with network technologies, security, and monitoring tools Thorough understanding of the latest security principles, techniques, and protocols Ability to problem solve independently and collaborate as a team to solve complex problems in support of the team’s mission Proven experience in installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Microsoft Windows and/or UNIX/Linux based environments Knowledge of industry best practices for foundational security elements including network devices and system-level hardening Experience leading technical projects Extra Points Knowledge of Cloud Services like Google Cloud, AWS, Azure Knowledge of containerization software: Docker, Kubernetes Knowledge of shell scripting, Python, Perl Knowledge of Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) products.
