Job Title Senior Security Integration Engineer Requisition ID R015960 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming, and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland, and Japan. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Senior Security Integration Engineer you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats to both gameplay feature and anti-cheating integrity. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a constantly evolving threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and being able to react to newly emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an overall engineering team effort, you would be expected to be both hands-on working directly on protecting game features and integrity, in addition to playing a role in a longer-term technology and capability build-out. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of game title features, ensuring known exploits are corrected and potential threats are addressed. Be a priority resource to work side-by-side game engineers, as the engineering support representative of the Central Technology Game Security team. Perform R&D into both new techniques and technologies. Work closely with experts within the security team to identify the best course of action to protect game features and implement countermeasures to known cheats. Identify emerging threats, propose countermeasures, and implement these in a timely manner. Be the game title eyes-and-ears to report back potential issues and make recommendations for areas to improve. Be a proactive part of team to monitor and measure effectiveness in anti-cheat efforts. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. Strong C/C++ development on game titles, including some understanding of assembly code, and solid understanding of source control standard methodologies and hands-on knowledge of P4. Reverse engineering, sophisticated debugging, ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points Knowledge of social engineering, malware, industry standard methodologies for game and code security. Security-focused role on previously published games. Be part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Craft Technology & Development Job Description Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We are seeking a Senior Developer, Mobile SDK in our Ads Engineering team, empowering cutting-edge mobile advertising technologies to create the next generation of our Ads Platform. What You’ll Do… Be part of the AdTech team in developing innovative new ad platform for mobile games Work involve writing platform specific code for File I/O, HTTP and Rendering in order to build for example a Video Player. Analyse, improve, optimize, and debug ads platform technology and tools Write and maintain efficient, readable, and reliable code To succeed you should have… 5 years or more experience working in the video game or a related industry as an Engineer Fluent in C/C++ and cross-platform programming and is excited to spearhead our AdTech expansion into these new platforms. Communicate effectively with non-technical team members Work well in a diverse team environment We’d love it if you also have… Strong understanding and experience with SaaS platform development Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field Python or other scripting languages Solid public speaking skills About King King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta. A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. Making the World Playful Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful! Applications need to be in English. Discover King at careers.king.com R017125

Job Title Senior Software Development Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R017964 Job Description As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you'll be responsible for creating new tools and reports to improve automation testing of games and applications across Activision and Treyarch. You will be writing specifications, designing, building, testing, and implementing applications, as well as maintaining those applications after release using the languages and tools available. You'll also be working with, mentoring and providing technical leadership to other programmers on the team to develop new applications with overall efficiency, reuse and automation as guiding principles. What You’ll Do… Work on projects including database driven web applications, website enhancements, desktop applications, and efficiency automation projects Work within a team environment to address the programming needs of management and other teams within Activision and Treyarch Document and comment code thoroughly for ease of understanding for your peer programmers Participate in the planning process, programming and creation process with management and the client to release bug free tools and applications Build tools using whichever programming languages are necessary to complete the project, learning any languages that you don’t know to complete the project Review, analyze, and modify programming-related systems including documenting, designing, developing, testing, monitoring, and maintaining programs as specified by leadership Participate in review and company meetings concerning projects and programs Communicate effectively with clients in a courteous and respectful manner To succeed you should have… 7+ years of programming experience Strong experience with Python and Django Advanced knowledge of database query languages such as T-SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB The ability to use front-end and back-end languages to create a feature rich and polished application Experience with Microsoft operating systems Experience with JIRA and Agile management Experience with Git, GitHub or Gitlab Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications Strong interpersonal skills University-level degree in Computer Science or related field We’d love it if you also have… Experience with mobile development Experience programming in C/C++ or C# Knowledge of standards-based programming languages such as HTML5, XHTML, JavaScript, CSS Experience with testing desktop and web-based applications Experience with Linux operating systems We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Audio tools & run-time systems design collaboration. Player Profile Demonstrated creative and technical achievements in sound design. Minimum seven years of experience in game audio development. jobTitle: Senior Sound Designer - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Sound Designer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009771 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior Sound Designer at Infinity Ward, you will use your technical and creative audio skills to bring life to the action in our next big adventure. Joining an award winning team, you will help create a cinematic soundscape for our next AAA title from inception, leveraging your passion, experience and critical thinking to help guide team decisions and provide valuable input to your peers. All while applying your own craft to deliver experiences that exceed player expectations. As a leader in the audio discipline, you’ll strive to find ways to teach and level up those around you, while continuing to challenge and grow yourself. Responsibilities Contribute to all aspects of sound design, implementation, post-production, and audio engineering. Create and implement sound effects. Conduct and assist with field recordings. Assist with audio R&D and tool development. Coordinate with game designers and the audio team to reach audio aesthetic goals. Demonstrable passion for developing high quality audio and games. Seek and be open to feedback and suggestions from others. Be flexible and responsive to the needs of the team and value working relationships. Requirements 5+ years of industry related experience (with two or more published AAA game credits). Extensive audio recording, processing, and mixing skills – particularly with sound effects and dialog. Extensive knowledge and experience with current pro audio tools, such Pro-Tools, Sound Forge, Waves and other high-end plug-ins, etc. – as well as professional outboard gear, recording gear, and microphones. Understanding of next gen console audio functionality and capabilities. Excellent PC/Mac skills and proficiency with word-processing, spreadsheet, and database applications. Excellent organization and communication skills. Good work ethic and a positive attitude. Surround or Dolby Atmos mixing experience is a plus. Programming or scripting skills is a plus. jobTitle: Senior Sourcing Tech Recruiter (Contract) (LA Office - Hybrid)
jobDescription: Job Title Team Name: Senior Sourcing Tech Recruiter (Contract) (LA Office - Hybrid) Requisition ID R018777 Job Description This position will start as contract with the hopes of becoming FTE. FTE is not guaranteed. This candidate must live in the LA area and be able to go to the office on a regular basis, though not daily. Your Mission Would you like to be part of the recruiting team responsible for bringing Call of Duty to the market and fueling the growth of the games industry? Do you thrive in fast paced environments? Activision Publishing is seeking a Sourcing Recruiter that will partner with Talent Professionals to drive top of funnel initiatives on critical positions at Infinity Ward. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Partner with hiring teams to build effective sourcing, engagement and assessment strategies for the most critical talent pools. Source and build pipelines of candidates using all available systems and tools. Must be able to nurture passive candidates and build with an eye for both now and the future. Serve up a high-touch candidate experience. Communication and follow-up are key! Help ensure recruiting data integrity by using our ATS (Workday Recruit) to optimize and document your work. Apply data and analytics to drive decision-making with partners. Work with your colleagues in systems, assessment, analytics, talent attraction, and talent planning to level up your broader skills and knowledge base. Be a proactive ambassador and ally, for diversity, equity, inclusion efforts in all things we do. Keep a keen eye towards diversity and influence hiring initiatives to ensure we’re delivering a diverse slate of candidates. Build broad market knowledge of the AAA gaming space to understand trends and the hiring/retention of top talent. Player Profile 3+ years of recruiting experience either agency or in-house. Process driven and proven ability to navigate ambiguity and solve challenging problems. Experience handling multiple searches and client relationships simultaneously. High attention to detail, team-oriented and ability to contribute to an inclusive work environment. Ability to pick up new ATS systems, tools and technology (e.g. Workday Recruit, Eightfold, etc). We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. Craft Technology & Development Job Description Senior Staff Software Engineer (Backend) Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. Your role within Activision Blizzard Media Partner with Architects, Product Managers and other engineers to build one of the world’s largest mobile game advertising platforms Evaluate and choose the right technology stack and build the Ads & Monetization platform to handle billions of requests per day and tens of thousands of requests per second Own the overall goals of uptime and scalability of the platform Genuine interest in working with and mentoring junior engineers Qualifications 7+ years of experience leading the development of highly performing, highly available and highly reliable production services Expert knowledge in Java, JMeter and performance engineering Experience with streaming technologies e.g. Kafka, Kinesis and Flink Experience with NoSQL systems e.g. DynamoDB, Cassandra, HBase Experience working in a cloud-based environment with Google Cloud Platform or AWS Experience in designing overall architecture of frontend and backend solutions so that they work cohesively together Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to work in a collaborative team environment BA/BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience Preferred Qualifications Knowledge and experience in CI/CD, test automation, Jenkins, Gradle and related technologies Experience with open source technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Google BigQuery Focused on usability, maintainability and quality, building for the long term In New York City, the standard base pay range for this role is $196,710 - $291,334 annually. This base pay range is for New York City and is not applicable to other locations. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role are eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed. About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R015517

Job Title Senior Systems Designer Requisition ID R010867 Job Description Job Title: Senior Designer Requisition ID R010867 Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are looking for people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to develop, implement and tune player-first experiences that will be enjoyed by millions of gamers across the globe. You are a self-sufficient, fire and forget teammate who takes ownership of tasks, proactively and independently solve challenges, and delivers high quality work in a timely manner. You must thrive in a challenging and often ambiguous environment. An agile and flexible mindset is also necessary since this position actively partners with a variety of internal and external partners. Excellent and persuasive communication skills are a must. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and dedicated teammate to help tell our story. You will… Collaborate with Creative Directors, Designers, Engineers, Artists, Producers, and Animators to deliver world-class game systems Research subject matter relating to the design objective to ensure an authentic experience Be a proactive self-starter that can independently execute high-level direction Clearly and effectively pitch designs and features using multimedia tools Create and maintain design documents and systems specifications for games with an eye toward systems design and then provide verbal and written assessments of the same Uphold system designs during a live environment Mentor fellow Designers Use scripting tools to create, iterate, and balance game mechanics and systems Play builds of games in-progress and provide concise and prioritized feedback to both internal teams and external partners Interface with other teams to ensure systems are understood and utilized Possess a comprehensive understanding of the design process spanning all facets of the game Work closely with our user-testing teams during play-balancing to provide expert feedback You Bring… Minimum Requirements 5+ years in the games industry working in a system design capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space Solid experience with programming/scripting languages Passionate and egoless attitude that welcomes feedback and criticism, and enjoys working in a collaborative, iterative, and agile process Ability to lead by example Impressive communication skills Solid understanding of systems design with ability to clearly discuss modern trends Strong problem-solving skills Expertise writing high and low-level documentation (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio, etc.) Passion for Call of Duty, with understanding of the franchise’s progression and reward systems Hunger for gaming (especially online) with a broad range of game experience Extra Points Profound understanding of the Call of Duty franchise and Warzone Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the F2P games space Prior experience working on a games-as-a-service product. Experience with visual software (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) About Activision Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment. Job Title Senior Systems Designer - Sledgehammer Games Requisition ID R017185 Job Description Your Platform Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the videogame development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare, Call of Duty®: WWII, and Call of Duty®: Vanguard. Since our founding in 2009, our greatest passion has been making AAA games. The strength of our team makes us not only excellent at what we do, but also how we do it. We firmly believe in supporting our passionate employees to be the best they can be. Here at Sledgehammer Games, everyone is a game maker. We are constantly evolving and innovating – which are some of the most rewarding aspects of game development. With our outstanding audio, design, engineering, and art teams, we’ve been able to achieve some of the highest-quality game execution of any studio in the industry. We love making games and we work hard to make sure that each new game we make is even better than the last. Creativity is key, and we’re looking for dedicated game developers for our exciting upcoming projects. Sledgehammer Games is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.sledgehammergames.com or search for Sledgehammer Games on your favorite social media platform. Want to hear what it’s like at the studio directly from current employees? Check out our #LifeatSHG developer profiles: https://youtu.be/12DUBszg-w4 Your Mission We have an industry leading development team and a studio culture built to promote and support outstanding game developers. We are actively recruiting for a Senior Systems Designer to join our Call of Duty development team. If you love crafting fun new multiplayer experiences and have a desire to work on the most successful FPS franchise in the history of video games. This role is anticipated to be assigned as a hybrid work model position, with some work on-site at an Activision Blizzard office and some work remote Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Lead Lead design team by example and pursuit of excellence. Work with the lead designer to set standards and expectations within the design team. Ownership Own match health; including spawns, mode balance, match scoring and match rewards Drive design communications with multiple departments including User Research and Analytics Conceptualize Conceptualize, pitch and iterate on designs with the design team. Actively debate design concepts, systems and mechanics. Implement Implement designs and concepts using in-house tools within time frames provided. Work closely with UI/UX, Analytics, QA and User Research to advocate for match health, balance and player communication. Iterate Constantly iterate on match mechanics and system balance to find the fun based on user feedback, analytics and design goals. Polish Refine gameplay above and beyond expectations to execution excellence. Player Profile 5+ years of experience designing games 2+ years of experience with user research and analytics teams on live products Excellent design documentation skills Be Positive Love games Mental flexibility Mental fortitude Enjoy challenges and creative problem solving We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Technical Designer (Gameplay) Requisition ID R017160 Job Description Your Mission Welcome to Solid State Studios. We’re a new in-house studio within Activision, dedicated to developing the best AAA mobile games in the world. Our first project is Call of Duty®: Warzone™ Mobile , and we’re looking for great talent passionate about their work, who share our belief in what AAA experiences on mobile can and should be. We’re incredibly excited to build out our teams and get to work, and invite you to join us in making something special. Your Profile Activision Publishing is currently seeking a Senior Technical Designer to help our team develop the most engaging features for the next iteration of Warzone on the go. As a Technical Designer, you will be the link between metagame and core gameplay areas of our game. Working together with the Lead Game Designer and Game Director with a special focus on Battle Royale gameplay, in-game mechanics and combat systems. Responsibilities Craft and conceptualize new Battle Royale experiences specifically built for mobile players Integrate our set of metagame features more closely with BR and Multiplayer gameplay to create highly engaging experiences Be our weapon systems expert: Define a process that leads to the creation of the most exciting Weapon Blueprints for players to enjoy Collaborate with teams across the studio to prototype, implement, tune, and iterate your designs Know our game: how it excels, where it needs improvement, and how you’ll make it better Become an authority in competitive analysis and the deconstruction of gameplay features within our segment of the industry Communicate efficiently and rally a multidisciplinary team behind your design concepts Requirements Minimum 2 years’ professional experience in a Gameplay Engineering, Game Systems Design, Technical Design, or similar position Shipped 1+ game titles Proficiency with LUA, Python, Javascript and/or other script languages Enjoy challenges and creative problem solving Self-Motivated/Independent A love of mobile games and the FPS genre Extra Points Modding experience (examples and portfolio pieces are highly encouraged) Technical design experience on a shipped AAA title Understanding of Call of Duty, shooters and multiplayer industry trends B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. COVID-19 Hiring Update: While our Mobile Studio is based in Santa Monica, CA, we’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model. We’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. Job Title Senior Technical Designer - Treyarch Requisition ID R017954 Job Description As a Senior Technical Designer you will be working closely with our Design team, Engineering team, and all other departments to develop systems, tools, and game content. A Technical Designer should be excellent at rapidly prototyping ideas and capable of turning a design specification from paper into a high quality, shippable game system. You should be able to quickly familiarize yourself with an existing script base and be able to harness and improve on it to provide support to other designers and content creators to bring our games to life within a collaborative environment. A successful Technical Designer will also have a strong design sense and an ability to create compelling content that millions of fans are going to love. What You’ll Do… Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Use our scripting language to implement robust, performant, and fun game systems. Work with other designers and almost all other disciplines to collaborate daily on systems and content. Document systems, define best practices, and communicate technical information to the rest of the team. To succeed you should have… Minimum 5 years’ professional experience in a Gameplay Engineering, Technical Design, or similar position Shipped 2+ game titles Proficiency with LUA, Python, Javascript and/or other script languages A passion for games Game knowledge and an understanding of the design principles behind games Able to collaborate with other engineers and designers Ability to work well in a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges evolve We’d love it if you also have… B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience Expertise and passion in one or more of the following areas: AI, Animation, General Gameplay, Tools Experience working on networked Cooperative or Competitive Multi-player game experiences Understanding of 3D Game Math (e.g. vectors) Previously shipped AAA titles Experience with our map building tools (Radiant), or our game scripting language (GSC). Proficient in C/C++ Note: If your strength is on the technical side and you’re looking to make a shift from Engineering to Design we want to hear from you! We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R017954

Job Title Senior Technical Environment Artist Requisition ID R016606 Job Description Job Title: Senior Technical Environment Artist Reporting To: Senior Lead Technical Artist Department: Art Location: Madison, Wisconsin Why Raven? Here at Raven, we pride ourselves on our unique vision for the industry that continues to inspire us after more than 30 years. We developed a team that cares about one another, our games, and our players. We treat each other with respect. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our mistakes. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are seeking people to grow with us. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission Your mission is to play a critical role in developing responsive art tools and user-friendly workflow solutions for the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. You are a self-sufficient, ‘fire-and-forget’ teammate who takes ownership of critical tech art tasks, acts as a bridge between the art and engineering teams, and proactively and independently solve challenges. You also have an agile and flexible approach, and excellent and persuasive communication skills, as you will actively partner with some of the most dedicated and passionate developers in the industry. Above all, we are looking for an innovative and committed teammate to help tell our story. You Will… Share your deep passion for technical art knowledge and your drive to improve and expand upon content creation pipelines and tool sets. Be a proactive self-starter that can independently implement high-level direction. Collaborate with Artists and Engineers to deliver innovative tool solutions that will help artists develop epic visual content for world-class player experiences. Spearhead tech art development for specific projects, and initiatives to standardize solutions across the organization. Champion processes and advocate towards streamlining tools and processes. Be a trusted gatekeeper for performance, efficiency, and quality. Inspire and mentor fellow tech artists as a role model of initiative, accountability, and attitude. Encourage artists and engineers to thrive on open and welcome constructive feedback. Contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. You Bring… Minimum Requirements 6+ total years in the games industry working in an art capacity, with at least 3 shipped title in the AAA console / PC space. Egoless attitude that welcomes feedback and enjoys working in a collaborative, iterative, and agile process. Strong scripting or programming knowledge (Python, JavaScript, C#, C++, MEL) Possesses in-depth understanding of game engines, pipelines, and processes. Proven experience in several of the following: lighting, shading, VFX, environments, characters, physically based rendering (PBR), and content management & optimization. Good understanding of creating art assets in multiple major 3D and 2D packages (3DS Max or Maya, Houdini, Photoshop or Substance) for console hardware (Xbox, PS, PC). Ability to lead by example. Impressive communication and strong problem-solving skills. Proven ability to thrive in an ambitious and often ambiguous environment. Solid understanding of game art with ability to clearly discuss modern trends. Extra Points Passion for the Call of Duty franchise. Experience with Maya OpenAPI, MaxScript, wxPython, PyQt, and P4Python. Experience with integrated solutions such as RealityCapture, Simplygon, Substance, etc. Strong traditional art foundation. History of playing a variety of game genres both digital and physical. About Raven Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We each bring a unique set of experiences from dozens of cultural backgrounds. Our shared values unify our direction and decisions, helping us touch the lives of more than a billion people each day. Job Title Senior Technical Product Manager Requisition ID R017890 Job Description Who we are: Demonware is an independently-run part of Activision Blizzard. We run every part of the players’ online experience, from logging in to matchmaking to climbing the leaderboards, for popular video game franchises such as Call of Duty, Tony Hawk Pro Skater, Crash Bandicoot and Skylanders. The work we do together every day impacts almost half a billion players around the world. We solve big company challenges with a small company feel. We are technology-driven with a culture of openness. This means collaborating to solve interesting challenges, enjoying the freedom to talk to anyone, and always feeling respected. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much. What We Do We are looking for a Senior Technical Product Manager to join our team in Santa Monica or Vancouver, where you will work within the Demonware Product Management department to deliver impactful player outcomes for Activision’s industry leading games. Your Responsibilities Work closely with game studios, partners in Activision, and Demonware engineering and production teams to assess and prioritize opportunities that will delight players and drive engagement Develop detailed product requirements and establish quantifiable measures of success (KPIs) for validated opportunities Partner with engineering leadership to shape product strategy and translate into actionable short and long-term road maps Perform user- and competitive research to inform opportunities and make data-informed decisions Regularly communicate product plans and outcomes to company leadership and key stakeholders Player Profile 5+ years’ experience of technical product management, focusing on developing achievable objectives and a solid product roadmap Self-driven, motivated and resourceful with an ability to drive alignment and maintain momentum Hands-on experience navigating, analyzing and presenting data objectively Experience working with Engineering teams using Agile/Scrum methodologies Preferred background or education in Computer Science and/or Software Engineering Your Platform We’re headquartered in Santa Monica and Vancouver, housing multiple teams across many disciplines of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivaled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world. Our World Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! Activision has been changing the way people play for the past 40 years—as the leading developer and publisher of video games, our teams have created some of the world's biggest, most ground-breaking, and beloved entertainment franchises in the industry. Ask anyone who works at Activision what their favorite thing about it is, and they’ll tell you it’s the people. We have world class brands, infrastructure, and resources, but our success comes from people producing greatness together. We are nothing without our employee’s brilliance. Activision is more than just the leading developer and publisher of video games; we are the creators of some of the world’s biggest, most ground-breaking titles in the industry. Our current portfolio includes Call of Duty®, Skylanders®, and Crash Bandicoot™. Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ: ATVI), headquartered in Santa Monica, California with locations across the globe, is one of the largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies in the world. Sitting at the intersection of media, technology, and entertainment, our employees are some of the best and brightest across engineering, entertainment, media, and technology. A member of the S&P 500 Activision Blizzard is proud to be included as one of FORTUNE's "100 Best Companies To Work For®," "World's Best Employers," as well as "Most Admired Companies." In 2019 we were honored to receive a perfect score on our entry to the Corporate Equality Index as a Best Workplace for LGBTQ professionals and once again made Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies in Gaming. The video game industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. R017890

jobTitle: Senior Technical Sound Designer - Call of Duty - New Studio
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Technical Sound Designer - Call of Duty - New Studio Requisition ID R009774 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior Technical Sound Designer at Infinity Ward, you will use your technical and creative audio skills to be the bridge between the audio artistic direction of the game and its implementation within technical and production constraints. Joining an award winning team, you will help create a cinematic soundscape for our next AAA title from inception, leveraging your passion, experience and critical thinking to help guide team decisions and provide valuable input to your peers. All while applying your own craft to deliver experiences that exceed player expectations. As a leader in the audio discipline, you’ll strive to find ways to teach and level up those around you, while continuing to challenge and grow yourself. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Assess needs and quality with the Audio Director. Establish and document the technical audio charter based on the creative direction and define technical audio needs (tools, process, etc.) for the project to ensure proper integration, in collaboration with the Audio Director and programmers. Design and create original audio content within the project's creative direction Lead performance optimization and debugging phases. Scripting creative solutions for unique audio implementations Supervise the work of other Sound Designers on the audio team providing individual feedback and/or actively participating in audio reviews to ensure that the team’s work meets quality standards and remains in line with the audio vision Create and maintain audio-related documentation Coordinate with game designers and the audio team to reach audio aesthetic goals. Demonstrable passion for developing high quality audio and games. Seek and be open to feedback and suggestions from others. Requirements Technical curiosity, creativity Experience implementing audio using proprietary tools or commercial middleware Required familiarity of some scripting/coding language, experience with C, C++ a plus 5+ years of industry related experience (with two or more published AAA game credits). Strong knowledge of audio post process plugins Strong collaboration and communication skills across teams Extensive knowledge of Pro Tools Solid knowledge of studio audio equipment Ability to provide constructive feedback Bachelor's degree in music or audio or professional training in audio, CS degree a plus Musical knowledge a plus Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R009774

Job Title Senior Tools Engineer Requisition ID R016366 Job Description Your Mission: Infinity Ward is looking for a talented Senior Tools Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive full-time programming experience in games. We are looking for someone who is passionate about the digital content production process and who is passionate about working with content creators and engineers of other disciplines to build awesome tools The tools team at Infinity Ward is responsible for providing a good user experience for the content creation story of game development. This includes improving the content editing tools as well as the build pipeline technology used to deliver content changes to the game. It also encompasses delivering good feedback to the entire studio on both a micro and macro level. This includes keeping artists informed about the specific changes they submit, and the larger team informed about the health of the whole game. This is an exciting opportunity to join an award-winning video game developer, and work with the best gaming talent in the world. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design and development of various asset creation and management tools ranging from exporters, to content creation tools, to asset management tools, to build tools, to frameworks. Maintenance and support of existing and new and infrastructure as needed, including honing studio services such as: Continuous integration, Automated Testing, Distribution and Caching systems. Work with content creators, designers, and other engineers to gather requirements and ensure tool design specifications are met. Coordinate feature sets, roadmaps, and technical requirements provided by stakeholders to implement high quality software to facilitate the creative process. Minimum Requirements Player Profile: 5+ years of programming experience in developing media pipeline tools. Demonstrated proficiency in and knowledge of C#/C/C++, data structures, performance, and multi-threaded programming techniques. Understanding of fundamentals of 3D math. Knowledge of common data structures and algorithmic solutions. Client focused. Contributed extensively to the development of one or more shipped games, PC, or console. Thorough knowledge of software design practices including modular architecture, event-driven architecture, and software design patterns. Ability to quickly understand and work with internal and externally developed code. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. A strong passion for video games of many kinds. Extra Points Experience with developing composite applications using the Model View-View Model design pattern. Experience with various technologies and SDKs such as WPF, Prism, and Rad Controls. Experience with SQL Server. Experience with Maya plugin and script development. Experience with computer game technologies including: Camera systems, AI programming, physics, 3D programming, animation, collision detection. Demonstrated ability to write clean, readable, portable, reliable, and optimized tools code. Contributed extensively to the development of tools for at least one shipped console game. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Job Title Senior Tools Engineer (Test Automation) - Treyarch Requisition ID R015040 Job Description Are you passionate about writing tests and developing frameworks? Do you want to have an impact on the development process while improving the quality of a game played by millions of fans across the globe? Automated tests are an essential technique we use to detect and report defects in our game and tools. As a Senior Tools Engineer focused on Test Automation, you will work closely with Quality Assurance and Engineering leadership. You will develop new features for our testing frameworks, create new tests, and deploy them to the data center and developer’s desks. Each day you’ll collaborate with developers from multiple disciplines. What You’ll Do… Write and maintain automated tests Develop frameworks to apply white box and black box techniques Collect and visualize metrics Research and develop new techniques and maintain a process of technological evolution Analyze test results and partner with feature developers to understand unexpected outcomes Meet regularly with QA leadership to develop plans, roadmaps, and tools to improve QA workflows and productivity Mentor other engineers on the automation team To succeed you should have… Passion for automation and software testing Bachelor’s degree in computer science, a related field, or equivalent experience Previous work experience developing test frameworks Advanced understanding of Python, C/C++, and SQL Deep grasp of computer architecture, networks, and operating systems Experience working in a collaborative team environment Self-motivated, strong sense of independence We’d love it if you also have… Experience developing console games Familiarity with QA methodologies Experience working in a collaborative team environment Knowledge of Win32, Git, Puppet, Grafana, Perforce, Linux, Flask, or Django Experience in a management or leadership position Passion for video games, especially FPS games We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R015040

jobTitle: Senior Tools Programmer OPEN TO REMOTE
jobDescription: Job Title Senior Tools Programmer OPEN TO REMOTE Requisition ID R018052 Job Description About us This is an exceptionally exciting time to be at Activision, a period of phenomenal change and ambition throughout the organization! Activision Central Tech (or "CT") is a global, multi-disciplinary team dedicated to supporting the technological needs of our games. We work alongside Activision studios around the world to build the most compelling entertainment experiences ever seen. Your role Activision is searching for a Senior Tools Programmer to join its CT group. This is a full-time permanent position, learning and working in a friendly and inclusive environment alongside some of the best game creators in the world. You will help us craft the next generation of the massively successful Call of Duty® series of games. Responsibilities Include Research, design and build new tooling for our AAA technology. Debugging and optimization of existing tools pipeline and build systems Engage and co-develop with large geographically distributed teams Make optimal use of our cutting-edge build and testing infrastructure Mentoring and supporting junior engineers. Qualifications A degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience. 4-5+ years’ experience working as a programmer in the game industry or a related field. Skills & Attributes Our ideal candidate for this role would possess the following skills and attributes: Experience with tools pipelines, build systems or test automation in shipped games. A proven understanding of computing fundamentals Capable and eager to take the leading role in certain projects. Creative, motivated, focused, and results oriented with a passion for games and technology. Optional These are not firm requirements, but we would be especially interested in talking to anyone with: Experience in relevant areas of code, including build systems, build automation, test automation, distributed processing, asset pipelines An understanding of technologies such as Containers, Kubernetes, Redis, Prometheus, ElasticSearch Experience with automating games consoles or mobile platforms. What we offer A friendly, international team of game technology experts ready to guide and support you. A healthy work-life balance. We create our best work when our free time is valued and respected. Access to counseling services and mental health support through our wellness programs such as AbleTo and our Employee Assistance Program. Generous benefits package including pension contributions, health insurance and bonuses. Comprehensive relocation support. Applying We love hearing from anyone who is talented and enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Activision is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for this role regardless of gender, gender identity, gender expression, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or whether they are parents, carers, a person with disabilities or any person protected by applicable law. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. Lastly, in your application please feel free to let us know which pronouns you use. R018052

Job Title Senior UI Artist Requisition ID R017051 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Your Mission Infinity Ward is currently seeking a Senior UI Artist.This person will work closely with the multi-discipline UI team to help deliver the vision for innovative, cutting-edge user interfaces for Call of Duty titles. Player Profile Working with the UI/UX Director and UI Art Lead to establish and push the look of the game’s UI, covering the frontend, in-game HUD and any additional art content required whilst adhering to the established UI styleguide, game direction and overall theme and aesthetic. Strong understanding of the principals of design, color theory and typography. Creation of assets based on defined art styles from initial concept through to the final product. Assets can range from whole screen layouts, iconography, backgrounds, map imagery through to widgets and button helpers. Authoring of comps and assets with motion in mind, to convey concepts, visualize functionality, flow, and animation states. Working with UI Engineers, UX Designers and wider feature and gameplay teams to problem solve and ensure visuals are creating the best possible user experience. Own and manage assets from establishing naming conventions, maintaining accurate and functional checked-in content, and proactively ensuring stakeholders are updated. Requirements Shipped at-least 1 AAA multi-platform title, through the entirety of its production. Possess a strong graphics design background and be able to demonstrate a high level of proficiency in Illustrator and Photoshop. A clear understanding of art optimization, game and engine constraints. Be able to conceptualize, present and execute ideas within a tight schedule. The ability to work effectively in a multi-discipline team. Be able to provide and take constructive feedback to push the boundaries of interface design. Demonstrable proficiency in motion graphics creation for game UI. Avid gamer. Pluses After Effects Scripting (e.g. Lua) 3ds Max / Maya / Blender Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Senior UX Researcher - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R017600 Job Description Your Mission Infinity Ward is looking for a detail-oriented Senior UX Researcher with a passion for games, data science, and the voice of the gamers. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Work closely with game teams and studio leadership to understand franchise goals and strategies Design and conduct qualitative studies (usability studies, click-tests etc.), analyze data, and share findings Analyze relevant data from mixed research methods (interviews, lab studies, heuristic evaluations, surveys, telemetry) Effectively communicate research results to multiple levels of the organization in creative ways that create impact, while providing recommendations and ongoing design consultation Develop long-term user research plans for Infinity Ward games Create new methodologies for each product's unique gameplay and sensibility while maintaining research quality and process Recruit participants through internal or external recruiting methods Execute user-tests including setup, breakdown, game review, intake/outtake of participants, recording/reporting of the players' experiences, and other research related activities Player Profile Minimum Requirements 3+ years experience in user experience research in a fast-paced product environment A Bachelor’s degree in game development or a field focusing on human subject research (e.g., psychology, human computer interaction, human factors, communications, market research, anthropology, or similar) Good interpersonal communication (both written and verbal) Excellent organizational and analytical skills Adaptable and quick learner that enjoys tackling a large variety of problems Must have a passion for video games Familiarity with FPS and console games is a plus R017600

Job Title Senior VFX Artist Requisition ID R010822 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We’re based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We have a unique vision for our industry. One that has and continues to inspire us. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our own mistakes. We treat each other with respect. After nearly 30 years, Raven Software is still thriving. We developed a team who cares about one another, our games and our players. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are growing. Our team is creative, highly intelligent, well-led and equipped to face this exciting future. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Raven Software is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.ravensoftware.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ravensoftware, and @RavenSoftware on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior VFX Artist you will create particle simulations and systems that both mimic real-life phenomena and capture the imagination through fantastic visuals. We’re looking for strong collaborators who bring no ego but plenty of passion. Together, we’ll push our tools beyond all reasonable limits, and constantly hunt for better techniques and inspiring reference no matter where it can be found. With your creativity and curiosity, and your own blend of technical and artistic skills, you’ll help us create the most stunning AAA visuals and compelling gameplay on the planet. In This Role You’ll Be Asked To Work closely with the VFX Lead, Art Directors and others in bringing life to gameplay and cinematics through the addition of flair and visual drama Craft compelling moments through the design, creation, and implementation of real-time particle effects using both static and animating 2D/3D elements Prototype VFX and materials which effectively develop tone and pacing of gameplay events Stay current with the latest tools, technologies, and techniques to help shape our pipelines Balance quality with efficiency when working under tight deadlines Follow and maintain workflows and technical requirements Player Profile Minimum Requirements 2+ years of Visual Effects experience for games, or equivalent experience in film/television Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to excel in a collaborative and diverse work environment Being a self-motivated team player who proactively seeks feedback and communication Ability to quickly learn new software and adapt to proprietary software Strong technical problem solving skills Relevant 2D and 3D software experience - Photoshop, After Effects, Maya, Max, Houdini, Substance Designer Extra Points Bachelor’s degree in an Art related discipline or equivalent experience Experience in a secondary area such as texturing, modeling, scripting, animation, or lighting Experience creating VFX shaders Experience and comfort in Unreal and/or PopcornFX Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Job Title Senior VFX Artist - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R017500 Job Description Senior VFX Artist - (Open to Remote) Your Platform Toys for Bob, a collaborative team of stellar individuals that have inspired love, joy, and laughter through epic AAA entertainment for more than 30 years, is open to remote work! Our passion for developing award-winning games with diverse genres includes the Crash Bandicoot®, Call of Duty®, Overwatch®, Spyro®, Skylanders®, and Tony Hawk® franchises. We are constantly evolving and support our growing employees to be as innovative as they can be. Toys for Bob’s experienced developers are looking for creative individuals ready to take on exciting and new projects. Join us! Toys for Bob is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, visit us at www.toysforbob.com and @ToysForBob on Twitter. Your Mission As a Senior VFX Artist, you will report directly to our Lead FX Artist. The ideal candidate is an artist/magician/pyromaniac/tech-head who can build astounding visual FX. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Create amazing yet efficient in-game particle and geometric VFX using proprietary tools as well as Maya and Photoshop Work with level artists, level designers, character designers, and programmers to implement and troubleshoot FX Build art assets that demonstrate advanced techniques Be a proactive problem solver with a solid grasp of art and design principles Player Profile Minimum Requirements 5 + years of experience in VFX for games Strong experience working with real-time particle engines and geometric FX as demonstrated by a strong portfolio Strong understanding of color, composition, and timing Texture creation expertise by hand, photos, or other packages Good modeling, UV-ing, rigging and animating skills Solid understanding of art pipelines and how to get the most out of them Strong communication skills, self-motivated, and a great teammate Flexibility with the adoption of art styles and direction Sets priorities and plans with a realistic sense of the time demand involved Takes personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and achieves results with little oversight Maintains composure in highly stressful or adverse situations Bonus Experience Deep understanding of timing, scale, color, composition, motion and physics for visual effects Cascade, Maya, Photoshop and After Effects experience Shipped one or more AAA titles Scripting or programming experience Solid understanding of art pipelines and how to get the most out of them Experience working among art, design, and engineering departments Motivated and driven to face challenges and be a problem solver Texture creation expertise, either 2D painting, photosource or 3D renders Modeling and UVmap understanding BS/BA/BFA degree in graphic design, fine arts, digital arts or similar We love hearing from
