Job Title Steam Specialist, Senior Software Engineer Requisition ID R018132 Job Description Your Platform Activision Central Tech works to support our development studios and their titles. Comprising seven main teams, we have many specialties including big data, privacy and security, motion capture and animation pipeline technologies, graphics, build and infrastructure for studio development and data centers, optimization, systems programming, and online services including matchmaking and networking. Central Tech is distributed globally with offices across the U.S., and in Canada, England, Ireland, and Japan. Most of our teams are composed of both engineering and research talent, allowing us to always have an eye on the future. Our talented engineers help with title development and provide valuable knowledge sharing between studios while our researchers make things happen and keep a strong connection with the needs of the game studios. Central Tech is part of Activision. To learn more about us and our research, please visit us at https://research.activision.com/. Your Mission As a Steam Specialist SSE you will provide expert analysis and robustly engineered solutions to help strengthen our titles against threats to both gameplay feature and anti-cheating integrity. The role requires an insightful, agile, and pragmatic approach to a constantly evolving threat landscape - balancing both long term capability buildout and being able to react to newly emerging threats. This is a hands-on role, requiring strong programming and reverse-engineering skills. Working as part of an overall engineering team effort, you would be expected to be both hands-on working directly on protecting game features and integrity, in addition to playing a role in a longer-term technology and capability build-out. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Strengthen security and integrity of game title features, ensuring known exploits are corrected and potential threats are addressed. Be a priority resource to work side-by-side game engineers, as the engineering support representative of the Central Technology Game Security team. Perform R&D into both new techniques and technologies. Work closely with experts within the security team to identify the best course of action to protect game features and implement countermeasures to known cheats. Identify emerging threats, propose countermeasures, and implement these in a timely manner. Be the game title eyes-and-ears to report back potential issues and make recommendations for areas to improve. Be a proactive part of team to monitor and measure effectiveness in anti-cheat efforts. Support both engineering and security operations efforts. Player Profile Minimum Requirements Extensive knowledge of Intel-family processor architecture, mobile processors (such as ARM64) a plus. Strong C/C++ development on game titles, including some understanding of assembly code, and solid understanding of source control standard methodologies and hands-on knowledge of P4. Experience working with the Steam platform Reverse engineering, sophisticated debugging, ability to identify code vulnerabilities and exploits. Be able to interact with and work directly with game engineering teams. Extra Points: Knowledge of social engineering, malware, industry standard methodologies for game and code security. Security-focused role on previously published games. Be part of a broader live operations or game security effort a plus. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only improved by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We seek to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as advised by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R018132

Job Title Systems Engineer - Raven Software Requisition ID R018574 Job Description As a Systems Engineer you will optimizing, enhancing, and developing new engine systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA technology. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a passionate team that defines and shapes the technology of our upcoming Call of Duty titles. You will be developing the engine systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in engine development and the subsystems that support games. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Design, modify, optimize, and debug engine systems Research and document ways of improving our engine systems Deploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platforms Communicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teams Participate in the performance and code review process Contribute to the design and roadmap of industry-leading AAA engine technology Collaboration and co-development with other engineering teams Minimum Requirements We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related field Experience developing and optimizing engine systems Effective 3D math and algebra skills Strong programming skills in C/C++ Background with multi-threaded systems Understanding of computer architecture and memory management Debugging skills Shipped at least one game title 3+ years of experience working in the game industry or related field Comprehensive understanding of object-oriented programming Demonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable code Nice to have Development experience with networked multiplayer games Experience with bandwidth and latency in a client-server architecture Development background targeting multiple platforms (Linux, Windows, and consoles) Understanding of compression, encryption, and/or security Background with physics systems and experience with file streaming and I/O technologies About Raven Software Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise. We are based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty, World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. Job Title Tech Art Internship Requisition ID R017320 Job Description Technical Art Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. We are looking for talented and innovative students to join our team for the 2023 summer. All interns will receive a meaningful project and an unparalleled experience. We’ll provide the tools and resources you need to learn. The challenging and creative work you do throughout your internship will directly impact the team you are contributing on. All interns will be given the choice to work remotely or relocate to the internship location. The company will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. Player Profile Must be a current student pursuing their bachelors, masters, or PhD and graduating May 2023 or later. Available for a 12-week internship starting late May or late June. Can demonstrate strong artistic sensibilities, robust technical skills, and strong work ethic. Passionate about learning what it takes to be a successful artist in the video game industry. Candidates must apply with a resume and portfolio link to be considered. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Learn and contribute to writing and handling veracious tools, set up technically complex art assets, implement various content pipelines, and gain hands-on experience working on our newest game asset creation pipelines as part of our MoCap R&D team Cover letter required.  Solid understanding of a game engine (Unity/Unreal) or C++ and object-oriented programming practices.   Experience with Maya and Photoshop. Experience with realistic human character art/animation. Experience with Motion Builder, Blade, Z-Brush, Agisoft, Faceware and other relevant software . Knowledge of Motion Capture, FACS, human facial anatomy, facial animation and related topics are a plus .  Your Mission Work with artist and animators on one of Activision's award-winning franchises.   Help make new characters, environments, concepts, animations, UI, and/or armor. Work closely with a mentor to improve technical skills, artistic sensibilities, and a strong work ethic. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Do… Work with established proprietary rigging and animation system within digital creation tools. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of Coders, Animators and Technical Animators cultivating a positive team dynamic. Work quickly and effectively to support content creators. Skeleton creation, high quality realistic skin weighting, and animation rig creation. To succeed you should have… 3+ years of proven experience in rigging, animation roles or technical art. Professional or personal experience working with real time game engines. Proficiency in building skeletons, skinning and rigging in Maya. Good understanding of proprietary engine and related tools. Strong artistic skills and working knowledge of 3D art production. Solid understanding of Python tool and pipeline development. The ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with the development team. Strong problem solving and trouble-shooting skills. Must be flexible and comfortable with prototyping and quick iteration. An adaptable and continuous learning attitude. We’d love it if you also have… Technical Animation/Art Degree. jobTitle: Technical Art Engineering Lead - Infinity Ward
jobDescription: Job Title Technical Art Engineering Lead - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R018748 Job Description Your Mission: Infinity Ward is seeking a talented Lead Engineer to join the Technical Art Team. The ideal candidate will be someone with a passion for graphics technology, content pipelines, enjoys working closely with content creators, and has an established track record of shipping high quality games. You should be skilled at managing a small team of engineers and feel comfortable working in most areas of a game content pipeline. Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities. Responsibilities Own Infinity Ward’s suite of DCC plugins Set technical direction and long-term planning to ensure our technology is best-in-class Communicate with users and keep up to date on their needs and struggles Keep your finger on the pulse of the project and its changing needs Evangelize the team’s plans and progress Mentor the team on both technology and communication Coordinate on both schedule and technology with other Activision studios Requirements Player Profile: Experience creating and maintaining content creation tools for game development, either as standalone applications or within third-party digital content creation applications (DCC’s) such as Maya, Houdini, 3DS Max, Photoshop, or Blender. Experience leading or working in a tools engineering team in games, film, or a similar field. Experience using various DCC’s as mentioned above. Strong ability to provide and support creative solutions for content developers in different areas of a content pipeline. Knowledge of real-time graphics techniques and 3D math. B.S. in Computer Science and/or Mathematics or equivalent work experience. Proficiency in C++, C#, and Python. Self-motivated with excellent problem-solving skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. “We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, CA, just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. Job Title Technical Artist Internship (Houdini) - Treyarch Requisition ID R018403 Job Description Treyarch is looking for talented interns to join our Technical Art team who have experience with Houdini and a passion for high-quality content creation, who can think creatively, and can create optimal pipeline and optimization tools, specializing in one or more areas of content development. Our team is a multidisciplinary group serving as a bridge between art, design, and engineering, providing them with effective implementation tools, complex asset templates, and final content which must not only meet our high-quality standards, but also be optimized to be as efficient as possible. Inspiration may come from artist requests, collaborative discussion, competitive analysis, game design requirements, and/or engineering directives. Our ideal candidate has an interest and some experience in both tool making and art, as well as a keen sense for seeing fixes where others find workarounds. What You’ll Do… Create Houdini tools and processes that assist in authoring environment art, VFX, destruction simulations, animation, lighting, and post process effects. Work with all art teams to understand and improve content creation processes and pipelines. Learn how Technical Art teams support a fully operational production art team. Provide input on the technical methods to achieve the artistic goals and vision through all phases of the game development cycle. Create and maintain technical documentation, and offer technical support to the art teams on day-by-day production issues. To succeed you should have… Experience with Houdini, including using it to build digital assets and in creating intuitive user interfaces. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in communicating with both engineers and artists. Knowledge of content creation toolsets and game engines (Maya, Unreal, Unity, Photoshop, etc.). Excellent time management skills, with the ability to break down tasks and assignments and prioritize them into workable pieces on a daily, weekly basis. Experience programming in Python and scripting experience in VEX. A passion for learning and expanding your skills. Be pursuing an Associate, Bachelor, or Graduate degree at a College/University (or equivalent), or be a recent graduate. We’d love it if you also… Have working knowledge of linear algebra (vector math) as it pertains to 3D environments. Possess object oriented software design skills using C# or C++. Are experienced with source control software (i.e. Perforce) and collaborating on a code base. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We expect to be back in office for our summer 2023 internship and successful candidates will be expected to relocate and be onsite in Los Angeles for the duration of it. Treyarch will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R018403

Job Title Technical Artist/Rigger - (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R017906 Job Description Technical Artist/Rigger - (Open to Remote) Toys for Bob, a collaborative team of stellar individuals that have inspired love, joy, and laughter through epic AAA entertainment for more than 30 years, is open to remote work! Job Title Technical Designer - Treyarch Requisition ID R017953 Job Description As a Technical Designer you will be working closely with our Design team, Engineering team, and all other departments to develop systems, tools, and game content. A Technical Designer should be excellent at rapidly prototyping ideas and capable of turning a design specification from paper into a high quality, shippable game system. You should be able to quickly familiarize yourself with an existing script base and be able to harness and improve on it to provide support to other designers and content creators to bring our games to life within a collaborative environment. A successful Technical Designer will also have a strong design sense and an ability to create compelling content that millions of fans are going to love. What You’ll Do… Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities: Use our scripting language to implement robust, performant, and fun game systems. Work with other designers and almost all other disciplines to collaborate daily on systems and content. Document systems, define best practices, and communicate technical information to the rest of the team. To succeed you should have… Minimum 3 years’ professional experience in a Gameplay Engineering, Technical Design, or similar position Shipped 2+ game titles Proficiency with LUA, Python, Javascript and/or other script languages A passion for games Game knowledge and an understanding of the design principles behind games Able to collaborate with other engineers and designers Ability to work well in a fluid, changing environment as creative challenges evolve We’d love it if you also have… B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience Expertise and passion in one or more of the following areas: AI, Animation, General Gameplay, Tools Experience working on networked Cooperative or Competitive Multi-player game experiences Understanding of 3D Game Math (e.g. vectors) Previously shipped AAA titles Experience with our map building tools (Radiant), or our game scripting language (GSC). Proficient in C/C++ Note: If your strength is on the technical side and you’re looking to make a shift from Engineering to Design we want to hear from you! We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Title Technical Lead - Monitoring Automation Requisition ID R018619 Job Description Who we are: Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We run every part of the players’ online experience, from logging in to matchmaking to climbing the leaderboards, for popular video game franchises such as Call of Duty, Tony Hawk Pro Skater, Crash Bandicoot and Skylanders. The work we do together every day impacts almost half a billion players around the world. We solve big company challenges with a small company feel. We are technology-driven with a culture of openness. This means collaborating to solve interesting challenges, enjoying the freedom to talk to anyone, and always feeling respected. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much. What We Do We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the Platform Team. We build monitoring infrastructure for complex distributed systems. Using a combination of open source projects and extensive custom software our focus is on improving the experience of on call engineers during outages and incidents. Our monitoring systems are high scale, and highly available. Many companies struggle with high volumes of low value alerts. We are working towards building human-aware systems to improve actionability of system alerting, with a high priority on reducing alert fatigue Your Responsibilities Develop new tools to improve workflows across the organization Own, operate and support the tools and automation that you and your team develop Drive design of the software produced on the team, as well as define technical standards and patterns Identify problems or inefficiencies facing our engineers and drive adoption of new tools, process or infrastructure to help improve productivity Provide outstanding support to the engineers who utilize and depend on your tools and automation Take ownership of problems and projects which require in-depth evaluation About You 5+ years relevant work experience in high-volume and highly-available production service environments Extensive experience working in a distributed Linux environment Proficiency in Python Demonstrated ability to build and maintain existing and build new tools in Python Experience with at least one major data store such as MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra Experience with automated deployment on CI/CD pipelines Proficient working with applications deployed on Kubernetes in Docker containers Experience working with Docker containers in development and production Tenacity for debugging and solving technology problems at root cause Bonus Points Excellent analytical/troubleshooting skills Passion for understanding and solving your customer’s problems Passion for Automation An interest in technical leadership What Demonware Offers Relocation Support, generous paid vacation, RRSP matching program and top-tier medical, dental and life insurance coverage for you and your dependents and perks. R018619

Team meetings / stand-ups, Post-mortems, Sprint Kick-offs) Balance resources across multiple projects already in flight. Ensure progress is accurately tracked throughout the duration of the project, identifying roadblocks and escalating critical issues; Track velocity and highlight risks. Provide regular timely and accurate reporting to department. Create wireframes, process flow diagrams, UI mock-ups, and other documentation. Develop KPIs to track project timeliness and quality. Player Profile Minimum Requirements 5+ years of technical program management or similar experience. Deep experience with each stage of software development lifecycle, from inception, design and implementation, through to QA and deployment. Experience in practicing agile development practices, and strong working knowledge of a variety of project management techniques. Experience with project management tools such as Atlassian JIRA, Trello, Confluence, MS SharePoint, MS Project, Smartsheet, etc. Able to proactively navigate roadblocks with effective solutions, keeping projects moving efficiently. Can breakdown complex projects into manageable phased deliverables. Must be able to communicate concisely and effectively. Extra Points Experience in game development or game publishing environments. Familiarity with working as part of and alongside software engineering teams. Formal project management qualifications or accreditation. Familiarity with data protection laws and regulatory requirements a plus. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Job Title Technical UI Designer Requisition ID R018442 Job Description Located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Melbourne, Australia, Toronto, Canada and Guildford, UK – Sledgehammer Games is the video game development team behind Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare 3, Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare and Call of Duty®: WWII. You will implement and support various workflows that enable our Artists and Technical Artists to author and produce high quality, world-class content. We’re looking for awesome developers to grow our team. We want to hear from you! Improve how content developers search for and filter content for use in game more effectively – allowing for them to find the highest quality and fit-for-purpose assets they require. Provide user tools around our content library to help artists make higher quality choices when adding assets to our levels. Improve and maintain core libraries, modules, and API’s the Tech Art team uses – primarily supporting Python development across many of our internal tools and DCC applications. Implement data gathering solutions to help inform quality decision making around efficient content sharing and the size of the installed game. Strong ability to provide and support creative solutions for content developers in different areas of the content pipeline. Proficiency in Python, C++, C#, or equivalent. Job Title Tools Engineer OPEN TO REMOTE Requisition ID R018055 Job Description About us  This is an exceptionally exciting time to be at Activision, a period of phenomenal change and ambition throughout the organization! Activision Central Tech (or "CT") is a global, multi-disciplinary team dedicated to supporting the technological needs of our games. We work alongside Activision studios around the world to build the most compelling entertainment experiences ever seen.  Your role  Activision is searching for a Tools Engineer to join its CT group based in Vancouver, Canada. This is a full-time permanent position, learning and working in a friendly and inclusive environment alongside some of the best game creators in the world. You will help us craft the next generation of the massively successful Call of Duty® series of games. Responsibilities Include Architect, refactor, optimize, and maintain tools, pipelines, core systems, and infrastructures. Develop new world building features, pipelines, and tools in support of large maps with many players. Improve workflows and iteration times. What does the future hold for game tech? We need you to help us find out! Qualifications  A degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience. Proficient in golang or python programming, problem-solving, debugging etc. 4+ years’ experience working as a golang or python programmer in the game industry or a related field. Skills & Attributes Our ideal candidate for this role would possess the following skills and attributes: Experience working on tools, content pipelines, and core engine systems. Proficient with 3D math including linear algebra, and trigonometry. Experience with a broad range of systems in shipped games. Ability to operate within a large, complex, and constantly evolving C++ codebase. Experience working on multi-platform software projects. Optional These are not firm requirements, but we would be especially interested in talking to anyone with: Qt knowledge and skills. Experience optimizing tools and pipelines. Familiarity with modern real-time rendering APIs and architecture. What we offer  A friendly, international team of game technology experts ready to guide and support you. A healthy work-life balance. We create our best work when our free time is valued and respected. Access to counseling services and mental health support through our wellness programs such as AbleTo and our Employee Assistance Program 20 days paid vacation, holiday gift days and generous paid parental & family leave. Top-tier medical insurance coverage for you and your dependents, plus dental. Pension, extended health cover and life insurance. Comprehensive relocation support Applying We love hearing from anyone who is talented and enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Activision is an equal opportunity employer; we encourage people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, ethnicity, LGBTQ+ individuals, parents, and people with disabilities to all please feel confident in applying. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. Lastly, in your application please feel free to advise which pronouns you use. R018055

Job Title Tools Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R015667 Job Description We are on a mission to dramatically improve tools and workflows for the teams making Call of Duty. All of the tools used by our content creators are created and maintained in house. You will be responsible for adding new features, helping to implement new workflows, and directly working with others to get our games made. We have an interest in new efficient methods of creating content, as well as developing a clean and intuitive user experience. What You’ll Do… Work closely with content teams to develop the features needed within our in-house toolset. Maintain and improve any of a variety of tools, including our asset editor, level editor, animation tools, and more. Work with graphics and engine engineers to implement new workflows for getting content into the engine. Support users and debug issues to keep tools performant and stable. Refining the interfaces to ensure we can meet the standards of a good user experience. To succeed you should have… 2+ years of experience in engineering. Experience working on tools or GUI applications used by multiple users. Proficiency in C++. Familiarity with some of the workflows involved in making content for games. We’d love it if you also have… Experience developing in C++ with Qt. Prior experience working on world or asset editors for a video game engine. A track record of designing workflows with great UX. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R015667

Job Title UI Motion Designer - Infinity Ward Requisition ID R017419 Job Description Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. Infinity Ward employs more than 250 people in Woodland Hills, Calif., just outside of Los Angeles. A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter. Job Title UI/UX Design Internship Requisition ID R017330 Job Description UI/UX Internship Your Platform  At Activision Blizzard we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences, driven by our company values and passion, Activision Blizzard creates worlds with the focus to entertain the universe. Job Title UI/UX Internship - Treyarch Requisition ID R018426 Job Description Are you passionate about using your art and design skills to solve complex problems? Do you love video games? If this sounds like you, Treyarch is looking for passionate UI/UX Interns to take on these challenges in working on one of the largest franchises in gaming with Call of Duty! Join our team in sunny Playa Vista, CA for our summer internship program! As an Art, Design, or UX Intern in our UI/UX department, you will partner with mentors in your chose area of interest who have years of industry experience and work on a variety of projects in a collaborative development setting. You will apply your design sensibilities by communicating complex information across a variety of human-software interactions. On the technical side, you will learn our implementation pipeline through real UI feature assignments. You will hone your artistic skills creating motion graphics, layouts and iconography. This is an excellent opportunity to get an intimate understanding of this exciting industry. What You’ll Do Across UI/UX… Work with a mentor to level up your design skills for the purpose of creating UI elements. Learn implementation best practices bringing your work to life in our game engine Collaborate on the design of new UI features, building intuitive interfaces with aesthetic appeal Develop wireframes, user-flow diagrams, prototypes and concepts for team discussion and testing purposes Script UI interactions and prototype new experiences Attend the daily standup meeting as part of our team of artists and designers. Experience the typical day-to-day tasks and ask questions Create high-quality designs that meet the standard and visual expectations of a AAA title Upon completion of the program, UI/UX interns will have a better understanding of the industry requirements and the experience needed to kick start a career in video games What you’ll do within your chosen UI/UX field of interest… UI Artists will specifically focus on creating iconography, framing elements, typography, layouts, art comps, and implementing assets in engine UI Designers will specifically focus on creating prototypes, UI components or features, and work within our Lua codebase in writing extensible scripts that works in engine UX Designers will specifically focus on creating wireframes, User Flow Diagrams, Lo-fi prototyping, design specs, and work with other team members to translate systems and gameplay goals into UI that enhances the game To succeed you should have… A positive personality and a passion for all aspects of UI and UX Some experience in graphic design, web design, scripting (Lua/C#) or interactive media Strong organization and communication skills Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects and include a shot breakdown specifying what you were directly responsible for creating. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Job Title Vehicle Art Internship - Treyarch Requisition ID R018411 Job Description Job Title: Vehicle Artist Intern Reporting To: Intern Art Director Department: Vehicle Art Location: Playa Vista, CA Treyarch is looking for a talented and passionate Vehicle Art Intern to join our team of Vehicle and Hard Surface Artists next summer. In this role, you will start by learning our proprietary tools and workflows and participate in our daily reviews of vehicle art content. Under the guidance of our team, you will then move on to modelling and texturing a vehicle based on concept art and reference material, finishing up by working with one of our Vehicle Art Specialists to set up and export the vehicle into the game. A successful candidate is an aspiring Artist that absolutely LOVES vehicles, 3D art, and has the talent and skill to match that love, while being a great teammate. What You'll Do... Model and texture of vehicle content for use in game while working from scan data, concept art, and reference photos. Maintain and update assets to a high efficiency standard that fits within a defined budget. Basic rigid skinning using internal tools to set up a vehicle in game. Collaborate with the Vehicle and Hard Surface Artists to meet departmental goals. Receive feedback and modify work based on direction, following schedules and managing time for deliverables. Provide feedback on concept art and vehicle art deliveries from outsourcing. To succeed you should have… An incredible passion for 3D art, vehicles and First-Person Shooters. Experience modelling and texturing realistic 3D models. Be able to work independently, be self-motivated, and not afraid to ask questions. Strong interpersonal skills, being able to communicate effectively with other Artists, Concept Artists, Designers, Art Outsource Coordinators, and peers across other development teams. A drive for learning new tools quickly and effectively. Experience using Maya, Substance Painter, 3DSM, Blender or a 3D art package of your choice (Maya is where we primarily export for vehicles). We’d love it if you also have… Experience creating vehicles, specifically in Maya and Substance Painter. An interest in and knowledge of vehicles, weapons, and equipment. Experience working with real time game engines. Awareness of techniques to use photogrammetry or scan data for the creation of game assets A good understanding of mechanical function and purpose. Note: A portfolio submission is required for this position. Please focus this portfolio on personal contributions to your projects. Job Title VFX Art Specialist - Treyarch Requisition ID R014220 Job Description Treyarch Studios is looking for a passionate VFX Specialist to help us create photo-realistic particle effects for a high-profile action-packed AAA title. This position requires expert-level artistic sensibilities and strong technical skills, where we're looking for someone passionate about making great games, who is an excellent problem-solver, and an effective communicator. If you think that describes you then we'd love to speak with you further! What You’ll Do… Create content at an industry expert level and lead the way for in-game visual and/or technical quality bar. Create photo-real particle systems for game environments and scripted moments, as well as destructible assets, and coinciding particle systems. These may include real-time particle effects for the destruction of buildings, vehicles, natural environments, and everything in between using our proprietary toolset, as well as set dressing for levels with ambient atmospheric effects that produce beautiful photo-realistic game moments. Work closely with art directors/leads, lighting, design, sound, animation, and production to bring levels and features to life. Spearhead high profile innovations and/or technical processes for the department. Help to set quality and efficiency standards within the department, and to identify, assess, and manage art risks on a project and studio level. Create textures and/or meshes to use in particle effects with various 2D and 3D applications. Create detailed documentation and/or presentations to share information with team members. Mentor other artists on best practices and workflows. To succeed you should have… 8+ years of experience in AAA game development with multiple shipped titles. Advanced experience with simulation and VFX software like FumeFX, Houdini, Maya, Max, etc. Advanced compositing knowledge (After Effects, Nuke, Fusion, Photoshop, etc.). Demo reel or website showing previous VFX work. Ability to work collaboratively between different departments as well as independently, and be able to drive initiatives through to completion. Expert eye for timing, weight, realism, color, volume, energy, and other particle aesthetics. Advanced ability to create all required art assets needed for particle effects and level atmospherics. Experienced technical ability within VFX, and strong general skills in understanding multiple disciplines. Able to stay within budgets and understand platform limitations. Strong troubleshooting and interpersonal skills. We’d love it if you also have… Expert modeling and animation experience a plus. Advanced knowledge of Perforce or other version control software. Strong understanding of scripting and programming concepts. Ability to perform rigid body and soft body simulations/animations. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Job Title VFX Artist - High Moon Studios Requisition ID R015635 Job Description Great Games Start with Great People! This is a significant time in our company’s history – and one of the most exciting times to join us! We are building a culture of collaboration and seeking an imaginative, resourceful, and versatile VFX Artist to join our team in Carlsbad, California. As a VFX Artist you will have a track record of delivering high-quality VFX art, possess a deep understanding of real-time, video game VFX content creation, and be willing to jump on any problems that come your way. If you share a passion for developing groundbreaking worlds and player experiences, then this may be the position you’ve been waiting for! What You’ll Be Doing… Collaborate with the VFX Art Lead and other departments to deliver stunning AAA quality visual effects. Use sprite-based particle systems along with pixel and vertex shaders to create a wide variety of real-time special effects. Use traditional visual effects software such as Maya, Max, Photoshop, Houdini, etc. along with proprietary tools to deliver high quality visual effects simulating real world physical elements. Placing and sequencing the behavior of effects in game balancing Design and Art requirements. Read and write script code to sequence effects. Troubleshoot artistic, technical, and performance issues. Collaborate with team members, production and management to ensure that project goals are met. To succeed you must have… Production experience using particle systems and other forms of dynamic simulations. Proficient with Photoshop, Max or Maya. Strong artistic ability as well as good technical knowledge. Ability to communicate and work collaboratively with team members. Awareness of console game budgets and technical constraints. Detail oriented and highly organized. Continuous learner and ability to adapt to change. Passion for video games. 3+ years of Visual Effects experience for games, or equivalent experience in film/television. We’d love it if you also have… Programming experience in any language (C#, Python, HLSL). Traditional animation background. Houdini, or other dynamic and fluid simulation experience. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! We employ more than 170 people in Carlsbad, CA, a seaside city in San Diego County. Our pride is our people and the experiences we have successfully created for our fans. Job Title Video Editor - Artist Requisition ID R018038 Job Description Our world Activision Blizzard, Inc., a member of the S&P 500, is the world’s most successful standalone interactive entertainment company. We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world through franchises including Activisionʹs Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzardʹs World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and Kingʹs Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™. The company is one of the Fortune ʺ100 Best Companies to Work For®ʺ. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, Activision Blizzard has operations throughout the world, and its games are played in 196 countries. More information about Activision Blizzard and its products and services can be found on the company’s website, www.activisionblizzard.com Your mission As an Artist (Video) you will be responsible for crafting industry-leading game trailers and supporting video media content produced by the Marketing Creative department for the Call of Duty franchise. You will share in multiple areas of production from start to finish, including game capture, editorial, post-FX, and finishing, both crafting your own assets and supporting other Artists and Senior Artists. This position reports into the Creative Team Lead (Video). Your Responsibilities Capable of following and conceptualizing on creative briefs for video Production In The Following Areas Build media content and game trailers for our IPs from scratch using a combination of gameplay capture, sound design, and music, This can include short-form social content up to long-form trailers. Work with Leads and ACDs to develop shot lists, storyboards, and outlines as needed. Capable of creative conceptualization with skills in trailer editing techniques, including music editing and sound design at a high-quality. Applying post-effects to footage including camera-shake, transitions, color-correction, or any other supporting software or plugins. Extensive knowledge in post-production workflows, including cutdowns, versioning, video codecs and delivery formats, transcoding, and media management. Occasionally direct and capture gameplay with knowledge of shot composition, blocking, and camera workflows (depth of field, aperture, focus, lenses). Working with and troubleshooting game development builds to manipulate camera tools to achieve cinematic gameplay capture. Work with and support other editors and capture artists in a collaborative environment. Player profile Proficient in editing with Adobe Premiere CC, with supporting knowledge in After Effects, Photoshop, and other relevant editorial software and plugins. Experience in gameplay capture or videography/cinematography a plus. Ability to work within timelines and adapt creatively when scope is adjusted with a solutions-focused demeanor and composure. Passion and understanding of gaming, with a foundational knowledge of the first-person genre. Prioritize asks and multitask effectively when needed during sophisticated project. Good listener and able to give and take creative suggestions. A portfolio or demo reel showcasing editorial work. 4-5+ years of experience in the video gaming industry working on equivalent forms of assets. College degree in the requisite field or equivalent experience preferred. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Thank you for your interest. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet! Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics. About Activision Blizzard Media Activision Blizzard Media is the gateway for brands to the #1 cross-platform gaming company in the western world, with hundreds of millions of players across over 190 countries. Our legendary portfolio includes iconic mobile game franchises such as Candy Crush™, esports opportunities like the Call of Duty® and Overwatch® Leagues, and some of the top PC and console gaming franchises such as World of Warcraft®, Call of Duty®, and StarCraft®. The idea is simple: great game experiences offer great marketing experiences. We have built a new team to introduce innovative, impactful, and rewarding advertising experiences to our huge audience of highly-engaged players. We are looking for new talents to help take our emergent media offering to the next level. We need all sorts of heroes Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. Ready to play? Come join our world and work alongside some of the best and brightest minds in the business. All applications should be made in English. Discover more at https://www.activisionblizzardmedia.com/ R018701

Job Title Weapons Animator Requisition ID R018506 Job Description Your Platform Founded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise. We’re based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We have a unique vision for our industry. One that has and continues to inspire us. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our own mistakes. We treat each other with respect. After nearly 30 years, Raven Software is still thriving. We developed a team who cares about one another, our games and our players. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are growing. Our team is creative, highly intelligent, well-led and equipped to face this exciting future. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. Your Mission As a Weapons Animator you will have a great understanding of real-world weapons and military gadgets with a strong passion for creating both realistic and stylized animations. In this roll you will be working alongside experienced Raven artists and the Motion Capture team to produce content for high profile games. You must be comfortable with all levels of ownership, from the taking of initial concepts through to providing high-level feedback. You must be able to thrive in a challenging environment with an aptitude for critical thinking and analysis, boundless creativity, good visual aesthetic, and with a deep passion for playing videogames. Experience in first-person shooter (FPS) games and extensive knowledge of the Call of Duty games is essential to this role. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Experience in creating high quality key frame and motion capture animations Create world-class First-Person animation for weapons, gadgets, player world interactions Work with engineers to develop gameplay animation system and mechanics Produce pre-visualizations and present concept ideas to the team Assist in troubleshooting Animation and technical issues. Collaborate with team to ensure project goals are met and delivered to the highest levels Work with the Motion Capture team to direct talent to capture the highest levels of performances Expected to give advice and mentor entry level Animators Player Profile Highly skilled in all areas of 3D animation and principals Solid First-Person Animation skills with excellent awareness for timing, weight and composition. Good knowledge and understanding in real world weapons and military warfare. At least 3 years of experience with animation in the video game industry Shipped at least one multi-platform AAA game title Proficient in Maya, Max, and/or Motionbuilder Can quickly learn and master new tools, processes and pipelines Communicate and collaborate effectively with other disciplines and departments Extra Points Strong reel demonstrating excellent examples of keyframe and motion capture animation works. Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. jobTitle: Workday Application Support Analyst (Open to Remote)
jobDescription: Job Title Workday Application Support Analyst (Open to Remote) Requisition ID R011723 Job Description Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB. Your Mission Great Games Start with Great People! This is an exciting time to join us! We are actively seeking a Workday Application Support Analyst, who will be responsible for post-production issue resolution and enhancements of Workday integrations and reports per agreed SLAs. This is a hands-on role. Join the Enterprise Applications HRIT Team, and work closely with Workday Integrations team, HRIS and business partners to identify the best solutions for the business.. Responsibilities Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities Be responsible for management of Workday integration tickets by investigating the issue/request and providing resolution within defined SLAs. Complete RCA, if applicable. Be a technology domain guide and partner with business as well as technology partners to deliver high-quality, scalable and cost-effective solutions that meet business requirements Monitor integration performance and recommend areas of improvement. Lead the technical recovery of Integration outages by collaborating with all stakeholders including third-party partners Develop and maintain technical documentation for new development and integration enhancements Conduct post implementation reviews Maintain a good knowledge of functional domains by staying up-to-date with the latest applicable functional improvements Participate in Workday twice-yearly release reviews and testing by identifying impact and improvement opportunities associated with the new release Follow Activision’s Development Standards and Processes Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree (or equivalent experience) preferred. Workday Certification is preferred 3+ years working in a Workday production support environment supporting Workday integrations preferably between HR, Payroll, Benefits Partners, CRM and CMS using Workday tools Experience with HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Recruiting, Talent Management, Time Tracking, Absence Management, Security Administration Working experience of Workday Studio Development, EIB, RaaS, and Web Services. Good understanding of SOAP, REST, XML and XSLT, Java BIRT experience preferred Knowledge of all phases of system development lifecycle. Experience with integration design and testing concepts and integration frameworks (e.g., middleware, transformation logic) Data conversion concepts and impacts on business processes (such as Workday iLoads or bulk data loading). Excellent written and verbal communication with a focus on documentation, presentation and social skills Strong customer service focus, responsiveness and attention to detail with an ability to effectively navigate a complex and diverse organizational structure, achieving results through influence and collaboration. Highly organized with the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively Experience with ServiceNow and Ms Excel preferred Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. R011723

Job Title World Artist Internship - Treyarch Requisition ID R018401 Job Description Job Title: World Artist Intern Reporting To: World Building Design Director Department: World Building Location: Playa Vista, CA This role is with the World Building branch of our Art Department, where you will be providing guidance and oversight to our map content that is being developed by our outsourcing partners. You will start by learning our proprietary engine to create and set dress map content before moving onto auditing the map content of our outsource partners, providing tasks and feedback to ensure that the content meets our standards and goals. What You’ll Do… Review asset deliveries to assess if they are following our best practices and standards. Collaborate with your Art and Design team counterparts to reach departmental goals. Help guide our OS partners to detail and polish geometry based upon photo reference and concept art. Write documents to direct OS teams and correct any errors found during reviews. Write documentation and examples as needed to convey processes for tool usage and performance topics for both internal and external usage. To succeed you should… Be able to communicate effectively with other World Builders, Artists, Designers, Management, and peers across other development teams. Be proactive in communicating progress and solving problems. Be a team player and look for opportunities to self-motivate and be a positive force for the studio. Have familiarity with one or more 3d level/world creation packages (Maya, Unreal, Unity, Radiant, etc). We’d love it if you also have… Experience working with Outsourcing or Auditing content. Knowledge of level construction methods or experience creating multiplayer levels. Experience with creating assets with considerations to technical limitations such as memory, tri-count, or frame rate. Experience with creating materials with any of the following: Zbrush, Photoshop, Substance, or equivalent. Mod community experience. We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply. Covid-19 Hiring Update: We expect to be back in office for our summer 2023 internship and successful candidates will be expected to relocate and be onsite in Los Angeles for the duration of it. Treyarch will cover relocation services and will provide a living stipend to supplement housing, utility, and office supply costs. About Treyarch Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode. At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do. Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters. These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter. PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/ R018401

Job Title Zombies Gameplay Engineer - Treyarch Requisition ID R015362 Job Description Do you think about how to survive the apocalypse? Do you ponder interesting ways to stop the undead? Are you interested in creating new monster AI, mythical weapons or player abilities? If so, you are a great fit for our Treyarch Zombies’ team! We are looking for talented gameplay engineers to help build the future of COD Zombies. As a Zombies Gameplay Engineer, you will be working closely with our Design team to bring innovative game features to life for millions of fans. What You Can Expect… To be our undead champion, you’ll need to harness your strengths in C/C++ to debug and optimize our Zombie content systems. Help to make our undead hordes more fun by contributing to game designs. Survive Zombie playtest matches with your work team mates in order to provide feedback, tune gameplay and analyze Zombie horde performance. Show new comers the ropes and how to survive in your Zombie world through mentoring of less experienced engineering team mates. To succeed you should have… A strong passion for Zombie game modes and some ideas on how to make survival game modes fun for our fans. A college degree in Computer Science, or equivalent education or experience that enables you to contribute to our C/C++ code systems. Ability to team up with counterparts in our studio in order to collaborate on Treyarch’s next zombie experience. You’re a great fit if your philosophy is to… Commit to doing things the right way, even when it's difficult. Value diversity and differences in others. Ensure discussions include every voice that has something to say. Strive to learn from the knowledge and experiences of those around you.
